notes_H8: The Prime Minister held a news conference on 23 Mar 2020 and asked anyone over age 70 to stay home.   ” I am asking all persons over the age of 70 years old or any person who has an underlying that is not being managed properly to stay at home and minimize contact with the general public,”   https://web.archive.org/web/20201208184715/https://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/covid-19-skerrit-suspends-classes-asks-elderly-and-medically-vulnerable-to-stay-home/    The government website now lists recommendations as well, so I am leaving this as in place from 23 March 2020 onward.   Recommendations:   Keep the elderly home to reduce their risk of getting sick.  To protect the elderly against COVID19, limit visitors, especially those that are sick.  To protect against COVID19 keep elderly in a well ventilated room.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028144106/https://dominica.gov.dm/tips-to-protect-self-family
notes_C1: Fully open under government safety guidance.   https://archive.vn/QR2yu
notes_H7: All citizens are encouraged to get vaccinated.   Vaccines: Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccines, Sinopharm  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329194352/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus  https://archive.vn/KKsmB
notes_C5: I've seen no indication of bus closures; to the contrary, masks are required when riding the bus. Thus, I'm indicating "no measures" but would welcome seeing any reporting to the contrary, as I don't want to code this inaccurately.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201201151147/https://discoverdominica.com/en/island-transportation#:~:text=Dominica%2520has%2520a%2520reliable%2520public,%252410.25%2520according%2520the%2520specific%2520route.

name: Denmark
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020123535/https://coronasmitte.dk/en/entry-into-denmark
notes_H2: The political parties note that the Government will implement the testing strategy in the weeks ahead and will focus on efficient tracking and tracing of outbreaks of the novel coronavirus among close contacts and home isolation of people with COVID-19.  The authorities are currently working on upscaling the capacity for testing for the novel coronavirus to perform more offensive testing in connection with the upcoming controlled reopening of the Danish society. The tests to be performed during the initial testing phase are diagnostic tests, but concurrent efforts will be made to try out and introduce so-called immune tests, which can detect COVID-19 antibodies.  In addition to ensuring the relevant treatment of individuals, the testing scheme is also intended partly to contain the disease by diagnosing individuals for the purpose of self-isolation and by curbing the spread of the disease through early detection and partly to monitor the prevalence of the disease in society.  An offensive testing strategy comprising the testing of both a cohort of healthcare staff and a cohort of the general population, the tracking and tracing of outbreaks of coronavirus and home isolation of people with coronavirus. A representative portion of the population will be tested at regular intervals based on a clear plan.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200521225925/https://politi.dk/en/coronavirus-in-denmark/controlled-reopening-of-denmark
notes_C7: The restrictions imposed in North Jutland were "significantly eased from 19 November 2020", with a few exceptions.     It seems there are no restrictions on internal movement elsewhere in the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201121062734/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_H6: The Danish Ministry of Transport and Housing issued a press release that as of 22 August 2020, all passengers aged 12 or more must wear face masks or shields on all means of public transport, on ferries and in taxis. Customer-facing staff must also wear face masks or shields.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200826184752/https://politi.dk/en/-/media/mediefiler/corona/genaabning/face-masks-or-shields-required-on-all-forms-of-public-transport-from-22-august-2020.pdf?la=en&hash=3438F39C3B8F72E5FA2BE5BC514308FF091C910C
notes_E2: Can't find any current evidence of current debt or contract relief for households. A review of this indicator going back to August shows that it's been consistently recoded using data related to businesses, rather than households or individuals (hence the shift from 2G to 0).
notes_C3: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G. Considering new guidelines from April 1, events do seem to be allowed albeit very restricted (including to people with a corona 'passport'). Since 50 people can now assemble outside and stadium events - like football - can resume, ban no longer in place.     "Organized indoor sports open to children and young people under 18 years of age. The assembly ceiling is raised from 5 to 10 people indoors and from 10 to 50 people outdoors."    "Up to 500 fans can return to the country's football stadiums under an adapted model for the super league scheme."     https://archive.vn/zy9fr    See previous coding note:   From 21st April, The assembly ceiling is raised from 5 to 10 people indoors and from 10 to 50 people outdoors.  https://archive.vn/zy9fr   https://archive.vn/tvbU6
notes_C6: Socialising and activities outside the house are not recommended. Guidance is to reduce seeing people as much as possible.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C8: The Danish authorities revealed that the country will open its borders for Iceland and some Norwegian regions, including Nordland, Trøndelag, Troms and Finnmark. All persons entering Denmark from one of these areas will not be required to self-isolate upon entry and will be allowed to travel without an essential purpose.    Denmark has also announced that the country has lifted all the entry restrictions, which will enter into force from April 21, for the following non-EU and non-Schengen countries :  Australia  New Zealand  Singapore  South Korea  Thailand    See full details of the new travel restrictions - https://archive.vn/Ohthx
notes_C2: "Stores, such as DIY stores and interior design shops, with a size of no more than 5000 m2 - that are not located in a shopping centre - can reopen as of 1 March 2021 with a stricter requirement to ensure minimum distance between customers. Stores above 5000 m2 can open for a limited number of customers with a pre-booking. Shopping centres, shopping arcades and bazaars must continue to stay closed. The same applies to liberal professions who are not able to maintain the distance required to prevent infections, such as hairdressers, massage therapists, tattooists and driving schools. On the island of Bornholm, liberal professions who are not able to maintain distance can reopen with the requirement to wear face mask and present a negative COVID-19-test no older than 72 hours.    Further measures applicable until the end of 5 April 2021 include, but are not limited to, a ban on on-site consumption of food and drinks at restaurants etc. and the requirement that indoor cultural and sports facilities must stay closed. Further, citizens are still encouraged to work from home."     https://archive.is/8n1YM
notes_C4: On a press conference on October 23rd the prime minister announced new restrictions which are implemented from October 26rd. As part of these restrictions you are no longer allowed to be in groups with more than 10 people both in private homes and public places.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201030113153/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_H3: Press briefing by the Danish Health Authority about a man testing positive after returning from a ski trip in Italy. It was announced that contact tracing had begun to control the spread of the virus.    (source: https://www.thelocal.dk/20200227/breaking-denmark-announces-first-coronavirus-case)
notes_E1: The compensation schemes for salary and revenue loss will continue until 31 January.    "The government and a broad majority of the parliamentary parties have just entered into an agreement that extends the aid packages until 31 January. "    There are also measures in place for self-employed and freelancers affected by restrictions.    http://web-old.archive.org/web/20201124093950/https://em.dk/nyhedsarkiv/2020/oktober/covid-19-ny-aftale-udvider-hjaelpepakker-til-dansk-erhvervs-kultur-og-idraetsliv/    https://archive.vn/xmKCO
notes_H8: ***Recoded from 1G to 2G; as there are hygiene programs and some limitations/guidance on visitors to long-term care facilities, this meets the threshold for a 2G ("Narrow restrictions for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly  people at home")      Original coding note:   Compared to previous advice, new guidance 25th November which contains:  Expansion of the National Board of Health's general advice and change in the formulation of the main priorities in the prevention of the spread of infection.  Clarifications regarding sections on the virus' transmission modes and symptoms of COVID-19.  Addition of a section on airways and ventilation.  Sharpened focus on situations where there is no concrete suspicion of infection with a new coronavirus, including a new section on the use of face protection products in common areas in accordance with temporary legal requirements, as well as the use of face protection products in close contact with the citizen in the citizen's home.  Clarifications in relation to the description of visit restrictions, including clarification of resp. The role of the Danish Agency for Patient Safety and the Ministry of Social Affairs and the Interior in this regard.  Addition of sections on resuscitation.  Addition of sections about employees who are at increased risk of a serious course with COVID-19  Clarifications in the section on testing when COVID-19 is not suspected or detected, as well as in the section on organizing testing for detected COVID-19 in the institution.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210115185122/https://www.sst.dk/da/Udgivelser/2020/Vejledning-om-forebyggelse-af-spredning-af-COVID-19-paa-plejecentre-bosteder
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 3T. As of March 29: Following the broad political agreement on reopening, the Danish Agency for Patient Safety has also issued orders to close all schools and leisure facilities in Brøndby, Ishøj, Høje Taastrup and Vallensbæk municipalities due to high infection. The municipalities will at the same time be exempt from the political agreement on the reopening on 6 April 2021, cf. above    Coding remains at 3T due to these closures despite the following reopening:     As of 6 April 2021 further reopening of schools and higher education is accommodated nationwide. However, schools in Ishøj, Brøndby, Høje-Taastrup, Gladsaxe, Vallensbæk, Halsnæs, Helsingør, Fredensborg, Rødovre and Albertslund also remain closed. https://archive.vn/ZB3Xc     Schools and educational institutions which do not open from 6 April - https://archive.vn/7M6L1     Overview of reopening - https://archive.vn/NwXpb
notes_H7: According to the official calendar, up to the current date the Danish Health Authority has determined that the target groups for the vaccination programme should be given priority in the following order:  - Residents in nursing homes, etc. & People aged = 65 years who receive both personal care and practical assistance.  - Personnel in healthcare, elderly care and selected parts of the social sector who are at particular risk of infection or who has been identified as performing a critical function in society.  - Selected persons with conditions and diseases that result in a significantly increased risk of severe illness from COVID-19.  - Selected relatives of persons at significantly increased risk of severe illness from COVID-19 or relatives who are indispensable as carers.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210130122057/https://www.sst.dk/-/media/Udgivelser/2021/Corona/Vaccination/Kalender/Vaccinationskalender-A4-webtilgaengelig.ashx?la=da&hash=5234BB82243B24FD492FDDAC1388CA9A22BC83D6  https://web.archive.org/web/20210130123050/https://www.sst.dk/en/English/Corona-eng/Vaccination-against-COVID-19/Target-groups  https://web.archive.org/web/20210130123058/https://www.sst.dk/-/media/Udgivelser/2021/Corona/Vaccination/Kalender/Specificeret-vaccinationskalender.ashx?la=da&hash=C2818CB774B7C56FCC64981CD7D6B3752EA026AF      The first approved vaccine against COVID-19 is called Comirnaty® and was developed by the German company BioNTech in collaboration with the American company Pfizer. The deliveries of Comirnaty® that we receive to Denmark are produced in factories in Germany and Belgium.   The second vaccine, which is approved for use in the EU and thus Denmark, has been developed by the American company Moderna. COVID-19 vaccine Moderna® is developed on the same technology as Comirnaty®, and is produced in factories in Switzerland and Spain.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210130132848/https://coronasmitte.dk/raad-og-regler/emner/vaccination
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Public transport passengers are required to wear face masks or shields.

name: Dominican Republic
notes_H1: The "National Plan for Orientation" was released 2nd March, to "provide information on the coronavirus and how to prevent it." [https://web.archive.org/web/20200518101326/https://www.resumendesalud.net/60-infectologia/19800-cronologia-del-coronavirus-en-rep-d]
notes_H2: Testing available to:  - People who have been in countries with circulation of the virus in the last 15 days or who have traveled on cruise ships. • People with two or more symptoms associated with the virus. • People who have been in contact with other people infected by the virus.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201116070448/https://www.cnss.gob.do/index.php/noticias/item/853-gobierno-dispone-cierre-operaciones-presenciales-sector-privado-ofrece-servicios-no-esenciales
notes_C7: No policy about movement restrictions found. Nothing was found regarding restrictions on intercity or interprovincial travel.  "Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel?  No"  https://web.archive.org/web/20201009190715/https://do.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Masks are required in all public spaces in the Dominican Republic    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013111157/https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/adbb9cbf-f780-4f58-a8bf-189496d34504
notes_C3: All public events forbidden: "In the same way, following the WHO protocols and the practices in place in different countries, events and concentrations of all kinds are suspended for 15 days.  This includes national and international events, public shows, cultural, artistic, and sporting events, as well as activity in bars and discos, among others."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427180440/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=6627
notes_C6: "Beginning December 31, the government of the Dominican Republic has issued a curfew nationwide.  Failure to follow the curfew, including for U.S. citizens, may result in arrest and/or fines.  Full details on the curfew can be found at https://presidencia.gob.do/            December 31:  Curfew will begin at 7pm.              January 1-10 (M-F):  Curfew from 5pm to 5am, with a grace period for transit until 7pm each day.              January 1-10 (Sa-Sun):  Curfew from 12pm to 5am."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103135354/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Due to the covid variant in the UK, travelers from the UK are required to present a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 72 hours before travel. UK arrivals without a negative PCR certificate will be tested upon arrival and must complete a seven-day quarantine at a government facility at their own expense.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419185149/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/467556/dominican-republic-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-curfew-hours-and-other-measures-through-may-16-update-30
notes_C2: From May 20, some sectors have been authorised to re-open their workplaces. The tourism industry will remain closed.  "Spokespersons for the Ministry of Economy, Planning and Development (MEPyD) indicated that the first phase of the de-escalation, which will come into effect on Wednesday 20, will include almost all economic sectors, except those that by their nature involve crowds of people. This means that from that day on, any type of company -except bars and discos, cinemas, gyms, gambling venues, hotels, shopping centers and restaurants, which only with delivery or take-out services can open to the public, always that they respect the permitted attendance percentages."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200601141424/https://www.diariolibre.com/actualidad/mas-de-600-mil-empleados-vuelven-manana-a-sus-puestos-de-trabajo-en-rd-ID18933830
notes_C4: Group gatherings are to be limited to no more than 10 people in public spaces.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419185149/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/467556/dominican-republic-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-curfew-hours-and-other-measures-through-may-16-update-30
notes_H3: "I also want to invite the entire population to follow the recommendations of experts and health authorities.  This means taking the necessary hygiene measures to prevent the Coronavirus: washing your hands frequently, keeping your distance if you have a cough or sneeze, and seeking medical attention in case of fever or respiratory distress.  Likewise, we must bear in mind that the health authorities will request that people who have been in contact with infected patients also remain isolated, even if they are asymptomatic." http://web.archive.org/web/20201116073439/https://coronavirusrd.gob.do/2020/03/12/gustavo-montalvo-comision-de-alto-nivel-dara-seguimiento-permanente-para-respuesta-a-coronavirus/
notes_E1: Launch the “Stay at Home” program to subsidize 1.5 million Dominican households, identified as poor or vulnerable and that are mainly informal. The program will transfer RD $ 5,000 pesos per month to 811,003 families that currently benefit from “Eating is First”. In addition, coverage will be increased to include 688,997 new homes, during a period of 2 months. The program will also make an additional transfer reaching up to RD $ 7.00 to those households with a member over 60 years of age or with a health precondition that makes them vulnerable to COVID-19. This targeted intervention will involve resources for RD $ 16,981.7 MM.    Create the Employee Solidarity Assistance Fund (FASE), which will transfer RD $ 8,500 per month to formal employees who have been suspended from their work. FASE will impact more than 754,000 families, representing an injection of liquidity to the economy of up to RD $ 15,000 million.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201115135417/https://www.hacienda.gob.do/gobierno-lanza-un-paquete-historico-de-ayuda-economica-para-proteger-a-la-republica-dominicana/
notes_H8: "Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.- The Minister of Public Health, Rafael Sánchez Cárdenas, announced the issuance of Resolution 0018, by virtue of Law 42- 01 General de Salud, which declares this epidemic in the national territory with the aim of controlling the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).    The suspension of economic, social and recreational activities is available from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am every day of the week, with the exception of some," he said.  This document establishes the following provisions:    (...) people over 60 must stay at home and maintain social distancing measures, limit leaving the home, go out only when necessary."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200811192246/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=7826
notes_C1: State of emergency declared on Mar 19 and extended through to April 30th - includes school closures. "Teaching at all educational levels, from basic to university, was suspended until April 13."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200426081828/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/332541/dominican-republic-curfew-and-state-of-emergency-extended-nationwide-through-april-30-update-5; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426081843/https://presidencia.gob.do/noticias/danilo-medina-prorroga-por-un-plazo-de-17-dias-contados-partir-de-manana-el-estado-de  http://web.archive.org/web/20201113160010/https://www.elperiodico.com/es/internacional/20200318/republica-dominicana-estado-emergencia-coronavirus-7894492
notes_H7: A,C  Vaccine: Covishield, Astra Zeneca, Sinovac and Pfizer  Vaccination started in mid-February 2021 with front line health personnel, 60+ year old, first responders and teachers. As of March 30, 910, 869 people had been vaccinated, of which 54,395 had received both doses.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419192123/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C5: "On May 20, some public transportation services, including buses, metro trains, and cable cars will restart with social distancing guidelines and reduced schedules."   http://web.archive.org/web/20200521092913/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  The public transport has been opened to provide transport coverage to workers. Passengers must follow strict sanitary measures. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528033058/https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/video/dominicana-reactivacion-economica-transporte-publico-coronavirus-jessica-hasbun-lkl-perspectivas-mexico/

name: Algeria
notes_H1: Government communication on covid-19 appears to have been forthcoming: https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/mediatheque/videos/pm-djerad-30-03-2020.html
notes_H2: COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Algeria? Yes.  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? No. Not always. Can depend on volume of tests in processing.  Consult with the testing facility.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315232547/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: "All vehicle travel between the 29 provinces listed below as being impacted by a curfew has been prohibited for one week as of July 10: (...) Algiers, where the curfew is from 8pm to 5am.  The other provinces covered by the curfew are:  Boumerdes, Souk Ahras, Tissemsilt, Djelfa, Mascara, Oum El Bouaghi, Batna, Bouira, Relizane, Biskra, Khenchela, M’sila, Chlef, Sidi Bel Abbes, Médéa, Blida, Bordj Bou Arreridj, Tipaza, Ouargla, Bechar, Constantine, Oran, Sétif, Annaba, Bejaia, Adrar, Laghouat, El Oued (...)"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200816105319/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The wearing of facemasks became mandatory on 24 May in all public spaces, including when using public transport, and within private cars and taxis.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200910153722/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_E2: Key Policy Responses as of February 4, 2021    FISCAL  A national socio-economic recovery plan was discussed at a conference on August 18 and 19. Among other things the plan aims to ensure food and pharmaceutical security, promote a favorable business climate, and foster high value added sectors and international trade and FDI. A supplementary finance law (SFL) was enacted on June 4. It includes provisions amounting to 70bn dinars to mitigate the health and economic impacts of the COVID-19 crisis. For the health sector, this includes 3.7bn for medical supplies, 16.5bn for bonus payments to health workers, and 8.9bn for the health sector’s development. For the economic impact, the law includes 20bn for allowances to the unemployed because of COVID, and 11.5bn for transfers to poor households. Overall, in order to adjust to the new low oil price environment, the SFL plans for a reduction in current and capital spending by 5.7 percent (representing 2.2 percent of 2019 GDP) compared to the initial 2020 budget law. In response to the economic impact on household and enterprises of the lockdown measures, the authorities also announced that: (i) the declaration and payments of income taxes for individuals and enterprises have been postponed except for large enterprises; and (ii) contractual deadlines would be relaxed and penalties for companies that experience delays in completing public contracts would be suspended.    I recorded this as a 1(narrow) because it includes only tax exemption and nothing else like utilities    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210215151708/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Public events remain banned.    Archived Web Link: https://archive.vn/v4djv
notes_C6: The government lifted the full lockdown in Blida on 24 April and replaced it with curfew between 14:00 to 07:00. Night time curfews in other provinces to continue.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426141624/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/335791/algeria-authorities-ease-covid-19-restrictions-for-ramadan-april-24-update-12
notes_C8: President Abdelmadjid Tebboune announced in a televised speech on Tuesday, March 17, the closure of all land borders and the suspension of all air and maritime links - except for those transporting goods - to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).    The decision follows the announcement that all travel via air and sea to and from Europe will be suspended from Thursday, March 19. Air Algerie is scheduled to arrange flights for citizens returning from France. The airline will also temporary suspend its flight services to and from Tunis, Cairo, Dubai, Doha, and Amman from March 17. Prime Minister Abdelaziz Djerad had previously announced the suspension of flights to several African destinations including Senegal, Mali, Niger, Mauritania, Cote d'Ivoire, and Burkina Faso from March 19.    Link - http://web.archive.org/web/20200611151823/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/323986/algeria-government-closes-land-borders-and-suspends-air-and-sea-transport-due-to-covid-19-march-17-update-6
notes_C2: In mid-November, the Algerian government imposed mandated 3:00pm daily closures on some businesses, including salons, home goods stores, and commercial centers, in the 32 wilayas, including Algiers.  Restaurants and cafes are also subject to the 3:00pm closure requirement and offer only carry-out or delivery services.  It is expected that the Algerian government will review these restrictions in mid-December.  The lifting of restrictions will be gradual and dependent on the evolution of COVID-19 cases in Algeria.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214081917/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: All gatherings and public events remain banned, of all sizes, including all family gatherings.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315232526/https://www.africanews.com/2021/02/15/mosques-reopen-in-algeria-as-covid-19-restrictions-ease-up//
notes_H3: The government statement says that it aims to -     Strengthen epidemiological surveillance by conducting in-depth investigations, especially about people in contact, in order to break the chain of spread of infection. In this context, the human and material means necessary to implement these investigations will be provided by placing land and air transport at the disposal of the Ministry of Health in order to enable it to intervene quickly and effectively to resolve the problems raised across all states of the country      https://web.archive.org/web/20200707001319/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/ar/premier-ministre/activites/com-29-06-2020-ar2.html
notes_E1: It was decided after consultation with Mr. President of the Republic that eff. June 14, with regard to exceptional paid leave in the economic sector: - The lifting of the measure of exceptional paid leave of 50% of the workforce in the public and private economic sector, for companies that can transport their staff, and meet the health protection conditions specific to their activity.   With regard to exceptional paid leave in public institutions and administrations:  - The lifting of the measure of exceptional leave with pay of 50% of the staff of public institutions and administrations, while maintaining this measure for the benefit of pregnant women and those raising children under 14 years of age.  The measure was therefore lifted partially, and will affect only certain groups hereon.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200709105027/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/premier-ministre/activites/com-13-06-2020-fr.html
notes_H8: "Algeria will ease confinement measures from the first day of the holy month of Ramadan on Friday by shortening a night curfew and lifting a full lockdown for a province near the capital Algiers, the prime minister’s office said on Thursday.    It said the full lockdown in the Blida province south of Algiers will be replaced with a curfew from 2 p.m. to 7 a.m. while a 3 p.m.-7 a.m. curfew in nine provinces, including Algiers, will be shortened to run from 5 p.m. to 7 a.m."    Source: https://archive.vn/rPpZF
notes_C1: Schools are closed due to COVID-19 according to the Global Monitoring of School Closures by UNESCO.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426094354/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: B (Clinically Vulnerable) and C (Elderly groups) receiving the vaccine in the first phase. Group A (Key Workers) added in next phase.   "Some 8,000 health centres have been mobilised to roll out vaccinations, starting with medical workers, the elderly and people with chronic health conditions.From Sunday, security and civil protection personnel, workers in the education sector, religious leaders, politicians and journalists will also start to receive the jab."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315234515/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20210130-algeria-launches-coronavirus-vaccination-campaign
notes_C5: Public and private transportation between the 29 provinces listed below as being impacted by a curfew has been prohibited.  Public transportation (and depending on the province, private transportation) may be suspended on Fridays and Saturdays in the provinces affected by a curfew.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201115073533/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Ecuador
notes_H1: The government launches the official website on all COVID-19 related information. Retrieved from: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409110834/https://coronavirusecuador.com/
notes_H2: Ministry of Health responsible for continuation of issuing required health prevention measures, including PCR tests     https://web.archive.org/web/20210308175157/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C7: A 28-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, Pichincha, Imbabura, Carchi, Tungurahua, Cotopaxi, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, , Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, Santa Elena, Los Rios, Sucumbios and Zamora Chinchipe declared to be effective as of 23rd April. Curfew with complete lockdown.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_H6: The national Emergency Operations Committee (COE) ruled this Monday, April 6, 2020, a new resolution to contain COVID-19 . According to the resolution, each Municipal Decentralized Autonomous Government (GAD) must issue an ordinance of mandatory use of masks to circulate in public spaces.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200915204754/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/mascarilla-obligatoria-espacios-publicos-covid19.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200915204809/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-04/08/c_138956755.htm
notes_E2: The Ministry of Energy and Non-Renewable Natural Resources ordered that all the electricity and water distribution companies in the country not cut service to residential users who have unpaid bills.  /web/20200503195024/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/03/15/nota/7783146/emergencia-sanitaria-no-se-cortaran-servicios-agua-o-electricidad    13-apr. A Law Project has been sent to Congress to forbid evictions but this has not yet been approved  /web/20200503195220/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/04/13/nota/7812147/ley-inquilinato-emergencia-covid-19-arriendos-inquilinos-defensoria
notes_C3: A 30-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, Pichincha and Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, was declared by the President on 1 April. This includes: a curfew for people and vehicles from 8pm to 5am, between 2 and 9 April, the prohibition of alcohol sales and consumption from 6pm onwards from Monday to Thursday and all day Friday, Saturday and Sunday; the prohibition of social and public gatherings; the suspension of mixed online/in-person schooling; restaurants can operate at 30% capacity and shopping centres at 50% capacity; and all public and private sectors to prioritise virtual working.  Power to impose traffic restrictions and controls on social gatherings, as well as the above regulations, is now devolved to local municipalities and to other competent authorities, in conjunction with Ecuador’s National Emergency Operations Committee (COE).  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C6: A 28-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, Pichincha, Imbabura, Carchi, Tungurahua, Cotopaxi, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, , Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, Santa Elena, Los Rios, Sucumbios and Zamora Chinchipe declared to be effective as of 23rd April. Curfew with complete lockdown.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C8: All land borders with Colombia and Peru remain closed until further notice.  Upon arrival, all passengers will be required to sign a health declaration form with their itinerary and local contact details. They must also present a negative Real-Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) qualitative test for COVID-19, or a negative antigen rapid test, taken up to 3 days prior to their arrival in the country.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210412212355/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/entry-requirements
notes_C2: A 28-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, Pichincha, Imbabura, Carchi, Tungurahua, Cotopaxi, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, , Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, Santa Elena, Los Rios, Sucumbios and Zamora Chinchipe declared to be effective as of 23rd April. Curfew with complete lockdown. Only essential sectors open.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C4: A 30-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, Pichincha and Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, was declared by the President on 1 April. This includes: a curfew for people and vehicles from 8pm to 5am, between 2 and 9 April, the prohibition of alcohol sales and consumption from 6pm onwards from Monday to Thursday and all day Friday, Saturday and Sunday; the prohibition of social and public gatherings; the suspension of mixed online/in-person schooling; restaurants can operate at 30% capacity and shopping centres at 50% capacity; and all public and private sectors to prioritise virtual working.  Power to impose traffic restrictions and controls on social gatherings, as well as the above regulations, is now devolved to local municipalities and to other competent authorities, in conjunction with Ecuador’s National Emergency Operations Committee (COE).  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_H3: Governement is struggling to systematically contact trace https://web.archive.org/save/Source:%20https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)30851-5/fulltext
notes_E1: From 1 April, the Government announced the program "Bono de Contigencia", that will support more than 250.000 low-income families. The program consists of two payments of USD 60 each.    https://archive.vn/o38yY
notes_H8: A protocol by the Ecuadorian government to regulate livestock markets in pandemic times includes a prohibition on the entry of vulnerable people "such as the elderly" to animal marketing centers.    As this is a regulation specific to elderly and fulfills the definition for a "policy that affects the elderly in the community setting", it qualifies for H8. Given the very specific restriction, 3G is too aggressive and 2G seems like the closest fit.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210215155051/https://www.gestionderiesgos.gob.ec/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/MAG-Procedimiento-para-comercializaci%C3%B3n-de-animales-de-abasto.pdf
notes_C1: Some schools are returning on a pilot basis.   For example, compliance with biosafety measures were reported in Alberto Guerra Educational Unit in the provice of Tungurahaua, enabling progressive and voluntary return to classroom     https://web.archive.org/web/20210404175932/https://educacion.gob.ec/comunidad-educativa-del-canton-cevallos-muestran-su-satisfaccion-por-el-retorno-a-las-aulas/
notes_H7: A, B, C. Pfizer, Sinovac, Covac,  Halfway through Phase 1 of vaccination programme.   Target Group: 2,000,000 people approximately.  Remaining health personnel.  Remaining older adults.  National Police and Public Force.  Firemen.  Waste collection staff.  Teachers at all levels.  Vulnerable population:   People with disabilities, over 65 years of age.  People with the following catastrophic diseases: Diabetes, Kidney failure, Tuberculosis, chronic respiratory diseases, COPD, Cancer, HIV and people who are on the transplant list.  Personnel from strategic care sectors  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205049/https://www.planvacunarse.ec/
notes_C5: A 28-day state of emergency for the provinces of Azuay, Pichincha, Imbabura, Carchi, Tungurahua, Cotopaxi, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Guayas, Loja, Manabi, , Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, Santa Elena, Los Rios, Sucumbios and Zamora Chinchipe declared to be effective as of 23rd April. Curfew with complete lockdown.     Urban public transport can operate at 50% maximum capacity and inter provincial buses at 75% capacity but only with half of their frequency.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412205807/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus

name: Egypt
notes_H1: The Egyptian government has launched an information campaign 'Stay at Home' to raise awareness about COVID-19 urging citizens to follow the social distancing advice. The Ministry of Health has also established a dedicated COVID-19 hotline to answer any queries from the public.    Source (in Arabic):https://web.archive.org/web/20200528220904/https://news.un.org/ar/story/2020/03/1051932
notes_H2: 20 May 2020     Egypt signalled an expansion of testing for the new coronavirus on Wednesday, announcing that all the country’s 320 general hospitals would offer testing to people showing symptoms of the illness.   https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-egypt/egypt-to-offer-coronavirus-testing-in-all-general-hospitals-idUKKBN22W2UI
notes_C7: Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No    https://web.archive.org/web/20210129191754/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Government of Egypt has announced that commencing Sunday, January 3, 2021, individuals who do not adhere to precautionary measures such as wearing a mask indoors may be subject to an immediate fine or prosecution.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210117105308/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Individual life, medical and car insurance policyholders are given a grace period to meet their financial obligations. Mortage and financial leasing companies are to grant a six month grace period without imposing any delay fines. See Financial Regulatory Authority document, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823154518/http://www.fra.gov.eg/jtags/efsa_en/media/Initiatives.pdf
notes_C3: The Ministry of Awqaf of Egypt is one of the ministries in the Egyptian government and is in charge of religious endowments. The Ministry has decided on the 21st of March to suspend public prayers (including Friday prayers) in all the mosques of the country for two weeks.     Similarly, the Coptic church of Egypt has announced the closure of all churches across the country for a period of two weeks starting from the 21st of March.    (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506223019/https://www.bbc.com/arabic/middleeast-5198811)
notes_C6: Egypt is implementing 14-day quarantine periods and other preventative measures in all cases for people who test positive for COVID-19 while in Egypt. Individuals who do not adhere to precautionary measures such as wearing a mask indoors may be subject to an immediate fine or prosecution.  Large indoor weddings, funerals, festivals, or other mass gatherings are canceled indefinitely. Businesses such as restaurants and cafes must operate 50 percent of capacity or less, with penalties of 4,000 LE to temporary business closures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419080558/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: The Egyptian Government has announced that all passengers travelling to Egypt (including Egyptians) must be in possession of negative PCR test certificate for COVID-19, taken at a maximum of 72 hours before their flight departure time.  However, passengers travelling from Japan, China, Thailand, North America, South America, Canada, London Heathrow, Paris, and Frankfurt will be allowed to provide the test certificate performed at a maximum of  96 hours prior to flight departure, due to the long travel and transit period from these airports.   Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Reuters reported that, on the 19th of March, Egypt said it would shut all cafes, shopping malls, sports clubs and nightclubs from 7 p.m. until 6 a.m. local time every night until March 31. However, the government said supermarkets, pharmacies, bakeries and neighbourhood corner stores were exempt from the closure. It has also moved to cut the number of public sector employees reporting to work in an effort to discourage crowding and slow the spread of the disease.  (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222304/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-egypt/egypt-to-shut-all-cafes-malls-sports-clubs-in-evenings-until-march-31-idUSKBN2163H8)    Furthermore, according to Alarabiya Markets, 10 out of 17 multinational or Egyptian companies listed in the Egyptian Stock Exchange are preparing their staff to transition to work from home. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222422/https://www.alarabiya.net/ar/aswaq/companies/2020/03/16/????-?????????-???????-???????-?????-?????-??????.htm)    Similarly, across the public sector, the government has started to reduce the capacity of staff. For example, the Parliament has asked 50% of its staff to work from home. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222503/https://www.shorouknews.com/news/view.aspx?cdate=16032020&id=ba52ec71-1704-48e1-8ced-eae713ff507f)    "This includes the closure of schools, universities, cafes, and restaurants; a ban against travel, tourist activities, and major sporting events; and reduced work in the public sector, which employs over 5 million Egyptians."  (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222713/https://atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/menasource/the-coronavirus-crisis-highlights-the-unique-challenges-of-north-african-countries/)
notes_C4: The Government of Egypt has canceled all public New Year’s celebrations. All indoor weddings, funerals, festivals, or other mass gatherings are canceled indefinitely.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102074443/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: No information was gathered on this placeholder. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329055352/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fegypt.mohp%2F
notes_E1: Pensions have been increased by 14 percent. Expansion of the targeted cash transfer social programs, Takaful and Karama, are also being extended to reach more families. A targeted support initiative for irregular workers in most severely hit sectors has been announced, which will entail EGP 500 in monthly grants for 3 months to close to 1.6 million beneficiaries.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109105435/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: See C6
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419080009/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: A,B,C: AstraZeneca and Sinopharm both are being administered.  By early March, 2021, the Egyptian government had made vaccines available only to some health workers, as well as limited numbers of older people and people with chronic illnesses and had not provided a clear plan for its rollout. In January, the government created a website that on March 1 began accepting registrations for the vaccine but only from medical professionals, the elderly, and people with immunity-compromising health conditions. On March 4, the health ministry offered the vaccine for the first time to registered people who are not medical professionals    https://web.archive.org/web/20210321165150/https://reliefweb.int/report/egypt/egypt-provide-equitable-covid-19-vaccine-access-enar
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Masks are required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

name: Eritrea
notes_H1: No update. Regular announcements and advice continue to come from the Ministry of Information.
notes_H2: A program of random population testing for Covid was announced on May 16 2020 to "gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country in a comprehensive and more reliable manner". Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115164748/https://shabait.com/2020/05/17/first-phase-of-random-and-extensive-covid-19-testing-launched/     The Ministry of Health noted on October 12 2020 that "targeted testing of quarantined individuals, febrile and other patients with COVID-19 symptoms in all clinics and hospitals throughout the country; as well as Aggressive Contact Tracing continue to constitute the three key pillars of the Preventive Strategy." - source https://web.archive.org/web/20201115163833/https://us.embassyeritrea.org/2020/03/28/covid-19/"    Tests are generally taken at one of the Eritrean government’s 82 testing center and are free-of-charge. All testing samples are sent to Asmara’s Central Lab for evaluation. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115141839/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Restriction on all movement, with a ban on the use of private cars unless by key workers. https://web.archive.org/web/20200605224007/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30407-guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19
notes_H6: According to the Eritrean government, wearing masks is to be strictly observed. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210411220417/https://shabait.com/2020/12/21/guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19-5/
notes_E2: There is no data touching on this from the IMF. Please see: https://archive.ph/gxVRM
notes_C3: All public gatherings, sport and cultural events that assemble a crowd of more than 10 people are prohibited.  Cinemas and night-clubs to remain closed until further notice. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605214149/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30342--ministry-of-health-public-guidelines-no-3
notes_C6: There is no curfew in place, essential shops and services are open, but stringent movement restrictions imply that staying at home is recommended - https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142327/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: All borders are officially closed, as is Asmara international airport. There is no indication of when the airport will re-open. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200915213606/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eritrea/entry-requirements
notes_C2: Eritrea's Ministry of Information has stated that as of this month, people are now able to return to work   https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/
notes_C4: All gatherings of over 10 people are prohibited without a government permit. - https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142327/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: There is some evidence of contact tracing taking place (reported on 9 February) but not clear that this meets the bar for being "comprehensive". Reverting to coding of "Limited" - https://web.archive.org/web/20210314174819/https://shabait.com/
notes_H8: There are no protection measures beyond that of the general population in place for elderly people  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: Eritrea's Ministry of Information has stated that as of this month, people are now able to return to school   see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public Transportation is on reduced service, and private cars are banned from the road without a permit.  see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425113536/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112835/https://shabait.com/2021/04/24/safe-return-to-work/

name: Spain
notes_H1: Following the coronavirus outbreak in China, the Government of Spain has promoted a number of public information channels for gathering all the relevant information from the various ministerial departments. The purpose is to allow anyone interested in this topic to access information from reliable expert sources.  /web/20200430102339/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/lang/en/gobierno/news/paginas/2020/20200131info-coronavirus.aspx
notes_H2: "Early detection of Covid-19 infection will be done by performing a PCR (or any other molecular diagnostic technique considered adequate) to ALL CASES SUSPECTED of infection in the first 24 hours." Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200511201542/https://www.mscbs.gob.es/profesionales/saludPublica/ccayes/alertasActual/nCov-China/documentos/instruccionesPruebasDiagnosticasEmpresas.pdf
notes_C7: The country’s regions are limiting mobility during the upcoming holidays in order to curb the spread of the virus. Nighttime curfews will remain in place, among other measures  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210327050802/https://english.elpais.com/society/2021-03-18/coronavirus-in-spain-all-the-latest-restrictions-ahead-of-easter-week.html
notes_H6: Masks are required for everyone age six or older in enclosed spaces and public areas and on public transport.    https://archive.vn/vYbV5
notes_E2: Economic assistance measures approved which  1) bans electricity, gas and water shutoffs to all households during the coronavirus health crisis  2) Provides rent and housing support, including:   "Suspension of evictions: once the state of emergency has ended, and for the next six months, it is suspended for all those people who are in a vulnerable situation and are pending eviction.  Microcredits: banks will offer tenants microcredits without interest or commissions guaranteed by the state. Who is eligible? People who have lost their jobs, who are under an ERTE, who have had to reduce their working hours and self-employed who cannot make their payments. These microcredits may be repaid in six years and may be extended by another four years.  Extraordinary extension: leases that expire during the next two months after the entry into force of this rule are extended to six months.  Moratorium on payment: when the owner of the housing, physical or legal person, has an investment fund, the tenant may request a moratorium on payment of rent as long as the state of emergency is in effect. On the other hand, tenants may also apply for specific public aid."   ARCHIVED:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185146/https://www.mitma.gob.es/el-ministerio/sala-de-prensa/noticias/mie-01042020-0735  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185152/https://www.shbarcelona.com/blog/en/coronavirus-crisis-how-will-it-affect-rents-in-spain/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185157/https://smartwatermagazine.com/news/smart-water-magazine/spain-bans-water-shutoffs-during-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C3: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), public and private gatherings are limited to six people.  Since gatherings were limited to six people, public events were required to cancel. https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C6: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), there is a curfew in place from 23:00 to 6:00.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C8: Borders have been opened for EU flights only. Screening protocols in place in all airports.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200626011838/https://www.infobae.com/america/mundo/2020/06/21/espana-abre-sus-fronteras-y-apuesta-al-turismo-para-maquillar-su-peor-tragedia-economica-desde-la-guerra-civil/
notes_C2: * The High Court of Justice of the Community of Valencia has ordered the reopening of gambling venues.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210420002702/https://www.lasprovincias.es/economia/tsjcv-aperturas-salones-juego-20210415152110-nt.html  *updated to add additional source because first link was behind a paywall  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425192247/https://www.theolivepress.es/spain-news/2021/04/20/no-big-relaxations-to-covid-restrictions-in-costa-blanca-area-of-spain-ahead-of-may-9-says-valencian-president-ximo-puig/
notes_C4: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), public and private gatherings are limited to six people.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_H3: 24th Feb- first person tests positive in mainland spain. Catalan health authorities have isolated 25 people with whom she came into contact and are carrying out tests to see if they have the virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408121902/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/1000-tourists-tenerife-quarantine-coronavirus-diagnosis-200225115101427.html
notes_E1: The government announced a New Social Agreement that maintains until 30 June the support to furlough/unemployment insurance to the workers of those enterprises who will not be able to get back to work due to force majure.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200511211456/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspxhttps://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspx
notes_H8: 19th March 2020,  Order SND / 265/2020, of March 19, the measures adopted related to residences for the elderly and social-health centers, in the face of the health crisis caused by COVID -19.   This Order of the Ministry of Health includes measures referring to all personnel, health and non-health, who provide their services in residences for the elderly and other socio-health centers, as well as related to the location and isolation of patients with COVID- 19 in such centers, and applicable provisions for cleaning them.    *recoded from a 3 to a 1*  - The ongoing lockdown measures apply to the elderly by default. No evidence of additional measures was found.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210112110602/https://www.imserso.es/imserso_06/mas_informacion/covid19/norm/index.htm
notes_C1: According to this article, it is not even recommended that schools should close:  "the Health Ministry does not believe the rising trend will impact the return to school, which has already happened in some regions, and will begin on Monday in others. When asked about the possibility of closing schools on Thursday, health official María José Sierra replied: “We do not recommend it.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110182152/https://english.elpais.com/society/2021-01-08/coronavirus-cases-in-spain-officially-top-two-million.html
notes_H7: A, C:      The plan's first stage "includes residents and staff in homes for seniors and the disabled, healthcare workers and adults with dependencies who are not in institutions."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108111541/https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-12-29/more-than-350000-doses-of-the-covid-19-vaccine-arrive-in-spain-as-mass-immunization-campaign-begins.html
notes_C5: Spain’s Government to Allow 100% Passenger Occupation on Public & Private Transport from Monday June 8. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611033954/https://www.euroweeklynews.com/2020/06/06/spains-government-to-allow-100-passenger-occupation-on-public-private-transport-from-monday-june-8/

name: Estonia
notes_H1: On March 12th, 2020, the Government called together a special Committee tasked with resolving issues arising from events related to spreading of the coronavirus, public health and the economy. This is the first time an emergency situation has been called out in Estonia after regaining its independence. The committee provides information and updates about the virus: https://www.kriis.ee/en/emergency-situation-estonia
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210403204520/https://www.terviseamet.ee/en/testing-virus
notes_C7: "As of tomorrow, the restriction on freedom of movement will be lifted, people can travel feely between the islands and the mainland Estonia, and from one island to another, regardless of their place of residence. Since the risk of spreading the coronavirus due to movement between the islands and the mainland has decreased considerably, lifting the movement restriction is a proportional response." (http://web.archive.org/web/20200604215302/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/special-notice-tomorrow-movement-restrictions-between-islands-and-mainland-estonia-will-be)
notes_H6: On the 10th of November, the government announced recommendations that would come into place on the 12th of November. These included:  -A requirement to wear a face covering on the nose and mouth in public transport, in the service halls and public areas of commercial enterprises, at conferences, concerts, theatres and cinemas. Carriers/event organisers/ employers are asked to monitor this. Excepts are allowed e.g those with asthma.   -Carriers are asked to put up signs asking passengers to wear face coverings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201114191537/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-announced-new-measures-stop-spread-coronavirus
notes_E2: Grace periods can be applied to corporate loans, mortgage loans, leases, as well as consumer credit agreements. The length of the grace period is up to 12 months for mortgage loans and up to six months for leases and consumer loans. The common regulations for the grant of grace periods arising from the emergency situation will step into force on April 27 and they will be published on the web page of the Estonian Banking Association. https://web.archive.org/web/20200502105248/https://news.err.ee/1082058/banks-agree-on-common-rules-for-grace-periods
notes_C3: The public indoor spaces of all theatres, cinemas, museums, exhibition and conference facilities, children’s playrooms, bowling and pool halls, night clubs, casinos etc must be closed for visitors until April 11.  Religious and church services are prohibited.  Organising outdoor public meetings and public religious services will remain allowed but no more than ten people may participate in them.    https://archive.is/lfaTP
notes_C6: Interpreted from closure of non-essential shops and other restrictions for gatherings.
notes_C8: From 15 to 21 March. a 10-day restriction on the freedom of movement applies on entering Estonia from a country in the European Union, European Economic Area and the Schengen area with an infection rate above 150 persons per 100 000 inhabitants in the past 14 days. Passengers arriving from the United Kingdom are subject to an additional obligation to test for COVID-19 up to 72 hours before their arrival in Estonia, and the result must be negative. The period of restrictions on movement can be shortened if in addition to the first negative test, a second test taken 6 days after arrival is also negative.  However, gradual lifting of the temporary restrictions on non-essential travel into the EU, it is possible to travel to Estonia from Australia, New Zealand, Rwanda, Singapore, South Korea, and Thailand. A 10-day period of restrictions on movement is mandatory for passengers arriving from countries with an infection rate above 16 people per 100 000 inhabitants in the past 14 days.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210403175411/https://vm.ee/en/news/updated-information-about-restrictions-movement-passengers-arriving-estonia-between-15-and-21-0
notes_C2: Starting from March 11, only stores selling essential goods may stay open, meaning grocery stores, pharmacies, stores selling aid equipment and medical devices, the sales points of the representations of telecommunications enterprises, optics stores, pet stores and filling stations.    https://archive.is/lfaTP
notes_C4: The 2+2 rule must be followed in all public spaces, meaning that up to two people can move around together, keeping a distance of two metres from others. The restriction does not apply to a family moving around together, or if what it prescribes cannot be ensured reasonably.    Organising outdoor public meetings and public religious services will remain allowed but no more than ten people may participate in them.    https://archive.is/lfaTP
notes_H3: All people who have been in close contact with the confirmed sick person must remain at home in isolation. This is also the case where exposure to the coronavirus has occurred through the surrounding environment (contaminated surfaces, buildings, etc.).    Due to the maximum incubation period for COVID-19 infectious disease, we ask you to stay at home for 10 days from close contact and monitor your health.     The Health Board recommends that close contacts undergo a test to detect possible asymptomatic illness at the end of the 10-calendar-day quarantine.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316114058/https://kkk.kriis.ee/et/kkk/koroonaviirus-tervis/haigusnahud-nakatumiskahtlus-ja-terviseseisundi-jalgimine
notes_E1: The March wage compensation approved by the Government today is intended only to pay wages to those employees whose workloads or wages have decreased significantly.     Self-employed people will also receive support. The support is paid only to employees who have not been employed in the agreed volume or whose wages have been reduced. The Estonian Unemployment Insurance Fund reimburses the employer for 60 percent of the employee’s previous average wages, but not more than 1,000 euros per month (gross).    https://archive.ph/a7hRf
notes_H8: Visitations are allowed in hospitals, care homes, shelters and safe houses. People staying in general and special care homes are allowed to leave the territory of the care home, provided that they are wearing personal protective equipment if necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210403201327/https://www.kriis.ee/en/restrictions-force-estonia-starting-march-11
notes_C1: Starting from March 11, students in grades 1 to 4 must also start distance learning, and contact learning is not permitted.As an exception, it is still foreseen that in emergency cases, primary school students may continue to spend time in school buildings and participate in activities organised there.The Government strongly recommends not taking children to kindergarten or child care if there isn’t an urgent need.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210403155346/https://valitsus.ee/en/news/strict-restrictions-are-force-all-over-estonia-march-11
notes_H7: A,B,C:  AstraZeneca, Pfizer, Moderna  On 27 December, the process of vaccination against COVID-19 was launched in Estonia with the vaccination of healthcare workers. The vaccination process has been launched for those individuals who are over seventy years of age and who are included in a risk group based on their diagnosis.   In the week of 15 February, vaccination centres commenced the vaccination of the employees of educational institutions.  On 16 February, vaccination commenced against COVID-19 for frontline workers who are responsible for ensuring internal security    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208230159/https://www.vaktsineeri.ee/en/covid19

name: Ethiopia
notes_H1: From the ministry of health and Ethiopian Public Health Institute. For example, see: http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.facebook.com/ephipage/?ref=nf&hc_ref=ARRual-vb-0bHTsHys3NU-8N4iOccXLMtg1BLfDFVz2GTNcrFJUcdKKzGiDbgiC6Etc
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210408195828/https://www.wmcethiopia.com/ these testes are however relatively expensive for most of the citizen to afford. most test are available in government hospitals testing patients with symptoms and eligible for the test asymptomatic people can get tested in drive through testing facilities, or even in government health care facilities te
notes_C7: Local travel restrictions that were put in place due to unrest in the Ethiopian Tigray region, have been lifted however some clashes still exist, and applying caution is advised. To date, no local restrictions are in place due to COVID 19.   https://archive.fo/wZw4x
notes_H6: Wearing of face masks is mandatory in all public places (except for children under 6 years or those with a relevant provable condition)    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322111639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/coronavirus
notes_E2: No household support provided.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200505235808/https://institute.global/policy/economic-policy-response-covid-19
notes_C3: The following guidance came into effect on October 5, 2020:    "It is recommended, as much as possible, not to hold holidays in a public square involving too many people until the prevalence of the pandemic is stabilized."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121145133/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_C6: No curfew is in place.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201109160856/https://et.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: http://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/entry-requirements
notes_C2: It was noted on 18 June that nightclub and entertainments outlets must remain closed. Per guidance issued on October 5th, the hospitality industry (cafes, bars, restaurants and coffee shops) may offer service to up to 3 people per table, with social distancing, mask wearing, provision of ventilation and PPE, disinfection procedures. Nightclubs may operate with limited capacity and social distancing and other measures. Sports tournaments are permitted, but without spectators. Cinemas, thaters and art gallers are permitted to open with mandated cleaning protocols, provision of PPE, reduced capacity. Details are contained in Part 8, "Cautionary Measures To Be Complied with By Recreations, Hospitality Services, and Sport Tournaments" of Directive No 30/2020, "A DIRECTIVE ISSUED FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC" issued on October 05, 2020 by the Ethiopian Public Health Institute. https://web.archive.org/web/20201016015706/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_C4: No Policy Change. http://web.archive.org/web/20210215001037/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_H3: On 5th March, the EPHI has announced, only 1326 contacts were identified for 5714 new cases .  https://archive.vn/aJV1C
notes_H8: There is no specific directive or policy adopted by the government and health minister for the elderly  except vaccination priorities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210408202823/https://www.facebook.com/EthiopiaFMoH/photos/a.246374842199993/1784694475034681/
notes_C1: Ethiopia opened schools for 8th graders and 12th graders on oct 26 of 2020 (who were supposed to take national exams mid 2020 or at the end of academic year 2012 in Ethiopian calaender)  on Dec 7th of 2020 schools were open for 5th - 12th grade students   Dec 24th of 2020 there was a get back to school campaign launched by ministry of education in Ethiopia.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210414074745/http://www.moe.gov.et/ViewNews/118
notes_H7: A,B,C: Astrazenica  -The vaccines are available by donation, individuals don't pay for the vaccines however its difficult to label this as government funded.  -key workers and clinically vulnerable groups like front line workers were given priority to the vaccine followed by the elderly.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210408202823/https://www.facebook.com/EthiopiaFMoH/photos/a.246374842199993/1784694475034681/
notes_C5: Public transport providers must comply with relevant coronavirus measures, including reduced passenger loads, mask-wearing and ventilation.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322111639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/coronavirus

name: Finland
notes_H1: Covid Coordination group announced on Feb 27th https://vnk.fi/en/article/-/asset_publisher/hallitus-sai-laajan-katsauksen-koronavirustilanteesta-ja-paatti-lisakoordinaatiosta; dedicated, regular info from government maintained as of 24 April: https://web.archive.org/save/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates
notes_H2: THL recommends coronavirus testing at a low threshold with symptoms. However, they don’t test persons who are asymptomatic, since it does not always provide reliable results. Virus testing currently has a capacity of over 13,000 tests per day.  Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716034706/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases-and-vaccinations/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates/symptoms-and-treatment-coronavirus/coronavirus-tests
notes_C7: Government Q&A:  Is travel within Finland allowed? Travel within Finland is allowed as long as health and safety guidelines relating to coronavirus are observed.  All travel must be avoided when ill. During travel, it is important to observe good hand and respiratory hygiene. It is important to avoid unnecessary physical contact Tourism businesses must pay particular attention to cleaning, preparedness planning and training of staff. https://web.archive.org/web/20200523104305/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions  Old note: Starting from May 29, the Government is encouraging domestic travel. All travel should be avoided when sick, and social distancing should still be practiced.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200523104305/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions
notes_H6: Recoded from 1G to 2T to reflect "As of 13 March 2021, all those aged 12 or over must wear a face mask when using HSL public transport. The only acceptable reason for not wearing a mask is if you are unable to do so for medical reasons." http://web.archive.org/web/20210313204055/https://www.hel.fi/uutiset/en/helsinki/face-masks-mandatory-on-public-transport-from-13-march
notes_E2: Government announced on 5 June a removal of value added tax on PP&E and other goods vital  to fight the pandemic. This will sacrifice around 7 million euros of government revenue over 2020.     http://archive.vn/NWn81
notes_C3: The regional state administrative agencies have made decisions on restrictions to performances, concerts, shows and other public events under the Communicable Diseases Act. The restrictions and recommendations concerning events, gatherings and meetings differ from one region to another depending on the phase of the epidemic. For regions in the Community transmission phase of the epidemic, the number of participants at public events may be limited to 10 persons or, if necessary, events may be prohibited altogether.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210220002438/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions     Epidemic situation classified by region - https://archive.st/archive/2021/2/thl.fi/b85n/thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases-and-vaccinations/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates/situation-update-on-coronavirus/the-covid-19-epidemic-regional-situation-recommendations-and-restrictions.html    In Helsinki, all indoor and outdoor public events and general meetings are prohibited for a limited period of time until 28th February 2021.  https://archive.st/archive/2021/2/www.hel.fi/ie4w/www.hel.fi/helsinki/korona-fi/koronaneuvonta/voimassa-olevat-suositukset-ja-rajoitukset.html
notes_C6: No policy change, but I would code this as 1 because working from home is recommended.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221180827/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions
notes_C8: Statutory restrictions on border traffic will be lifted in cross-border traffic across the Schengen internal borders by allowing employment or commission-related commuting and other essential traffic.  For the time being, recreational travel abroad is not recommended    https://web.archive.org/web/20200514124101/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions
notes_C2: In general, working from home is recommended and workplaces remain open. In Helsinki, public spaces have been closed, which means the closure of some sectors, including all urban indoor sports facilities, cultural centers, museums, youth facilities and the zoo. This measure is in place from 30 Nov 2020 until 31 Jan 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210108142952/https://www.hel.fi/helsinki/korona-fi/koronaneuvonta/voimassa-olevat-suositukset-ja-rajoitukset
notes_C4: There is no policy for private events, but several regional authorities recommend that people adhere to the regional guidelines for (public) indoor gatherings in private as well. I have therefore coded this as 4, since at the regional level, indoor gatherings are restricted to max 10 people (see also the note under C3).     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221180827/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions    The regional authority for Helsinki for instance recommends:     "It is recommended that no private events be held. A private gathering also means family events. An exception to the recommendation is small-scale (up to 10 people) commemorative events that can be organized."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221185524/https://www.hus.fi/ajankohtaista/koronavirus-covid-19/alueellinen-koronavirusepidemiatilanne-ja-suositukset
notes_H3: 28th Feb Contact tracing “Officials said they will contact such persons individually who may have been exposed” from new case.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408214223/https://yle.fi/uutiset/osasto/news/new_coronavirus_infection_confirmed_in_helsinki/11234516
notes_E1: From March 16, the government has removed waiting periods and abolished some conditionalities on the duration of employment etc. to make unemployment benefits more accessible for people who have lost their jobs due to the pandemic. 'The five-day waiting period has been abolished starting 16 March. Unemployment benefits will be available from the first day of unemployment. The normal five-day waiting period will be applied again as of 7 July 2020.' 'The work requirement for qualifying for unemployment allowance has been reduced temporarily (.. ) The change will be effective until 6 July 2020.'     The Finnish benefits system is complicated, so it's not possible to clearly define whether income support is set at above or below 50% of normal earnings. There are multiple different types of benefits a person can receive depending on factors such as employment history and union membership. The amount of the base unemployment benefit provided by KELA is means-tested; increases to the base amount will be granted depending on conditions such as the number of children and the availability of other sources of income. Many people who lost their jobs will also be union members who receive earnings-related benefit that are calculated on the basis of duration of employment; in many cases this will be larger than the base amount.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200523110355/https://www.kela.fi/web/en/unemployment-benefit-corona
notes_H8: Following Midsummer 2020 (24. June), the blanket ban on visitors (except to meet seriously ill residents), was replaced by a policy that remains in place as of Jan 2021: • 1-3 visitors at a time, agreed in advance • Asymptomatic, good hygiene, safe distance 1-2 m, wear masks • Limited access in/to facilities • Personnel to advise visitors  As strict guidelines for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly people at home remain in place (only by advance "booking" etc.), 2G is closest fit (see previous note for more information).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210111235456/https://unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/pau/age/Policy-Seminar/Pia-Pulkkinen-Policy-Seminar-on-Ageing.pdf
notes_C1: In Helsinki, institutions of upper secondary education (upper secondary schools and vocational schools) will move to distance learning. The needs for necessary contact teaching will still be secured. Contact teaching will be offered, among other groups, to disabled students receiving special needs education and to students who need individual support for any reason. Distance learning will begin at the start of the new evaluation period on 3 December 2020 and continue until 31 December 2020.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175327/https://www.hel.fi/helsinki/coronavirus-en/childhood-and    In the rest of the country, schools remain open but with social distancing measures in place.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175732/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/questions-and-answers
notes_H7: ***Recoded from 2G to 3G based on this source, which shows A, B, and C groups being vaccinated as of March 2021: https://web.archive.org/web/20210313181658/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases-and-vaccinations/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates/transmission-and-protection-coronavirus/vaccines-and-coronavirus/vaccination-order-and-at-risk-groups-for-covid-19    Previous coding notes for March 5 & 12:   Group A and C   Pfizer, Moderna     Situation throughout the country:  - Up-to-date vaccination coverage: first dose 8.4%, second dose 1.5%  - Vaccinated subjects included in the coverage calculations: First dose 469,407, second dose 84,602  - Total doses of coronary vaccine administered: First dose 470,481, second dose 84,706    https://archive.vn/yZbSx     Situation throughout the country  Up-to-date vaccination coverage: first dose 10.1%, second dose 1.5%  Vaccinated subjects included in the coverage calculations: First dose 563651, second dose 85536  Total doses of coronary vaccine administered: First dose 565463, second dose 85826  https://archive.ph/dAUmE#selection-169.0-203.83

name: Fiji
