notes_C7: On February 25, the Council of Ministers announced restrictions on inter-provincial travel until further notice.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314204822/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: In the Iraqi Kurdistan Region (IKR), Decree #57 (December 24, 2020) imposes a 20,000 to 50,000 Iraqi dinar fine (approximately $17 to $42) on individuals who do not wear masks in public and on public transportation. The decree also obligates public and private sector institutions to require employees to wear masks and requires masks of passengers in vehicles.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210330004013/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: https://web.archive.org/web/20200525200132/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    Key Policy Responses as of May 21, 2020    FISCAL  To support the Ministry of Health's efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, the Central Bank of Iraq has established a fund to collect donations from financial institutions with initial donations of $20 million from the CBI itself and $5 million from the Trade Bank of Iraq. The authorities have reduced spending in non-essential areas and have safeguarded budgetary allocations to the Ministry of Health. The Supreme Committee for Health and National Safety is introducing a cash transfer scheme, targeting workers in the private sector that do not receive salaries or benefits from the government. Each eligible individual is expected to receive 30,000 dinars each month, with an expected cost of around 600 billion dinars over 2 months.    MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank has announced a moratorium on interest and principal payments by small and medium-sized enterprises through its directed lending initiative (the “one trillion ID” initiative), and encouraged banks to extend maturities of all loans as they deem appropriate. The Central Bank also encouraged the use of electronic payments to contain the transmission of the virus, and instructed vendors to eliminate commissions on such payments for the next six months.    EXCHANGE RATE AND BALANCE OF PAYMENTS  No measures.
notes_C3: Wedding halls, funeral homes, and mosques will be closed until further notice.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181239/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Starting February 18, the Government of Iraq of will impose full curfew on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  A partial curfew from 8PM to 5AM will take place on Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Iraqi security forces, ministry of health staff, service departments, bakeries, grocery stores, and pharmacies are exempted from the full curfew.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181239/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: The January 14, 2021 international travel restrictions imposed by the Government of Iraq were lifted as of March 10, 2021.  U.S. citizens may face complications with regional travel and should work closely with airlines when planning travel.    Entry and Exit Requirements  Are U.S. citizens permitted to enter? Yes.  As of March 10, previous travel restrictions for travelers from the U.S. have been lifted.  There is currently a ban on tourist travel to Iraq. S. may enter Iraq with a negative PCR test and a valid visa.  Airports throughout Iraq are open. Travelers should be aware that flight suspensions may be implemented at any time and on short notice.  Is a negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) required for entry? Yes.  The PCR and/or serology results must be completed less than 72 hours prior to departure for Iraq.  Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry? Yes.  Quarantine Information: Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314204822/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Starting 29th of March    -Government departments are permitted to resume working, with 50% general staffing and 25% for pregnant employees and those caring for children under 6 years of age.    -Restaurants, hotels, bars, sports facilities, and night clubs must close by midnight    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330004013/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Ban the conduct of public funeral services and mourning rites, and impose a fine of 5 million Iraqi dinars for any violation of these rules  Order the closure of all mosques and other places of worship until further notice  Ban wedding ceremonies at event halls from 18/2/2021 until further notice, and impose a fine of 5 million Iraqi dinars for any violation  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314203737/https://gds.gov.iq/covid-19-iraqi-government-imposes-nationwide-curfew-other-restrictions/
notes_H3: No evidence of contact tracing.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210330004013/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E1: The Supreme Committee for Health and National Safety introduced a cash transfer scheme, targeting the families of workers in the private sector that do not receive salaries or benefits from the government. Each eligible individual received 30,000 Iraqi dinars ($25), with the scheme costing around 300 billion Iraqi dinars ($254 million) in total.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330043412/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: No specific measures.
notes_C1: "Except for medical school seniors, all in-person class at schools, colleagues, private and public universities, and other educational institutions will be conducted online until further notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330004013/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Iraq began coronavirus vaccinations on Tuesday, inoculating medical staff hours after a military plane brought in 50,000 Sinopharm jabs donated by China. Aside from health workers, security forces and the elderly will be first to receive the free-of-charge vaccine, his ministry said on a citizens’ registration platform     https://web.archive.org/web/20210330022659/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1818796/middle-east
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330004013/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Iceland
notes_H1: Targeted Public information for Travellers  (https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.landlaeknir.is/english/news/detail/item38811/information-for-travelers)  About novel coronavirus, now called COVID-19:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028151628/https://www.landlaeknir.is/um-embaettid/greinar/grein/item38798/corona-virus-china-2019
notes_H2: the report on Mar 13 says that "Those numbers include the first results of the voluntary tests on people with no symptoms, which started last Friday." https://web.archive.org/web/20200412153448/https://www.buzzfeed.com/albertonardelli/coronavirus-testing-iceland
notes_H6: No change.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210330102259/https://www.covid.is/categories/effective-restrictions-on-gatherings
notes_E2: Tax reliefs already implemented early on during the crisis, especially for the tourism sector but other sectors could postpone their tax payments as well or had them reduced.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504134335/https://www.government.is/news/article/2020/03/10/-Economic-response-to-COVID-19-/
notes_C3: Sports, cultural events and religious organizations have an increased number of people allowed and 100 can attend funerals. This is subject to social distancing and hygiene measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210418013117/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/iceland-s-response
notes_C8: The authorities will be authorized to ban unnecessary travel from countries identified as risk zones by the Chief Epidemiologist (14-day notification rate exceeding 1,000 cases per 100,000 population).      Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425145321/https://www.government.is/news/article/2021/04/20/COVID-19-Temporary-introduction-of-stricter-border-measures-/
notes_C2: Nightclubs and bars are closed.  Arcades and gambling machines are closed.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330102259/https://www.covid.is/categories/effective-restrictions-on-gatherings
notes_C4: Public gathering restrictions have increased from 10 to 20 persons. "In stores, sports, cultural events and religious organizations have an increased number of people allowed and 100 can attend funerals. Restaurants and pubs are open until 21 but all guests are registered. Swimming pools are open for half of the permitted number".        https://web.archive.org/web/20210418013117/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/iceland-s-response
notes_H3: not sure about the start date, but it should be after the first case (Feb 28) and before the report (MAR 9th)   ““From the beginning, Icelandic authorities have taken important steps for effective detection of infections. Therefore, we have been able to identify a high number of infected individuals,” Þórólfur Guðnason, Chief Epidemiologist says. “The National Police has contacted all Icelanders who have returned from high-risk areas and those who may have been in contact with them to reiterate requirements for quarantine."  https://www.government.is/news/article/?NewsId=422e5545-5e45-11ea-9455-005056bc530c  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.government.is/news/article/?NewsId=422e5545-5e45-11ea-9455-005056bc530c
notes_E1: No change: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 *but no suggestion of informal workers being entitled to income support, as is coded above but without evidence
notes_H8: On April 22nd the Directorate of Health announced that from May 4th the ban on visits to nursing homes and long-term care facilities will start to be lifted gradually, but there will remain restrictions with regard to the number of visitors at each time. The lifting of the ban has to follow strict guidelines from the Chief Epidemiologist, administered by managers and staff on site and adapted to local circumstances and implemented in co-operation with families and relatives.    Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201213175034/https://www.ruv.is/frett/2020/04/16/einn-i-einu-i-heimsokn-a-hjukrunarheimili-4-mai  http://web.archive.org/web/20201213175101/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/iceland/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.4+Monitoring+and+surveillance&Type=Section
notes_C1: Schools are open but restrictions such as 1m distance is required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210418013117/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/iceland-s-response
notes_H7: - Some Key workers already vaccinated.  - Some Individuals with at risk diseases already vaccinated.  - Age 80-89 years, Age 70-79 years already vaccinated.  - Currently vaccinating more groups.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425152043/https://www.covid.is/vaccination-calendar
notes_C5: http://web.archive.org/web/20210330102259/https://www.covid.is/categories/effective-restrictions-on-gatherings

name: Israel
notes_H1: The coronavirus was communicated by the government and media since late January, but official awareness campaign by ads was launched on Feb 9: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=19IGaFdDvt4
notes_H2: When in doubt, there is no doubt, get tested!  Starting Today, Anyone Can Be Tested, and if You Have the Slightest Doubt – Don’t Hesitate, Get Tested   Anyone wishing to be tested for coronavirus may do so     In the Home Front Command's testing sites (whether "Test and Drive" or the pedestrian site) – no referral is needed. Call *3101 to schedule an appointment    In the HMO clinics – using a referral that can be provided through your insuring HMO's customer service center (you do not need a physician appointment)   If you feel well (no symptoms), if you do not know that you came in contact with a confirmed patient and if you did not return from a red destination – you do not need to self-isolate until receiving your test results.    Anyone tested due to any reason that requires self-isolation is required to self-isolate. In case of isolation, due to arrival from abroad or due to contact with a confirmed patient, negative test results do not absolve you from the isolation requirement. You need to complete you required isolation period in full. If your test results return positive, you are required to self-isolate and to follow confirmed patients' guidelines.      Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110055501/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/ramzor-cites-guidelines?chapterIndex=6
notes_C7: On the 1st March, government movement restrictions put in place to control COVID19 during the Purim festival were lifted.  https://www.siasat.com/israel-lifts-night-curfew-2100373/
notes_H6: The Director General of the Ministry of Health, Prof. Hezi Levy, amended the Public Health Order, so that there is no obligation to wear a mask in an open area, starting April 18.      Source: https://archive.vn/HLE5i
notes_E2: ***Recoded from 2 to 1. Evidence seems to draw primarily from businesses rather than households. The whole column should be reviewed.     Limited evidence of policies for household, but no broad or comprehensive policies found.     See previous coding note:     Keeping debtors connected to electricity  If you owe a debt to the Israel Electric Corporation you won’t be disconnected.  Contact the Israel Electric Corporation if you’ve been disconnected or if you have a pre-paid bill counter.    Business continuity  ILS 5.2 billion  Get help paying your fixed expenses, such as rent and utilities - Apply for a grant for businesses for help with fixed expenses during the coronavirus crisis  If you’re a small business owner whose business has been hurt by the coronavirus crisis, you may be eligible for up to ILS 400,000 to cover your fixed expenses.  The grant sum depends on the impact to your business turnover.  The grant will be paid to small businesses with a turnover of up to 20 million, by the Tax Authority.    Postponement of payments to VAT, NII, electricity, water, etc.  ILS 9 billion  VAT, NII, electricity, and water payments have been postponed to provide relief to businesses.  Postponement of electricity bills for small and medium businesses from various sectors on a case-by-case basis.  If your payment hasn’t been postponed, contact the service provider directly.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110054710/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/mof_economic_plan?chapterIndex=6
notes_C3: Events are now allowed under capacity restrictions and organiser guidelines for green pass holders only.      For those without a green pass, events are restricted by the virtue of the restrictions on gatherings (10 people inside, 20 people outside).    Coding as 1 because measures are very much in place - but only those with a green pass can access.  Please see https://archive.vn/4zluu
notes_C6: On the 1st March, government movement restrictions put in place to control COVID19 during the Purim festival were lifted.  https://www.siasat.com/israel-lifts-night-curfew-2100373/
notes_C8: "We decided to close the skies of Israel, and foreigners will not be allowed to enter the country, except in exceptional cases such as diplomats, due to the spread of the new coronavirus mutation,” Gendelman said, adding, “This decision is necessary as we are obligated to preserve your health and your life and it will currently be in effect for 10 days.”    Authorities have also introduced new strict restrictions requiring all citizens returning to Israel starting Wednesday from abroad to quarantine in a “state-run hotel facility,” according to a local media report.    Those returning from the UK, Denmark and South Africa were already required to quarantine from Sunday, news outlet Globes reported.    “All non-Israeli passport holders will henceforth be barred from the country including those with special permits to attend family events, students studying in Israel and business people,” according to the report."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201221144335/https://english.alarabiya.net/en/coronavirus/2020/12/21/New-coronavirus-strain-Israel-suspends-air-travel-bans-entry-of-foreigners
notes_C2: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G to show that while rules and guidelines are in place, no evidence of any sectors remaining closed now that nightclubs are open.     Nightclubs reopened in Israel for first time since March 2020 shutdown as of Sunday, March 21.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210328113620/https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/health-environment/article/3126233/why-israel-partying-its-2019-while-most-asia-stuck
notes_C4: The cabinet approves the Health Ministry regulations for the Third Phase beginning Sunday 7 March. These changes include the lessening of gathering restrictions.     Gatherings are now restricted to up to 20 people indoors and up to 50 people outdoors. If the gathering place includes both indoor and outdoor spaces – up to 20 people.     NB The press release published on 1 March notes "Gathering restrictions: Up to 20 people indoors and up to 50 people outdoors (except in red localities where the ratio will stay at 10:20). " That red localities restriction is not included in the release of 6 March.    Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308185332/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/news/06032021-01    https://archive.vn/Cb3Cq
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20201103133754/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/guides/information-corona?chapterIndex=2
notes_E1: Pay for workers on unpaid leave  ILS 15.4 billion  Claim up to 80% of your last salary  To claim the unpaid leave pay:    Register with the Israel Employment Service - https://www.taasuka.gov.il/he/pages/registertolishka.aspx  Submit a claim to the NII - https://www.btl.gov.il/benefits/Unemployment/Pages/submit.aspx    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110054710/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/mof_economic_plan?chapterIndex=6
notes_H8: "Visits to welfare, nursing or healthcare establishments (where those residents live) are to be avoided, except a single visitor, preferably a direct family member."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210127010322/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/faq/faq-coronavirus
notes_C1: No restrictions - schools, higher education system, trainings and informal education are back to normal.        NB "Frontal learning activities, ceremonies and social functions in establishments of higher learning upon presenting the Green Pass, and online learning for students who do not have a Green Pass." on corona.health.gov.il site.    Source: https://archive.vn/slazX
notes_H7: HMOs are offering the vaccine to all members over 16. The army is vaccinating forces. The percentage of the population vaccinated is now over 47% indicating both availability and delivery. Vaccination is voluntary.    "The majority of the Israeli population will be vaccinated. In the first stage, certain groups, such as children (under 16 years of age) and recovered patients, will not be vaccinated due to a lack of information about vaccination among these populations."    Percentage of vaccinated in the total population: 21/2  	• 47.06% first dose vaccinated  	• 32.29% second dose vaccinated    Who will get the vaccine first?  	• The vaccine is given to individuals who are 16 years of age or older.  	• Pregnant women or women who plan to be pregnant can get the vaccine.   	• People with an acute illness, especially if their body temperature is 38 degrees Celsius or higher, should recover before getting the vaccine.    Who will not get the vaccine at this stage?  	• People who are younger than 16 years of age.  	• People with a history of severe allergic reactions. They are required to tell staff before they are vaccinated and ask if they can have the vaccine.  	• Certified recovered COVID-19 patients.    Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20210224150712if_/https://datadashboard.health.gov.il/COVID-19/general    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223153943/https://govextra.gov.il/ministry-of-health/covid19-vaccine/en-covid19-vaccination-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226115508/https://govextra.gov.il/ministry-of-health/covid19-vaccine/en-covid19-vaccine-faqs/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226113624/https://www.timesofisrael.com/poll-some-25-of-israelis-who-havent-vaccinated-have-no-intention-of-doing-so/
notes_C5: Capacity restrictions lifted on public transport.  Text below from corona.health.gov.il guidelines.    General Guidance   - No restrictions on occupancy   - Wear a mask indoors, practice social distancing and hygiene.   - It is forbidden to board a means of public transportation with body temperature which is 38 degrees Celsius or higher, cough or difficulty breathing (except if caused by a chronic condition)    Private Vehicles   - No restrictions on the number of passengers    Taxis   - No restrictions    City Buses   - No restrictions on occupancy   - It is forbidden to sit or stand in the first row of seats   - Windows open throughout the ride   - You are required to pay for the ride from a distance with your fare ticket, except for older adults, caregivers of blind passengers and passengers on board the armored buses in Judea and Samaria    Inter-City Buses   - No restrictions on occupancy   - It is forbidden to sit or stand in the first row of seats   - Windows are to remain open throughout the ride   - You are required to pay for the ride from a distance with your fare ticket, except for older adults, caregivers of blind passengers and passengers on board the armored buses in Judea and Samaria    School Buses   - No restrictions on occupancy    Railways   - No restrictions on occupancy   - Boarding passes are to be purchased in advance    Driving Lessons  No restrictions on the number of passengers    Additional source: https://archive.vn/LyF5F [Covid-19 Guidance Ramzor Cites Guidelines] does not yet reflect the policy change.

name: Italy
notes_H1: "Dichiarazione dello stato di emergenza in conseguenza del rischio sanitario connesso all'insorgenza di patologie derivanti da agenti virali trasmissibili." https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/atto/serie_generale/caricaDettaglioAtto/originario;jsessionid=m-TCzlLUKBrw2D8F4H4Xlg__.ntc-as1-guri2a?atto.dataPubblicazioneGazzetta=2020-02-01&atto.codiceRedazionale=20A00737&elenco30giorni=false
notes_H2: https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/covid-19-testing/  Italy announced on Feb. 26 that it would relax its testing criteria to the point that contacts linked to confirmed cases or recent travelers to outbreak areas would not be tested anymore, unless they show symptoms.
notes_C7: movements across yellow regions are not subject to restrictions but are limited to 1 per day.  across orange and red zones movements are only possible with a proven track record of Covid-immunity (negative test, vaccination completed or fully recovered from past Covid infection)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210430090636/https://www.chietitoday.it/attualita/zona-gialla-riaperture-spostamenti-divieti.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210425153552/https://www.lastampa.it/cronaca/2021/04/25/news/ecco-cosa-si-puo-fare-da-domani-torna-la-zona-gialla-pass-verde-per-muoversi-tra-le-altre-regioni-1.40196916
notes_H6: “People in Lombardy, the region at the epicentre of Italy's coronavirus pandemic, must now cover their face in public as part of the latest regional quarantine measures.  A decree signed, on April 4, stated that anyone leaving their own home must wear a face mask or, if they do not have one, cover their nose and mouth with a scarf.”    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200829194625/https://www.thelocal.it/20200428/coronavirus-where-should-you-wear-a-face-mask-in-italy
notes_E2: The government of Italy announced relief measures for small and medium enterprises, corporations and households. This is in the form of grants, tax defferals and other liquidity measures  https://web.archive.org/web/20200611215602/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: public events such as fairs are forbidden in Orange and Red Zones  In Yellow zones, from 26th of April, some events are now possible in closed spaces, only with assigned seats, and for 50% of the assigned capacity and with a max of 500 participants in closed spaces and 1000 in open air  Local fairs are still forbidden even in Yellow zones until June 15th  https://web.archive.org/web/20210430054127/https://www.governo.it/it/articolo/domande-frequenti-sulle-misure-adottate-dal-governo/15638
notes_C6: The new ministerial decree - Dpcm signed on November 3 by the Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, which went into effect on November 6, states that there are curfews in place for all categories of risk areas (Yellow, Orange, and Red); therefore, updating this indicator to reflect a general status.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201124205413/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioFaqNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=english&id=230
notes_C8: Till 2nd of June 2020 travel abroad (to and from foreign states) is forbidden, except for proven work needs, emergency situations or health reasons. In these cases a quarantine period of 14 days applies. Travelling from and to the Vatican City or the Republic of San Marino to the adjacent regions is allowed.   Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20200523090446/http://www.italia.it/en/useful-info/covid-19-information-and-updates-for-tourists.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200523092158/http://www.viaggiaresicuri.it/approfondimenti-insights/saluteinviaggio
notes_C2: In red zones non essential businesses are still closed (such as gyms, pools and hairdressers and shops selling clothes except those selling clothes for children).  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409052858/http://www.governo.it/it/articolo/domande-frequenti-sulle-misure-adottate-dal-governo/15638
notes_C4: eating and drinking at the table is allowed for a maximum of 4 people per table, unless they all live together.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201028122734/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioFaqNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=english&id=230
notes_H3: Reports about the first 2 tourists to test positive in Rome describe a comprehensive attempt at contact tracing and isolation. "Health surveillance has already been activated - explain from the Lazio Region -, at the moment people are all asymptomatic and do not cause concern" -   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.corriere.it/cronache/20_gennaio_31/virus-primi-due-casi-italia-due-cinesi-marito-moglie-italia-dieci-giorni-e365df1c-43b3-11ea-bdc8-faf1f56f19b7.shtml
notes_E1: https://www.thelocal.it/20200318/coronavirus-the-financial-help-available-in-italy-and-how-to-apply;http://www.governo.it/it/curaitalia
notes_H8: Vaccines started to be administered to elderly (over 80-years-old) in some regions  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207094724/https://roma.repubblica.it/cronaca/2021/02/07/news/vaccini_la_carica_dei_3_601_piano_per_evitare_gli_sprechi_e_dal_15_apre_anche_la_nuvola-286380038/
notes_C1: Some school levels remain closed across Italy in red zones.  In orange zones, all levels are open but high schools can have in presence learning for 50%-max 75% of the students. Universities can determine whether to host lessons in presence or via distance learning.  In red zones, 7th and 8th grade for primary schools and all high school levels must remain closed.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210407074141/https://www.adnkronos.com/riapertura-scuole-oggi-in-classe-2-studenti-su-3_75LJGgLJS8VIdN8VQxVVhR  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409052858/http://www.governo.it/it/articolo/domande-frequenti-sulle-misure-adottate-dal-governo/15638
notes_H7: Now fragile groups are being vaccinated everywhere:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210420130444/https://www.leggioggi.it/2021/04/16/vaccini-persone-fragili-novita/
notes_C5: It is strongly recommended to refrain from travelling by public or private means of transport, with the exception of work, study and health related reasons, any urgent matters, or when carrying out activities or using services that are still available.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028122734/http://www.salute.gov.it/portale/nuovocoronavirus/dettaglioFaqNuovoCoronavirus.jsp?lingua=english&id=230

name: Jamaica
notes_H1: "Minister of Health and Wellness, Dr. the Hon. Christopher Tufton, says a Ministry-led national public education campaign is under way to heighten citizens’ awareness about the novel coronavirus.  Addressing journalists at a media briefing at the Ministry’s offices in New Kingston on February 5, Dr. Tufton said newspaper advertisements have commenced, and there are social media postings on his personal page as well as those of the Ministry and Regional Health Authorities.  “I understand we will hear some radio ads coming out soon,” the Minister added.  “We would have done a series of interviews… myself [and] the various medical team members. I get a call almost every day for a comment… and I try to respond because I know it’s important." https://web.archive.org/web/20200416163126/https://jis.gov.jm/public-education-campaign-to-heighten-awareness-about-coronavirus/
notes_H2: Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Jamaica? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  U.S. Citizens can obtain a COVID-19 test in Jamaica at the following locations: https://www.visitjamaica.com/travelauthorization/testing-labs. Travelers are responsible for costs of testing. Cost of tests range from $60.00 to $100.00 for antigen tests and from $150.00 to $230.00 for PCR tests.  Method of result delivery to the traveler varies by location.  /web/20210216003154/https://jm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-jamaica/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes   /web/20210216003154/https://jm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-jamaica/
notes_H6: On April 20th, during a virtual press conference in Jamaica House, in Kingston, Prime Minister, the Most Hon. Andrew Holness said: “The wearing of a mask is now mandatory in all public spaces and that would include all public passenger vehicles". Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200906212950/https://jis.gov.jm/all-jamaicans-must-wear-a-mask-in-public-pm/
notes_E2: No additional debt/contract relief reported   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322103045/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: "Where the law requires the granting of a permit for any event or gathering, no permits will be issued within the next 14 days, so that means any event, any entertainment events, any gathering that requires the issuing of a permit, we will instruct the permitting authorities, police, and the municipal councils not to issue any permits. Permits that are already issued will be rescinded, revoked effectively."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200426205459/https://opm.gov.jm/news/government-restricts-public-gatherings-for-the-next-14-days-in-wake-of-second-covid-19-case-in-jamaica-2/
notes_C6: There is an island wide curfew from 8pm to 5am.  /web/20210216001754/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C8: 2. Jamaica’s most recent disaster risk management order, published on August 5th, stated: “All persons arriving in Jamaica are required to undergo a health screening and risk assessment.”  “ A person seeking to enter Jamaica at any time during the period from August 7, 2020, to September 30, 2020, who is ordinarily resident in Jamaica shall, on being permitted to enter Jamaica, be required to remain in quarantine, in isolation from other persons, in accordance with— (a) a home quarantine order; or (b) a Government facility quarantine order, issued to the person by a Medical Officer (Health)”   In the case of a “non-resident visiting Jamaica for business (duration of stay-less than fourteen days)” “the Medical Officer (Health), Medical Officer or public health officer has determined that you require testing for COVID19 and you are to be quarantined until released by the Parish Health Department. If you test negative and will be in country for less than fourteen days, the Parish Health Officer will advise you of your result and your release from quarantine.”  Also, any “non-national visiting Jamaica for tourism and staying in the resilient corridor” is “required to remain in the hotel property stated below within the COVID19 Tourism Resilient Corridor for the duration of your stay. You are required to report symptoms 842 PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS [AUGUST 5, 2020 to the health desk in your hotel or to the health department and based on assessment, you may be required to do a COVID-19 PCR test”.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906095950/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/08/Disaster-Risk-ManagementEnforcement-Measures-No.-11-Amendment-Order.pdf  Also, “from 20 August, visitors from high risk places the USA, Brazil, Mexico and the Dominican Republic will be required to upload a valid Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test result, no more than seven days old. Approval for travel will be subject to the upload of the test result.” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906175955/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/entry-requirements
notes_C2: The main business district, the Corporate Area of Kingston, will be restricted for the purposes of essential activity and residents should only venture out for such purposes  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111143809/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C4: Gatherings of more than 10 people in any public place are not permitted     https://web.archive.org/web/20210410120042/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_H3: Actions the Ministry of Health and Wellness are taking include continuing “contact tracing, testing and quarantine of MOHW workers who are contacts of a confirmed case at the MOHW Head Office.”, and escalating “the identification of cases and contacts, contact tracing, establishment of national quarantine and isolation facilities and installation of equipment and materials for case management.” The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) situation report for Jamaica states 8,064 contacts have been identified and 2,465 close contacts are being followed (contact tracing figures were updated at 18:00 on September 3rd). Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906102239/https://www.paho.org/en/situation-report-covid-19-jamaica
notes_E1: Covid Allocation of Resources for Employees (CARE) program  All grants under CARE:  1. SET CASH - SUPPORTING EMPLOYEES WITH TRANSFER OF CASH  2. BEST CASH - BUSINESS EMPLOYEE SUPPORT & TRANSFER OF CASH  3. COVID-19 GENERAL GRANTS  4. COVID-19 COMPASSIONATE GRANTS  5. COVID-19 PATH GRANTS  6. COVID-19 SMALL BUSINESS GRANTS  7. COVID-19 TOURISM GRANTS  8. COVID-19 STUDENT LOAN RELIEF  9. OTHER COVID-19 SUPPORT PROGRAMMES  The Business Employee Support and Transfer of Cash (BEST Cash):  This will provide temporary cash transfers to registered businesses operating in the hotel, tours, attraction companies, segments of the tourism industry who are licensed with the Jamaica Tourist Board based on the number of workers they keep employed who are under the income tax threshold of $1.5 million. When such businesses file and pay their payroll returns as usual on the 15th of April, May and June, for each employee, with taxable income that is less than 1.5 on whose behalf statutory returns are applied, the Government will transfer funds at a rate of $9,000 per fortnight to that tourism related business, by direct transfer to their bank account, paid monthly. For the months of April, May and June that will equate to $54,000 for each employee they retain whose taxable income is less than $1.5 million    Informal sector - The Government will allocate $1 billion in additional funding to the Ministry of Labour and Social Security to provide Covid Grants to those who are marginally self-employed and informally employed.    The application portal for CARE opened on 9th April, 2020.     Minimum wage in Jamaica is $7000 per week i.e. $28000 p.m. Under this package, the maximum allocation over three months (April, May, June) is $57,000 i.e. $18,000 p.m. Hence, this will be less than 50% of lost income for many workers.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114547/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/04/CARE-Brochure-Ministry-of-Finance-2020.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114621/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/jamaica-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_H8: Persons aged 60 and over are confined to home  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419171048/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C1: Monday 4th Jan sees the start of the new school term, with some 129 schools offering face-to-face teaching and learning, providing they are safe to do so. Though some schools are still recommended to close and delivering virtual learning     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104145320/https://www.loopjamaica.com/content/129-schools-approved-face-face-learning-january-4
notes_H7: A & health officials over 60 years of age       Jamaica will begin administering COVID-19 vaccinations Tuesday to top government officials, including Cabinet members, Parliamentarians and heads of ministries and government agencies who are at least 60 years of age.     The Ministry of Health announced Monday night the group follows healthcare workers, police and members of the military who have already gotten their shots against the virus.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322135947/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/jamaica-begin-mass-vaccinations-top-govt-officials-over-60-years-old    Since Jamaica began its immunization program six days ago, some 15,000 people have been vaccinated.
notes_C5: "It also reminded commuters that passengers will only be carried between 6:00 am and 6:00 pm daily, in keeping with the latest restrictions announced by the Government."  Source: http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/auto-front-page/new-rules-for-public-transportation_192749

name: Jordan
notes_H1: On March 5, abriefing noted that a free hotline number, 111, will be established soon under the title "Ask about Corona" for inquiries about the virus, its symptoms and preliminary diagnosis.    The ministry also organised a media tour of Queen Alia International Airport to view the newly installed thermal detectors and precautionary measures in dealing with arrivals.    The Ministry of Health called on the public to avoid direct contact with any person showing symptoms of respiratory diseases and to maintain personal hygiene.    The Jordan Ministry of Health has established the following hotline numbers for virus-related enquiries: 065004545 and 0778410186.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://jordantimes.com/news/local/health-ministry-bolsters-measures-combat-spread-coronavirus
notes_H2: Testing is available to everyone in Jordan, with a cost of 28JD, across 33 centres.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There is no restriction on travel between cities/regions, but travel is restricted during the curfew hours.   "The daily curfew will now begin at 6 p.m. for businesses and 7 p.m. for individuals and will extend until 6 a.m. the following morning."  "The comprehensive Friday curfews will continue and will now begin at 7 p.m. on Thursday and end at 6 a.m. on Saturday"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329155751/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Government of Jordan continues to implement social distancing regulations and mandatory mask wearing in business establishments, public transportation, and government facilities due to COVID-19.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Unable to find new updates regarding the same.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308145220/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210308150310/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/en/MediaCenter/2660
notes_C3: Starting March 10, the following sectors will be closed until March 31: nightclubs, bars, discos, and counters that serve alcoholic drinks, swimming pools, sports centers, academies, and clubs, oriental baths, equestrian clubs, and public parks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: As of 6th October 2020, there will be a nationwide comprehensive curfew? every Friday at 12:00 a.m. until 12:00 a.m. Sunday. The nightly curfew will remain in effect nationwide from 1 a.m. to 6 a.m., and 12:00 a.m. to 6 a.m. for commercial establishments.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201015100923/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Starting April 11, 2021, flights to and from the United Kingdom resumed following a four-month suspension.    Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 at the airport on arrival will be subject to the?Government of Jordan regulations for quarantine, which includes at least ten days of home isolation.? Individuals who test negative at the airport do not have any mandatory quarantine. A person arriving from a suspected or epidemic country within the last 14-24 days is expected to home quarantine.     Entry requirements are (1) A negative result for COVID-19 from a PCR test taken no more than 72 hours prior to the time of arrival in Jordan.  (2) Take a second PCR test conducted on arrival in Amman with the payment of JD 28?(children under the age of five are exempt).  (3) Have valid health insurance that covers COVID-19 treatment for the entire?period?of their intended visit.     Website archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210419175331/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Starting March 10, the following sectors will be closed until March 31: nightclubs, bars, discos, and counters that serve alcoholic drinks, swimming pools, sports centers, academies, and clubs, oriental baths, equestrian clubs, and public parks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: " Jordan restricts gatherings to 20 people."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200819000926/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: Health experts in the country said the resurgent pandemic illustrated the limits of lockdowns and closed borders without a strong testing and contact-tracing system, especially when dealing with a lengthy pandemic:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201213954/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/nov/04/jordan-suffers-covid-surge-after-early-success-against-virus
notes_E1: "In an attempt to reduce the consequences on the poorest households, the Jordanian government established official prices for different commodities, including bread and vegetables. ... According to Basma Ishaqat, minister of social development, around 350,000 families have received financial and in-kind support since the virus outbreak." https://web.archive.org/web/20200615110849/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/coronavirus-jordan-economy-year-over-for-us
notes_H8: While there are measures to protect the overall population, there are no specific measures which address the needs of the elderly specifically. For example, there are no policy recommendations in relation to a specific age group or no long term care facility policies/recommendations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329201129/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/en/MediaCenter
notes_C1: "Starting March 10, all schools are closed.  Students in all grades, including students in universities, cultural centers, and vocational training institutes, will conduct remote learning until further notice. Nurseries remain open"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Vaccinations paid by the government and available to a broad group. "Any individual on Jordanian soil is eligible to receive the vaccine, and it is free-of-charge"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329210938/https://help.unhcr.org/jordan/en/frequently-asked-questions-unhcr/covid-19-vaccine/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transportation remains operational at 50% capacity and mask wearing is mandatory.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909093411/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200909091639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jordan/coronavirus

name: Japan
notes_H1: Cabinet Office Twitter -- Published informational leaflet on COVID-19 control; free to reprint, reproduce (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413192433/https://twitter.com/kantei_saigai/status/1224589187719946240)
notes_H2: Patients are being identified from doctor reports on suspected patients in accordance with the Infectious Diseases Control Act. A PCR test is conducted if the doctor considers it necessary based on the diagnosis.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210123085826/https://www.mhlw.go.jp/stf/seisakunitsuite/bunya/0000121431_00182.html
notes_C7: Recommendation from Minister in charge of covid response: “We’re extremely alarmed by the situation,” Nishimura said, urging the public to avoid nonessential outings and traveling in and out of the targeted regions, even though there is nothing forcing people to comply." http://web.archive.org/web/20210409112108/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/04/09/national/tokyo-kyoto-okinawa-covid-19-measures/
notes_H6: "People have posited several reasons for Japan's success, including an existing culture of mask-wearing."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181516/https://www.businessinsider.com/how-japan-tackled-coronavirus-without-a-lockdown-2020-5      "Infections among essential workers have also been limited in Japan in comparison to Western countries, which is probably due to avoidance of the three Cs and wearing of masks.  The national state of emergency has been lifted, but heightened awareness of the danger of the three Cs remains and this has helped to curtail any major increase in infections even after the end of the “soft” lockdown."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181501/https://www.nippon.com/en/in-depth/d00592/
notes_E2: ***Recoded from 0 to 2 to reflect new policies located. May exist pre-Jan 22, but this is the farthest back located on the policy. Should be reviewed historically.   htps://archive.vn/9q2Pst    Coding Note:     Found new information, and have to revise coding up to 2.    Support for improvement of household finances: the government provides support for the use of delinquent rent, taxes, utility charges, etc., as well as various benefit systems.    10-day life support: For those who have lost their residence, the government provides necessary support for daily life such as food, clothing, and housing for a certain period of time.    Housing Security Benefits: Rent expenses will be provided for a long-term period of time to those who are financially distressed due to turnover, etc., and who have lost their residence or who are likely to do so, provided that they are seeking employment.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps  PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT
notes_C3: Some events have been cancelled, postponed, or held online.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102183310/https://www.japan.travel/en/coronavirus/
notes_C6: Voluntary restrictions have been loosened again in Tokyo.  https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/09/10/national/tokyo-bars-hours-coronavirus/
notes_C8: "To contain the spread of COVID-19, the Government of Japan will reimplement strict travel regulations barring most foreign entry into Japan effective Monday, December 28. While Japanese citizens and foreign residents with a reentry permit will be generally permitted to reenter the country, these reimplemented restrictions include suspension of short-term travel programs, suspension of quarantine relaxations for certain travelers, imposition of travel deadlines for already-issued visas, and enhanced COVID-19 screening protocols for travelers arriving from specific destinations."      https://web.archive.org/web/20210104182744/https://jp.usembassy.gov/health-alert-december-28-2020/      "From December 28, 2020, until the end of January 2021, entry into Japan from all countries and regions (except for the United Kingdom and Republic of South Africa) under this framework will not be permitted.  The GOJ decided that all foreign nationals who stayed in the United Kingdom (from December 24, 2020) and South Africa (from December 26, 2020) within 14 days prior to submitting the application of landing with this framework will be denied to enter Japan until further notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104183340/https://www.mofa.go.jp/ca/cp/page22e_000925.html      Dec 26, 2020: "The Japanese government has decided to suspend new entries of foreign nationals in an effort to stop the influx of a new coronavirus variant."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226141906mp_/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/20201227_01/
notes_C2: Japan declared a state of emergency from April 25 - May 11 with restrictions in Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, and Hyogo prefectures. Establishments that sell alcohol or offer karaoke will be asked to close or face fines. While closure is technically voluntary, the fact that local leaders in these prefectures requested the measures and the imposition of fines means that in practice there is a requirement to close these sectors.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210426091312/https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/04/23/990133421/japan-declares-3rd-state-of-emergency-3-months-ahead-of-olympics?t=1619428221199
notes_C4: Restrictions for Osaka. Restrictions for Japan to come on Sunday.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210420174222/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/04/19/national/coronavirus-emergency-osaka-tokyo/
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20210406143225/https://www.mhlw.go.jp/stf/covid-19/kenkou-iryousoudan_00006.html
notes_E1: ***Recoded from 1A to 2A based on new information, see below:     Have to revise up because I found new information.    Eligible: workers from small and medium-sized businesses which were closed between April 1, Reiwa 2 (2020) and February 28, Reiwa 3 (2021) because of the novel coronavirus and measures to prevent its spread, so who were unable to receive payment of wages (leave allowance) during this period.    Amount paid:  Of pre-holiday wages 80% (Maximum daily amount 11,000yen)  In addition, as maternal health management measures related to the novel coronavirus infection, a paid leave system is established. This applies to pregnant female workers who are required to take leave under the guidance of a doctor or midwife has been established.    The application period for this is valid from June 15 2020 to May 31 2021.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps    PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT    While the latest information I can find that confirms freelancers are eligible for this support is from May 2020, I also can’t find any information that expressly excludes freelancers in subsequent extensions of this support policy, so coding as A rather than F.  https://archive.vn/WFdtg#selection-773.157-773.179
notes_H8: Same as the general population.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406143225/https://www.mhlw.go.jp/stf/covid-19/kenkou-iryousoudan_00006.html
notes_C1: Some schools are closed because of outbreaks or local govt recommendations, but most schools are open with some measures in place  In most prefectures of Japan, schools have reopened by June 1. However, the situation continues to be monitored on the local level, and municipalities can choose to keep some schools closed or to close them again. Most universities are still conducting research and teaching in an online format to the greatest possible extent. (1.) For example, on June 13,  a local cluster was found in a Kitakyushu school, leading to an announcement that the school will be closed again. (2.)     (1.) https://archive.vn/oUa0v   (2.) https://archive.vn/D8EL1    https://www.mext.go.jp/content/20200603-mxt_kouhou01-000004520_4.pdf (For reviewers and updaters: Web archive services are unavailable in China, please archive this link when you see this)  Education Ministry  98% of the schools in total of all levels have reopened as of 1 June.    Note from 21 Aug: "Many schools across the nation reopened Monday after summer vacations were shortened to allow students to catch up on classes missed when schools closed due to the novel coronavirus pandemic."      https://web.archive.org/web/20200821005509/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/08/17/national/japan-schools-restart-coronavirus/
notes_H7: A: medical personal  Vaccines: Pfizer approved and being used. AstraZeneca under review.  https://archive.vn/iuQV6#selection-2727.0-2743.29    The period of inoculation has started February 17, 3rd year of Reiwa (2021). Initially, vaccinations will be given to medical staff. After that, it is expected that vaccination will proceed in the order of elderly people and those with underlying diseases. The inoculation of elderly people is expected to start after April 1st at the earliest.  https://archive.vn/SqjEL#selection-2283.0-2289.128    Health care workers began to receive vaccination. A total of about 40,000 people from 100 medical institutions nationwide, including the National Hospital Organization , are scheduled to receive it. Of these, 20,000 will be subject to health surveys, and information such as side effects will be collected during this period, which will lead to vaccination of a wide range of residents including the elderly from April.  Priority vaccination of about 3.7 million medical workers following the advance vaccination is scheduled to start in March, but if a sufficient amount is secured for the advance vaccination, it can be advanced at the discretion of the medical institution.  https://archive.vn/Q296C
notes_C5: Scheduled changes to reduce late night crowds on public transportation ended on March 12th.  https://archive.ph/E5ud8    There are no restrictions to public transportation other than hygiene measures.  https://archive.ph/SAyqX    There are extensive measures in place to circulate air regularly and disinfect surfaces, social distancing and to avoid having to touch surfaces like ticket machines.  https://archive.ph/8xcFI

name: Kazakhstan
notes_H1: On March 16 Kazakstan declared the state of emergency, followed by massive information campaign: (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413200152/https://liter.kz/v-kazahstane-vvedeno-chrezvychajnoe-po/)
notes_H2: The government is not testing everyone showing COVID-19 symptoms. The price of the COVID-19 test is still expensive for the general public. The government has promised to reduce the price of the COVID-19 test soon.   Link: https://archive.vn/WKHZu
notes_C7: Uilsky district of Aktobe region entered the "red zone" for the spread of coronavirus. Sanitary posts have been established there.   "Everyone who enters or leaves the district center will have their temperature measured and data recorded. Those who have symptoms of COVID-19 will be isolated for two days in a quarantine hospital for PCR testing.  Link: https://archive.vn/6iATq
notes_H6: Face masks are required at all times in public places.  *******  Quote from archived link:  "Masks Required: The Chief Sanitary Doctor of Kazakhstan has mandated that masks be worn nationwide in public settings, including both indoor and outdoor spaces and on public transportation. Failure to comply with this measure could result in administrative penalty."  _______________________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived Link:  http://archive.today/2021.02.15-161556/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      ******  Quote from archived link:  "Residents must wear protective facemasks and practice social distancing at all times while in public."    _____________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived link:  https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/430916/kazakhstan-as-of-jan-18-authorities-re-add-nur-sultan-to-red-zone-for-covid-19-infections-update-30
notes_E2: No debt and contract relief for a household is provided.  Link: https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_C3: Government cancels all public events, including the Norouz holiday celebrations and a military parade devoted to 75th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200825082025/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-kazakhstan/kazakhstan-suspends-all-public-events-over-coronavirus-idUSKBN20Z0OD https://web.archive.org/web/20201113213642/https://www.rferl.org/a/armenia-puts-restrictions-on-public-and-private-events-amid-spike-in-coronavirus-cases/30492284.html https://archive.vn/wjQVP
notes_C6: Is a curfew in place?  No  Link: https://archive.vn/jxM1W
notes_C8: According to the US embassy, the Kazakhstani border remains closed to foreigners with highly limited exceptions, including citizens of those countries with which Kazakhstan has resumed direct flights (China, South Korea, Japan, Thailand, and Turkey).  http://web.archive.org/web/20200808130057/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: The Nur-Sultan city local administration closed the following workplaces: bowling centres, cinemas, computer clubs, night clubs, entertainment centres for kids, etc.   Link: https://archive.vn/Rp7hE
notes_C4: According to a new decree of Chief Sanitary Doctor from December 25, more than 5 people in a group are not allowed to walk outside.  Link: https://archive.vn/Ywh7y
notes_H3: No manual contact tracing is reported in Kazakhstan. Some cities launching pilot testing of the Ashyq app that allows identifying infected people. However, this is not a manual tracing.  Link: https://archive.vn/uhqGf
notes_E1: Income support was provided during strict lockdown measures in 2020. However, the government has not announced any income support measures in 2021 for those who lost their jobs. Links: https://archive.vn/1e9Dy https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_H8: Previously this indicator was 3T since the Almaty region strictly prohibited elderly people to leave their homes. However, there is no information on the current situation in the region. New measures were announced in Shymkent city where the movement of elderly people was restricted (but not strictly prohibited).   Link: https://archive.vn/szVEF
notes_C1: From January 11, Grades 1-5 will study in a traditional format in duty classes. For Grades 9, 11, 12 - 70% of subjects will be held in a traditional format, 30% - remotely. Other grades will study fully remotely. Links: https://archive.vn/LucfO https://archive.vn/uLQBC
notes_H7: Currently, the government is vaccinating all people on a voluntary basis. There are enough vaccine doses are available across the country.   Link: https://archive.vn/LExtO
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating?  Yes  Link: https://archive.vn/jxM1W

name: Kenya
notes_H1: Public Communications on Covid-19, including posters, on social media from Ministry of Health.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824054005/https://twitter.com/MOH_Kenya/status/1232361147904466949/photo/1
notes_H2: Rapid antigen tests will be used for symptomatic individuals and their immediate household and workplace contacts; health-care workers in high risk areas, rapid response teams, labs and A&E; in outbreaks associated with superspreader events; for prison remandees; and for high risk patients in health facilities.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214155230/https://www.health.go.ke/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Interim_Antigen_Testing_Guide_COVID-19.docx-1.pdf
notes_C7: Travel inside the five county zone is also permitted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210420071518/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_H6: Coding changed as specific mention is made that mask-wearing should be adhered to even in private vehicles.  ________________________________    Quote (1):   "...the following controls are in effect nationwide: All residents must wear protective face coverings in public areas, including in private vehicles and while using public transportation."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425112634/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011887022/kenya-authorities-extend-existing-covid-19-related-restrictions-through-at-least-may-29-update-21  ________________________________    Quote (2):  "Public places and services  The Government of Kenya has directed that face masks must be worn in public places, except when dining, or when adhering to social distancing in hotels, gardens or on beaches."    Link (2): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425110753/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus  ________________________________    Quote (3):  "Individuals using public or private transport are required to wear a protective mask."    "Mandatory wearing of masks in public remains in effect. The government will not provide services to individuals not wearing a mask."    Link (3): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425111524/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Quote (1):  "The government, as part of the FY2019/20 budget (ending June 30, 2020), initially earmarked Ksh40 billion (0.4 percent of GDP) for Covid-related expenditure, including health sector (enhanced surveillance, laboratory services, isolation units, equipment, supplies, and communication); social protection (cash transfers and food relief); and funds for expediting payments of existing obligations to maintain cash flow for businesses during the crisis. The FY2020/21 budget includes a Ksh56.6 million (0.5 percent of GDP) economic stimulus package that includes a new youth employment scheme, provision of credit guarantees, fast-tracking payment of VAT refunds and other government obligations, increased funding for cash transfers, and several other initiatives. A package of tax measures has been adopted, including full income tax relief for persons earning below the equivalent of $225 per month, reduction of the top pay-as you earn rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the base corporate income tax rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the turnover tax rate on small businesses from 3 to 1 percent, and a reduction of the standard VAT rate from 16 to 14 percent. Some of the tax measures, including the reduction of top PAYE rate, corporate income tax rate and VAT were reversed effective January 1, 2021."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210424041427/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#S
notes_C3: Due to a new wave of Covid cases, new lockdown and suspension rules came into effect in late March 2021. 5 counties, in particular, have stricter restrictions as the new cases were primarily from these locations.  _____________________________    Quote (1):  "The prohibition of political gatherings has been extended."  "On March 26, the government announced further restrictions primarily focused on five counties: Nairobi, Kajiado, Machakos, Kiambu, and Nakuru. The restrictions took effect at midnight on March 26 and remain in effect until further notice"  "Public gatherings and in-person meetings are suspended in the five counties;"    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425111524/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  _____________________________    Quote (2):   "The suspension of large gatherings, in person meetings of any nature, congregational worship, conferences and political events have been suspended in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru until further notice."    Link (2): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425110753/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus  ______________________________    Quote (3):  "Furthermore, within these five counties, authorities have prohibited all public gatherings and in-person meetings until further notice. Bars must remain closed and eateries may only provide takeaway services."    Link (3): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425112634/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011887022/kenya-authorities-extend-existing-covid-19-related-restrictions-through-at-least-may-29-update-21
notes_C6: Travel inside the five county zone is also permitted. The curfew in these five counties will be in effect from 8pm to 4am (local time) until further notice.    The rest of Kenya will observe curfew from 10pm to 4am (local time). During curfew hours, everyone must stay at home or indoors, except for essential service workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210420071518/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_C8: Screening is conducted for all incoming passengers. A ban of all flights from the UK came in effect on April 9.  ___________________________________    Quote (1):  "Transportation Options    Are commercial flights operating? Yes  International with restrictions. However, the Government of Kenya banned all flights from the United Kingdom starting April 9, 2021.  domestic with restrictions."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425111524/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ___________________________________    Quote (2):  "On Friday, the UK announced new travel restrictions against travelers from Kenya saying it had established the South African coronavirus variant was fast spreading locally in the country. The decision means that Kenyans or anybody transiting through Kenyan airports is banned from setting foot in the UK starting on April 9. On Sunday, Nairobi responded with its own measures, banning passenger flights originating or transiting through UK airports for a month. In addition, passengers from the UK will be required to produce negative Covid-19 certificates and valid Covid-19 vaccine certifications."    Link (2): http://archive.today/2021.04.25-151915/https://www.africanews.com/2021/04/05/discriminatory-kenya-hits-back-after-uk-travel-ban//  ___________________________________    Quote (3):  "Kenya also said all visitors originating from or transiting through UK airports will be required to undergo a 14-day mandatory quarantine at a government facility at their own cost. Nairobi said that exemption from the new travel restrictions include cargo flights between the two countries and Kenyan nationals resident in the UK or transiting through the European nation's airports"    Link (3): http://archive.today/2021.04.25-151842/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/africa/2021-04/07/c_139865177.htm  _____________________________________    Quote (4):  "According to CGTN Africa, Kenya Airways will stop all passenger flights to and from the UK from the 9th of April onwards. The date coincides with when the UK will add Kenya to its “red list” of countries from which travel is highly restricted."    Link (4): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425151839/https://simpleflying.com/kenya-airways-suspends-uk-flights/  _____________________________________    Quote (5):  "All international travelers arriving in Kenya must present negative results from a COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 96 hours prior to travel and not be exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms. The test must be digitally verified through the Trusted Travel Initiative or Global Haven partnership. Moreover, individuals displaying symptoms or who have been in close proximity to symptomatic persons may be requested to quarantine for 14 days upon arrival. Travelers leaving Kenya are required to present a negative COVID-19 certificate verified by the Trusted Travel Initiative and the PanaBios system. Land borders remain open to commercial cargo."    Link (5): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425112634/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011887022/kenya-authorities-extend-existing-covid-19-related-restrictions-through-at-least-may-29-update-21  ______________________________________    Quote (6):  "The Government of Kenya has confirmed that all persons departing Kenya for a country requiring a negative COVID-19 test as a condition of entry must obtain an RT PCR COVID-19 test and an associated Trusted Travel code, which airlines and Kenya’s Port Health authorities will verify at the airport. "    Link (6): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425110753/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_C2: 'On 26 March 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that bars in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru are closed and that eateries and restaurants in the same counties will provide takeaways services only and will not serve alcohol. Bars, restaurants and eateries in all other counties would continue to close at 9pm (local time), but will be permitted to sell alcohol.'    Despite of the new strictions, '[p]ublic places, tourism and hospitality establishments, travel and tour companies, hotels and other accommodations, and recreation facilities are allowed to operate, provided they comply with Government of Kenya public health protocols, including 1.5 metre social distancing and the night-time curfew.  ...  Pharmacies and other shops selling essential products remain open, though business hours may be affected by the nationwide curfew.'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_C4: On 26 March 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that '[t]he suspension of large gatherings, in person meetings of any nature, congregational worship, conferences and political events have been suspended in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru until further notice.  In other counties the maximum number of persons permitted to attend meetings or events has been capped at 15, permitted to attend funerals has been capped at 50, weddings capped at 30, with all in attendance expected to abide by Ministry of Health protocols.'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_H3: Because testing is generally available through the voluntary testing scheme, it may be assumed that contract tracing is also comprehensive.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.africanews.com/2020/05/31/kenyans-heed-govt-s-voluntary-covid-19-testing-scheme//
notes_E1: Quote (1):  "Kenya also has existing cash transfer programs targeting over a million people, that receive 2,000 Kenyan shillings, or $19, per month. The national treasury allocated an additional 10 billion shillings to this program for supporting vulnerable groups including the elderly and orphans during this pandemic period."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210426145243/https://www.devex.com/news/cash-transfers-lead-the-social-assistance-response-to-covid-19-96949  _______________    Quote (2):  "The government’s COVID-19 Emergency Fund has raised more than KES 1 billion ($9 million), some of which will be sent as weekly stipends to low-income households in urban areas. "    "Still, the investment Kenya has made in its G2P payment infrastructure is already proving critical to mitigating the impact of the COVID-19 crisis on Kenya’s most vulnerable people. In April, the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection released four months’ worth of payments to current recipients, plus KES 500 million ($4.7 million) in arrears to people with severe disabilities."    Link (2): http://web.archive.org/web/20210426145324/https://www.cgap.org/blog/kenyas-expansion-g2p-becomes-lifeline-during-covid-19-crisis  _______________    Quote (3):  "The government, as part of the FY2019/20 budget (ending June 30, 2020), initially earmarked Ksh40 billion (0.4 percent of GDP) for Covid-related expenditure, including health sector (enhanced surveillance, laboratory services, isolation units, equipment, supplies, and communication); social protection (cash transfers and food relief); and funds for expediting payments of existing obligations to maintain cash flow for businesses during the crisis. The FY2020/21 budget includes a Ksh56.6 million (0.5 percent of GDP) economic stimulus package that includes a new youth employment scheme, provision of credit guarantees, fast-tracking payment of VAT refunds and other government obligations, increased funding for cash transfers, and several other initiatives. A package of tax measures has been adopted, including full income tax relief for persons earning below the equivalent of $225 per month, reduction of the top pay-as you earn rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the base corporate income tax rate from 30 to 25 percent, reduction of the turnover tax rate on small businesses from 3 to 1 percent, and a reduction of the standard VAT rate from 16 to 14 percent. Some of the tax measures, including the reduction of top PAYE rate, corporate income tax rate and VAT were reversed effective January 1, 2021."    Link (3): http://web.archive.org/web/20210424041427/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#S
notes_H8: While the statement from the Ministry of Health does not single out elderly individuals in terms of staying home (rather, opting for a more general recommendation), it does include special protections for shopping (separated lines and priority at the supermarkets) and the provision for *hospitals* (not LTCFs) "to restrict patient visitation to family and relatives of patients who have been expressly contacted by the hospital."    While this does not seem to rise to a 2G, 0 seems like a bad fit given the additional restrictions. Therefore, coded as 1G.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201101195445/https://www.health.go.ke/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/1584711987736-Press-statement-20th-March-2020.pdf
notes_C1: Due to a new of Covid cases in the country, a suspension of face-to-face learning in late March 2021 and early April 2021 at all institutions across the country were asked to close. However, examinations were still allowed and medical students were allowed to continue on.  ______________________________    Quote (1):  "Kenya has suspended face-to-face learning in all educational institutions, including universities and tertiary and vocational colleges, except for students sitting for their examinations and those in medical training institutions."    Link (1): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425140751/https://www.universityworldnews.com/post.php?story=20210405045325613  _______________________________    Quote (2):  "Kenya on Friday placed Nairobi and nearby counties under partial lockdown and closed schools and bars in those areas as a deadly third wave of Covid-19 gripped the country."    Link (2): http://web.archive.org/web/20210326200013/https://news.yahoo.com/kenya-imposes-nairobi-lockdown-shuts-123813010.html  ________________________________    Quote (3):  "Kenya announced to close schools nationwide on Sunday after two fresh cases of coronavirus were confirmed, taking the tally to three in the country."    Link (3): http://web.archive.org/web/20210425141105/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/coronavirus-kenya-shuts-schools-as-new-cases-confirmed/1767139  ________________________________    Quote (4):  "NAIROBI - Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta on Friday placed Nairobi and several nearby counties under a partial lockdown, and closed schools and bars in those areas, in an effort to contain the spread of COVID-19."    Link (4): http://web.archive.org/web/20210326150931/https://ewn.co.za/2021/03/26/kenya-imposes-nairobi-lockdown-shuts-schools-to-contain-covid-19
notes_H7: 'Kenya has offered free COVID-19 vaccines to all diplomats based there, including thousands of United Nations staff, even though it has not completed inoculating its own health workers, other frontline staff or elderly, drawing criticism from local medics.  ...  The government note said vaccinations would begin on March 23 and only accredited diplomats and their families were eligible.'    https://archive.vn/O6H7H
notes_C5: According to the UK government's website on travel to Kenya, The Government of Kenya has directed that, in addition to public transport systems, social distancing rules – in the form of capacity restrictions – will also apply when using private vehicles, including taxis. This means five-seater vehicles will only be allowed to carry two passengers in addition to the driver, while seven-seater vehicles will only be allowed four passengers in addition to the driver. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210411174349/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus

name: Kyrgyz Republic
notes_H1: There is a dedicated government website on the epidemic: covid.kg , which reports daily cases and advice for keeping safe, as well as a Telegram channel: https://xn--r1a.website/s/RshKRCOV.    The Kyrgyz Ministry of Health also publishes COVID-related advice  on their website: med.kg
notes_H2: Quote (1):    "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in the Kyrgyz Republic? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes   The Ministry of Health provides free testing only for symptomatic patients.  For those requiring a negative PCR test for travel, state laboratories in Bishkek and Osh can provide tests for a fee (approximately $20), depending on testing capacity.  Private COVID-19 testing is also available for a fee ($30) at Bonetsky Laboratory or Aqualab. "    Link (1):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155858/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  _________________________________________    Quote (2):  "Private laboratories are offering COVID-19 testing for people who are not showing symptoms of Coronavirus. Both PCR and antibody tests are available."    Link (2):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155331/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus
notes_C7: No restrictions on travel between cities/regions. However, SOPs have been implemented to avoid spread of cases.      Quote: "Movement Restrictions:    Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No"    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425192110/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ___________________________________________________________________    Quote: "With regard to domestic restrictions, inter-regional transport services, including flights between Bishkek and Osh, are operating, though passengers must undergo health screenings before boarding. "    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425183025/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17
notes_H6: "If you are going to a public place you should wear a mask. Gathering in groups of more than three people, unless they are from the same household is forbidden. Minors should be accompanied by an adult." https://web.archive.org/web/20200526141611/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/staying-during-coronavirus
