notes_E2: Broad range of debt and contract relief was provided in the form of taxes, food prices, and loans.    Quote: "To mitigate the impact on the economy, the authorities have approved the first package of anti-crisis plan economic measures of $15 million (0.2 percent of GDP) including the postponement of tax payments, time-bound exemptions of property and land taxes, and temporary price controls on 11 essential food items. They prepared a second and a third package of economic measures of about $540 million (7 percent of GDP), including temporary tax exemptions for SMEs, support food security program to the vulnerable groups, and subsidized credit to banks to provide funding to small and medium-size enterprises through soft loans."  Archived Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210425204401/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  ___________________________________________________________________  Quote: "The Government is working on conducting a detailed economic analysis and preparing a forecast on the possible amount of budget revenues due to emergency situation in the country, as well as on the provision of tax deferrals as part of the Government's anti-crisis plan to support economic sectors and businesses affected by as a result of the spread of the COVID-19"    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425200218/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/kyrgyzstan-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: Though it is unclear what size events are prohibited, 'Public gatherings are prohibited', thus this indicator as coded as a 2 under the assumption that public events are cancelled. (From Source 1, linked)    As a possible exception, places of worship appear to be open, subject to social distancing requirements. (From Source 1, linked)    There was also a mass protest in Kyrgyzstan's capital, Bishkek, on 8th April, but it is unclear whether this was permitted to take place. (From Source 2, linked)    Source 1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405233954/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17    Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210409060109/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/hundreds-protest-in-kyrgyzstan-after-bride-kidnap-and-murder-14583162
notes_C6: No "stay at home" policy was reported.
notes_C8: Quote (1):  "International travel  There are regular flights to and from Kyrgyzstan, operated by a range of airlines. Tickets are available online and at local travel agents. However, there may be reduced flights on some routes."    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155331/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus  ______________________________    Quote (2):  "Although international flights are operating, all persons entering Kyrgyzstan by air must produce proof of a negative COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test taken no more than 72 hours before arrival; exceptions will be made for passengers on flights that become delayed due to weather. Travelers without a negative test certificate will be tested at the border; those who test positive will be placed in a government quarantine facility for up to 14 days. Travelers entering the country through land border checkpoints are also required to produce a negative test certificate. Diplomats, international transport crews, freight drivers, and infants are exempt from this requirement."    Link (2):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-160628/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011870117/kyrgyzstan-authorities-maintain-coronavirus-disease-related-international-entry-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-feb-8-update-16    _____________________________________  Quote (3):  "Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry? Yes"    "Quarantine Information: Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No"    Link (3):  http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155858/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Quote from linked article 1:  "Shopping centers, outdoor markets, catering establishments, hotels, spas, car dealerships, places of worship, and many other nonessential businesses are open subject to social distancing requirements. Some leisure facilities remain closed, including playgrounds, swimming pools, gyms, and public baths."    Web archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.07-110656/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights/news-alerts/wip10011870117/kyrgyzstan-authorities-maintain-coronavirus-disease-related-international-entry-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-feb-8-update-16  ______________________________________________________________________
notes_C4: Though the numbers of how many people can meet are unclear, 'Public gatherings are prohibited', thus this indicator is coded as a 4, though it could be less stringent than this.     Considering that some non-essential businesses are still not permitted to open, such as 'playgrounds, swimming pools, gyms, and public baths', 4 seems an appropriate code for this indicator.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405233954/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17
notes_H3: Contact people are tested in case of COVID-19 symptoms are discovered.  Link: https://archive.vn/ib3Dl
notes_E1: Government launched and provided support to several vulnerable citizens in the form of payments and food.  Quote: "On July 30, the government launched the Emergency Support for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises project amounting USD 50 million. USD 35 million will provide financial support to a large cohort of MSMEs. Depending on the size of the enterprise and the number of formal employees, beneficiaries will receive a lump-sum contribution ranging from USD 500 to USD 10,000 to cover operational expenses such as employee salaries, suppliers, rent, and utilities. Surviving MSMEs will be required to repay the principal amount of the financial assistance."    Archived Link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425195933/https://docs.google.com/viewer?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.unescap.org%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2FKyrgyzstan_COVID%2520Country%2520profile%2520280820.pdf  __________________________________________________  Quote: " Social institutions  About 490 thousand citizens from socially vulnerable groups will receive social payments from the Government  The government allocated 4459,5 tons of flour  200 million soms allocated for the purchase of food for families from socially vulnerable groups  Workers involved in combatting COVID-19    As of April 10, from the deposit account opened for the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic, 433 medical workers were paid compensation payments in the total amount of 3 million 159 thousand soms for March  To avoid the risk of coronavirus infection, the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic decided to send on paid labor leave medical workers over 65, pregnant women and employees with small children  About 500 vehicles (buses, minibuses, personal vehicles) are involved in the movement of health workers"  Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425200218/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/kyrgyzstan-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html  ___________________________________________________    Quote: "As of early April, 2021, the World Bank has allocated a total of $88 million to aid poor and vulnerable families in the Kyrgyz Republic, and to shield businesses from the economic impacts of the pandemic."  Archived article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425202243/https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/feature/2021/03/17/one-year-later-in-the-kyrgyz-republic-s-battle-against-covid-19
notes_H8: No policy on elderly people was reported.
notes_C1: Several schools in Bishkek have been closing down since April 19 due to COVID-19.   " Four schools have been closed for quarantine since today in Bishkek, Education Department Chief Elmira Imanalieva told a press brefing on April 19"  Archived article:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181324/https://akipress.com/news:657033:4_more_schools_closed_for_COVID-19_quarantine_in_Bishkek_since_today/  _______________________________________________________________________    "Twelve schools are closed for quarantine in Bishkek"  Archived Article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181246/https://akipress.com/news:657067:12_schools_closed_for_quarantine_in_Bishkek_due_to_Covid-19/  _______________________________________________________    "Fifteen schools in Bishkek are closed for quarantine due to COVID-19, Education Department's representative Gulmira Akmatova said."  Archived Article  http://web.archive.org/web/20210425181845/https://akipress.com/news:657182:15_schools_in_Bishkek_closed_for_quarantine_due_to_Covid-19/
notes_H7: A - Sinopharm    ________________________  Quote (1):  "On March 19, Kyrgyzstan took delivery of 150,000 doses of the Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine that were provided by China, free of charge. The delivery enabled Kyrgyzstan to begin its vaccination campaign in Bishkek, Osh, and Chui oblast. The first phase is targeting healthcare workers. "    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-175011/https://thediplomat.com/2021/04/kyrgyzstan-begins-covid-19-vaccination-campaign-with-free-chinese-doses/    ____________________________    Quote (2):  "In Kyrgyzstan, vaccination with Chinese vaccine SinoPharm started on March 29, and 75 thousand people are planned to be vaccinated."    Link (2):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-182244/http://en.kabar.kg/news/kyrgyzstans-health-ministry-on-condition-of-those-vaccinated-against-covid-19/    ___________________________________    Quote (3):  "A total of 9 vaccination centers have been deployed in the country: 5 in Bishkek, 2 in Chui Oblast and 2 in Oshcity.    It was noted that at the first stage, doctors working in the red zones, ambulance doctors, as well as socio-demographic groups with a high risk of severe forms of the disease, teachers, law enforcement officers, workers of trade and catering will be vaccinated."    Link (3):  http://archive.today/2021.04.04-182058/http://en.kabar.kg/news/417-people-vaccinated-from-covid-19-in-kyrgyzstan/
notes_C5: Public transport is operating but at reduced levels and with some restrictions.    'Public transport is operating at reduced levels' and 'Authorities continue to advise against nonessential travel'. (From Source 1, linked)    'Bishkek city public transport operates on weekdays and weekends from 7:00 – 23:00. Masks are required on public transit.' (From Source 2, linked)    Source 1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405233954/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463696/kyrgyzstan-covid-19-related-restrictions-remain-largely-unchanged-as-of-april-5-by-comparison-with-early-february-update-17    Source 2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210402235204/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Cambodia
notes_H1: MOH in cooperation with Unicef is distributing posters and billboards, there are radio and TV announcements, and until recently MOH was issuing text messages to mobile phones recommending safety steps (haven’t seen any for about 10 days now). For the materials funded by Unicef see:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200729232153/https://www.unicef.org/cambodia/ and click on ‘communication materials’ at top of page.
notes_H2: Due to the February 20 Community Transmission Event, the Cambodian government is calling on anyone who has been at specified places such as all workers from a garment factory in Meanchey, visitors to Samhan Toul Sangke market, and a number of other locations found to have an individual test postiive.  In addition, anyone with symptoms of fever, cough, sneezing, running nose, tiredness and or shortness of breath should get tested for the virus immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419005109/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/839896/shoppers-and-visitors-to-samhan-toul-sangke-market-between-april-05-and-april-10-should-get-tested-for-covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419005031/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/?s=test
notes_C7: Announced April 29, previous prohibition on all interprovincial travel has been lifted however restrictions are still in place for travel to and from areas under lockdown such as Phnom Penh, Ta Khmau, Sihanoukville, Poipet, and Kandal are restricted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502000734/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: On March 23, the Cambodian government has mandated the wearing of masks in geographic areas where there is an outbreak of COVID-19 in the community as determined by the Ministry of Health. As of April 14, these geographic locations include Phnom Penh and the provinces of Preah Sihanouk, Kandal, Prey Veng, Siem Reap, and Svay Rieng.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426203851/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Different news articles call for govt stimulus packages, but no report about any support being given for 2021:  https://archive.vn/tfqWF
notes_C3: "On 20 February 2021, a press release by PM announced the [c]losure of the clubhouse and other areas related to the COVID-19 cases"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316062958/https://www.who.int/cambodia/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-joint-who-moh-situation-report-35
notes_C6: Three villages in Phnom Penh have additional "red zone" lockdown measures imposed, effective April 16 to April 29: All individuals within the “Red Zones” must not leave their residence, except for medical emergencies, for COVID-19 testing as directed by the relevant authorities, or to receive a second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as determined by the relevant authorities. These villages are as follows: Sangkat Stueng Meanchey 1, Stueng Meanchey 2, Stueng Meanchey 3; Sangkat Chaom Chau; Villages 14, 16, and 17 in Sangkat Boeng Salang.  Lockdown measures with some exceptions imposed on Phnom Penh and Ta Khmau municipalities are effective through April 28, 2021 and until April 29 for three districts in Siem Reap.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426203851/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Since the last update by the US embassy it seems like everyone must abide by the 14 day quarantine, even if everyone entering the country has a negative test result:  "Cambodian authorities have also introduced the following requirements for prevention, containment, and response to the spread of COVID-19 for all travelers entering Cambodia by air, land, and water.? All arriving foreigners must:  Fully abide by locally enforced quarantine measures for 14 days at a hotel designated by the Government of Cambodia."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201124224049/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Starting April 29, lockdown areas have been designated as “Red Zones,” “Dark Yellow Zones,” or “Yellow Zones." (Please see archived docx file for geographic designations.)  In Red Zones: "All individuals within the “Red Zones” must not leave their residence, except for medical emergencies, for COVID-19 testing as directed by the relevant authorities, or to receive a second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as determined by the relevant authorities. All markets, food sales, work and business activities are suspended except for a limited number of emergency and other services as determined by the authorities."  In Dark Yellow Zones: All individuals within the lockdown areas must not leave their residence for the duration of the lockdown period, with some exceptions. Certain essential businesses may remain open despite the lockdown, but may be subject to stricter requirements, such as minimizing their staffing to no more than 2%.  In Yellow Zones: All businesses are permitted to operate, except for schools and entertainment businesses (such as karaoke, beer gardens, clubs, discos, resorts and parks, massage, liquor stores, cinemas, theaters, museums, gyms, and sport centers).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502000734/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503223835/https://kh.usembassy.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/80/Phnom-Penh-and-Ta-Khmau-Zone-Classification-30-APR-2021.docx
notes_C4: Starting April 29, lockdown areas have been designated as “Red Zones,” “Dark Yellow Zones,” or “Yellow Zones." (Please see archived docx file for geographic designations.)  Gatherings are prohibited outside households in Red and Dark Yellow lockdown zones. Groups of up to 4 people may travel to seek medical care. Groups of up to 2 people per household may leave to purchase food.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502000734/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503223835/https://kh.usembassy.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/80/Phnom-Penh-and-Ta-Khmau-Zone-Classification-30-APR-2021.docx
notes_H3: "The MOH guidance on surveillance and contact tracing for COVID-19 has been updated with the inclusion of  an updated suspect case definition that incorporates living in an area with community transmission (updated  07 January 2021)"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221195415/https://www.who.int/cambodia/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-joint-who-moh-situation-report-32
notes_E1: In December 2020, the government extended until the end of March this year: i) allowance subsidy for garment and tourism sectors; ii) tax exemption for tourism and aviation sector; and iii) cash relief program for poor and vulnerable families.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308024659/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: Three villages in Phnom Penh have additional "red zone" lockdown measures imposed, effective April 16 to April 29: All individuals within the “Red Zones” must not leave their residence, except for medical emergencies, for COVID-19 testing as directed by the relevant authorities, or to receive a second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as determined by the relevant authorities. These villages are as follows: Sangkat Stueng Meanchey 1, Stueng Meanchey 2, Stueng Meanchey 3; Sangkat Chaom Chau; Villages 14, 16, and 17 in Sangkat Boeng Salang.  Lockdown measures with some exceptions imposed on Phnom Penh and Ta Khmau municipalities are effective through April 28, 2021 and until April 29 for three districts in Siem Reap.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426203851/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: "On March 20, the Cambodian government announced comprehensive closures to include all public and private educational institutions at all levels throughout the country."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322222100/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: (Sinovax, AstraZeneca, Sinopharm): Beginning May 1, the government of Cambodia has begun a targeted mass vaccination campaign for all adults within designated "Red Zones" within Phnom Penh. This vaccination effort is to prevent serious community transmission of COVID-19. Vaccinations will continue to include all residents of Phnom Penh and Kandal province during May and June.  In addition, other priority groups continue to be the elderly, the vulnerable, and frontliners including health workers, journalists, police and military personnel, government officials and factory workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210504020749/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50848400/large-scale-covid-19-vaccination-campaign-for-red-zone-will-start-may-1st/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210504021301/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50848724/revealed-vaccination-centres-in-the-four-red-zones-of-phnom-penh/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210504021318/https://www.khmertimeskh.com/50849863/pm-says-phnom-penh-and-kandal-vaccinations-will-be-done-by-june/

name: Kiribati
notes_H1: Article suggests that Kiribati has a suspected case of Covid-19 (a person from Papua New Guinea who recently came to Kiribati on a flight from Fiji on 19th March).    The article also refers to the provision of information about Covid-19 on multiple media channels (radio, TV and internet) by the Ministry of Health and Medical Services (MHMS), hence the change of code for H1 from "0" to "2".  It is entirely possible that a coordinated campaign has been in existence prior to this, although no policy announcement about such a campaign has been found.    "People were also kept reminded by the MHMS over radio Kiribati, the media and tv of steps to combat with the deadly convid-19 on all levels.    On the island people had their hand-held mobile smart telephone on site with them for any current viral news for the corona virus updates. They can access the latest news with their mobile any moment."    http://archive.today/2021.01.24-161213/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/kiribati-is-now-on-level-2-in-the-convid-19-scale-in-tarawa/
notes_H2: Article from Kiribati updates.    Notes that a suspected Covid case (a captain of a ship) had been tested for Covid-19 and the results had come back negative.  This suggests a policy of testing is in existence and is likely to have been in place prior to 28th March, although no policy on testing has been found, so code prior to this has been left as "0".  The tests were carried out in Australia.  It is assumed that reliance on other countries for testing will mean that testing is limited to symptomatic / suspected cases and is not available more widely.      Link:  http://archive.today/2021.01.26-174948/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/convid-19-results-proof-negative-in-tarawa/    Subsequent Facebook posts by the Australian High Commission for Kiribati notes the delivery of testing supplies and equipment (GeneXpert) on 1st May, 21st May, 25th August and 9th November 2020 which suggests that testing capacity within Kiribati progressively increases over the coming months.  A further post by the High Commission on 12th November comments on support provided for Kiribati to develop a PCR lab at Tungaru Central Hospital which will reduce its need for sending samples overseas for testing.  Taken as a whole, these comments suggest that whilst testing capacity increases, it has remained limited and is therefore unlikely to meet coding criteria for "2" or "3" throughout 2020.    Additional context: borders remained closed from March 2020 and Kiribati has continued to report no confirmed cases of Covid-19 throughout 2020.
notes_C6: The previous code of "2" was given in light of both the policy relating the persons under 18 years of age and the associated police Facebook post referring to enforcement of stay at home requirements.  As the policy was set to end on 16th April and as no further policy announcements have been found, it is assumed that the stay at home requirement for persons under 18 years of age ceased after 16th April.  Hence the code of "0".
notes_C8: IMF: "borders have been closed on March 21, except for delivery of essential goods (quarantine requirements apply at all ports). "  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501002338/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#K
notes_E1: The specific measures include: unemployment benefit via partial income substitution, employer cost sharing for off-shore observers, sea farers, and fruit packers, reduction in social security contributions for both employers and employees, and loan support through government-owned financial intermediaries.  https://archive.vn/gxVRM#K
notes_C1: From UN Sustainable Development Group (UNSDG).  Article not dated, link below.    "COVID-19 pandemic  A National State of Public Health Emergency was first declared by the Kiribati government on 25 March 2020; and a partial lockdown was effective between 30 March to 20 April 2020, [...] schools [...] closed. Schools reopened on 20 April 2020 "    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-164719/https://unsdg.un.org/un-in-action/kiribati

name: South Korea
notes_H1: http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/
notes_H2: KCDC- The newly developed diagnostic will be available at the 50 designated health facilities from 7 February. The improved real-time PCR can detect the novel Coronavirus within six hours.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200406091812/https://www.cdc.go.kr/board/board.es?mid=a30402000000&bid=0030  BBC- South Korea managed to get testing centres up and running 17 days after the 1st case (20th of January)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406084319/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-51836898
notes_H6: Beginning October 13, 2020, face masks are compulsory in public places (public transportation, demonstration sites and in healthcare facilities). Failure to wear an appropriate mask that covers both nose and mouth could result in a fine of up to 100,000 won (approximately $100).   See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210503233246/https://kr.usembassy.gov/022420-covid-19-information/    Also, see: South Korea launches a 30-day grace period for mandatory masks in such spaces starting October 13. A fine of up to 100,000 won ($85.50) will be imposed on people who fail to wear face masks in public spaces and on transportation starting November 13.     Archived web: https://archive.vn/RqYGE    [Recoded from 2G to 3G on 3 May 2021 during review]
notes_E2: On March 17, 2020, the National Assembly Strategy and Finance Committee made an announcement on the “Amendment to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act” to minimize and to overcome the economic impact due to COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215120/https://www.rsm.global/korea/tax-benefits-due-covid-19-korea  South Korean authorities in March 2020 approved tax relief in an effort to address the impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215233/https://home.kpmg/us/en/home/insights/2020/04/tnf-korea-tax-relief-includes-reduced-rates-temporary-increased-deductions.html
notes_C3: New Year events and holiday parties organized by in facilities such as hotels, ballrooms, and guesthouses are prohibited.    https://archive.vn/TmagY    In Busan, singing practice halls, indoor concert halls, and direct sales promotion halls are banned after 9pm starting today, December 1st.    https://archive.vn/d29d7
notes_C6: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL  http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)  [Previous note by coder added to this data point during review process]
notes_C8: South Korea said on December 23, 2020, it will suspend flights leaving for and arriving from United Kingdom until the end of the year (December 31) over concerns about a new strain of the novel coronavirus. The country will also place all international arrivals from United Kingdom in a 14-day quarantine and conduct an additional virus test at the time of the quarantine being lifted, according to health authorities. The measure takes effect immediately, according to health authorities.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226075508/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20201223004400320
notes_C4: Previous directive of Stage 2.5 in metropolitan areas and Stage 2 in non-metropolitcan areas will be extended for two further weeks until January 17. In addition, measures to ban private gatherings from 5 people will be expanded nationwide and implemented for the two weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102055818/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=362858&contSeq=362858&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_H3: Extensive public information campaign, most notably location tracing apps. The Corona 100m (Co100) app launched on February 11 and, using government data, alerts users when they come within 100 metres of a location visited by an infected person. Coronamap website shows the travel histories of confirmed COVID-19 patients and Coronaita aims to function “like a search engine” for information on coronavirus-hit areas.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202823/https://www.smartcitiesworld.net/news/news/south-korea-to-step-up-online-coronavirus-tracking-5109   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202916/http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Society/view?articleId=183129
notes_E1: Quotation: "President Moon Jae-in announced Monday during a meeting with a special task force that the government will pay about $820 to all households except for those in the top 30% income bracket, bringing the total amount to $7.4 billion."  Link: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/s-korea-offer-emergency-payments-help-ease-impact-covid-19
notes_H8: Nursing hospitals and nursing facilities will continue to take measures to prevent high-intensity infections, but will conduct non-contact visits from July 1. The Mayor or Province Governor will decide whether or not to allow visitations according to COVID-19 outbreak by region, and the institution operator (quarantine manager) should establish a visit plan to minimize the risk of infection of patients and residents if necessary.  Visitation guidelines are as follows: (1) Visiting is operated by reservation system in advance, and a separate meeting space is provided, and are notified of the visitation rules in advance with quarantine supplies and access list. (2) Visits must be conducted in a separate space or outdoors where a transparent barrier is installed, and direct physical contact or food intake other than indirect contact through vinyl, etc. is restricted.    https://archive.vn/DomUW#selection-2359.0-2367.248
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G. Under current restrictions, schools are open with restrictions. With the previous localized closure expired at the end of February, there is no evidence of any closures of any levels.     No change at social distancing level: Level 2 for Greater Seoul, Level 1.5 for non-Greater Seoul  https://archive.is/EnyfJ    In-person class attendance capped at one-third at level 2, two-third at level 1.5     Korean social distancing level: http://web.archive.org/web/20210211130346/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20201106000174
notes_H7: ***Recoded from 2G to 3G     As of Tuesday, seems three groups are being actively vaccinated - 1) key workers, 2) clinically vulnerable, and 3) elderly. See below:     "South Korea’s government on Tuesday began inoculating nearly 300,000 people at care hospitals and nursing homes who are 65 or older and medical workers there as it steps up its vaccination drive.    About 680,000 high-risk healthcare professionals and critically ill people have been vaccinated since the campaign kicked off at the end of February, according to the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA)."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210328141508if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-southkorea-idUSKBN2BF02D

name: Kuwait
notes_H1: From 18 Feb, the government has ramped up its public information activities in a coordinated manner.  On 18 Feb, the Ministry of Health allocated a hotline for citizens to answer any queries. A protocol of cooperation between Kuwait National Guard and Ministry of Health media office was activated on the same day to enhance awareness of the National Guard.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120433/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/news/hotline-allocated-to-answer-inquiries-on-coronavirus/  On 12 March, the government launched a website with all the latest updates and information.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120229/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2877656&Language=en  The Kuwait Ministry of Health has also been also providing regular updates in Arabic and English on its Twitter feed.
notes_H2: 'The Ministry of Health is randomly testing citizens and residents daily as part of its measures to curb COVID-19. Detailed instructions will be sent to those selected for a COVID swab via text message.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013195918/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: U.S Embassy in Kuwait reports that no restrictions currently exist in relation to inter-city and inter-state travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201017080651/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: 18th May 2020, Kuwait imposes mandatory wearing of masks in public, the country’s health ministry has revealed those who fail to adhere to the strict guidelines could be looking at up to three months in prison or be hit with fines of up to $16,200 (5,000 dinars).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200915055927/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/culture-society/446880-kuwait-imposes-mandatory-wearing-of-masks-in-public
notes_E2: No change in policy.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426152740/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: https://gulfbusiness.com/kuwait-begins-phased-plan-to-reopen-economy-over-a-million-expats-remain-in-lockdown/ mosques reopen but Friday prayers are not allowed. Public events remained cancelled
notes_C6: Beginning March 7 at 5:00 PM, a 12-hour curfew is in effect from 5:00 PM to 5:00 AM daily until April 8.  Is a curfew in place? Yes, a 12-hour curfew.  Beginning March 7 at 5:00 PM, a 12-hour curfew is in effect from 5:00 PM to 5:00 AM daily until April 8.  Those seeking emergency medical treatment during curfew should call 112.  Curfew passes for medical appointments during curfew hours can be requested at https://curfew.paci.gov.kw/request/create.  Grocery shopping appointments (5:00 PM to 10:00 PM) can be requested at www.moci.shop. Confirmation of the appointment must be presented to authorities upon entering and leaving the market.  Passengers departing Kuwait who need to reach the airport during curfew hours should be prepared to travel directly from their homes to the airport, carrying their passport and flight confirmation to show at potential checkpoints.  Pharmacies, cooperative societies, and grocery stores offer delivery services during curfew hours.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314213621/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Authorities in Kuwait have amended COVID-19 entry restrictions effective Feb. 21. Passengers arriving from 35 previously banned countries will be able to enter the country. The countries include India, Iran, China, and Brazil, among others.  People entering from these locations will be subject to a 14-day quarantine at a hotel at their own expense. Travelers from these countries will have to undergo two polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests, one upon arrival and another at the end of their quarantine.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219122511/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/445301/kuwait-authorities-amend-covid-19-entry-restrictions-effective-feb-21-update-31
notes_C2: "Government offices and private businesses, banking, financial, and construction sectors, retail stores, shopping malls, public parks, restaurant takeout and dine-in services, hotels, and tailors are open with physical distancing measures. Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, all commercial businesses, including restaurants, are closed from 8 PM to 5 AM daily, with the exception of pharmacies, co-ops, and grocery stores. Takeout orders and delivery is not restricted.  Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, health clubs, salons, barber shops, and spas are closed."
notes_C4: Kuwait reopens mosques after months of coronavirus closure.  http://archive.fo/muGeK
notes_H3: /web/20200409143715/https://twitter.com/KUWAIT_MOH/status/1236360623921008647  Screening to all people in contact with travelers.
notes_E1: "3. Establishing a mechanism to secure the minimum income that ensures facing the cost of living for workers affected by the current crisis and linked to contracts    4. Support the salaries of those under Chapter 5 in social Security in the affected sectors.    5. Assist owners of small, medium, industrial and agricultural projects by postponing the installments funded by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises Development and the agricultural finance portfolio in the Industrial Park    6. Providing loans on concessional and long term to small and medium enterprises, through joint financing from local banks and the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Development"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501022530/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2882522&Language=en
notes_H8: Updating indicator to be inline with C6 (stay at home requirements).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210325144456/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On Feb 26, the Ministry of Education announced universities and schools would be suspended for a period of 2 weeks starting 01 March. /web/20200409075927/https://twitter.com/MOEKUWAIT/status/1232659575565885447  Kuwait has further extended the closure of schools and universities, with the latest update on 20 March when the government announced suspension until August 4.  Education Minister Saud Al-Harbi said the decision applies to public and private schools, and that teachers will be paid with full salaries in the duration of the suspension.  The minister said the next school year will begin in December 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194131/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1644186/middle-east
notes_H7: Everyone can sign up for the vaccine for free, but the elderly, healthcare workers and clinically vulnerable people are given priority.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002053if_/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/kuwait-all-citizens-to-get-covid-19-vaccine-for-free-1.75488993  https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002646/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/covid-19-more-than-1000-people-vaccinated-on-1st-day-in-kuwait-1.76123900
notes_C5: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.  Reopening Taxi Services (Permitted to One Passenger Only).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf

name: Laos
notes_H1: The Prime Minister Exective order mentions about public awareness  through departments and official media. The Exective order implementation is from 30th March.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200618220009/https://www.norway.no/en/vietnam/norway-vietnam/news-and-events/order-of-laos-prime-minister//
notes_H2: The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020
notes_C7: Due to the 2-week lockdown announced April 22 to May 5, travel is prohibited from the Vientiane Capital district to the provinces. Travel into Vientiane Capital district is also prohibited except for returning residents, those who work in the capital, or who have obtained special permission from the COVID-19 Task Force.  Transportation to and from the capital district is suspended and the police will set up checkpoints to enforce the order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Facial masks are mandatory required when stepping out of house  Social distancing of one to two meters must be observed    Reference:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201024141830/http:/www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-09/30/c_139409766.htm
notes_E2: Recent mitigation policies include income tax exemption for both civil servants and employees of private sector with income less than 5 million kip per month for three months; profit tax exemption for microenterprises with annual income between 50-400 million kip for three months; duty fee exemption for imports of goods to be used towards the outbreak; deferring tax collection from tourism related businesses for three months; postponing mandatory contribution to social security by affected businesses for three months and extending the submission of the 2019 financial report (annual tax filing) by two months and road tax payment by three months.    Measures include, establishing a separate task force to address the economic impact of COVID-19. A new electricity tariff, to ensure supply of electricity, in effect from May 1, 2020 through December 31, 2025, is in place.     https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_C3: As a result of the 2-week lockdown beginning April 22 to May 5, gatherings of groups of more than 20 people are prohibited, except for funerals and certain religious activities such as alms offerings. Such exempted events still must adhere to all previously announced COVID-19 prevention measures including conducting temperature checks, maintaining social distancing of at least one meter, wearing masks, and using hand sanitizer.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Due to the 2-week lockdown announced April 22 to May 5, Vientiane residents are not permitted to leave their homes except for necessary activities such as buying food, for medical emergencies, or if they are essential government workers (firefighters, police, military, and other critical infrastructure workers). Agricultural workers are also permitted to leave their homes as necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: All ground-based border crossings will remain closed except for the transportation of goods. International flights (often to Seoul, Republic of Korea) and weekly UN humanitarian flights (to/from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia) are significantly limited, but operate regularly, with exit flights departing roughly every two weeks and entry flights arriving once or twice per month, depending on demand. Domestic flights continue to be fully operational.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Announced April 22, the government of Laos has closed its borders and announced a two-week lockdown in the capital, Vientiane, and restrictions in other provinces until May 5 as the country weathers a rare outbreak of COVID-19 linked to its neighbor Thailand.  Entertainment venues such as karaoke or beer bars, internet cafes, spas and massage places, fitness venues and all indoor sports facilities are ordered closed. The following entities are allowed to continue to operate: factories, banks and other financial institutions, the stock exchange, hospitals and medical centers, pharmacies, medical emergency services, postal service, telecommunication, electricity providers, water supply facilities, waste collectors, agricultural markets, convenience stores, supermarkets, gas stations, restaurants and coffee shops.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: As a result of the 2-week lockdown beginning April 22 to May 5, gatherings of groups of more than 20 people are prohibited, except for funerals and certain religious activities such as alms offerings. Such exempted events still must adhere to all previously announced COVID-19 prevention measures including conducting temperature checks, maintaining social distancing of at least one meter, wearing masks, and using hand sanitizer.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: Appears to be comprehensive: https://web.archive.org/web/20200619232042/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/04/12/laos-confirms-19th-case-of-covid-19-infection/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200619232100/https://www.who.int/news-room/feature-stories/detail/support-for-lao-pdr-s-response-to-covid-19
notes_E1: There is no evidence that the government has continued to compensate workers' salary pass June 2020. However terminated, and thereby unemployed, workers are eligible for an unemployment allowance in accordance to the Social Security Law.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426192623/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: According the country’s National Deployment and Vaccination Plan (NVDP), this initial batch of AstraZeneca/Oxford vaccines will be used by the Government of Lao PDR to first immunise priority groups in the country who are at greater risk of exposure to COVID-19 and those who are most likely to develop severe symptoms from infection.  This includes frontline healthcare workers, older adults above the age of 60 and people with underlying health conditions. Some essential workers will also be prioritised based on the nature of the job and high-risk of exposure to COVID-19 such as workers at points of entry and in quarantine centres.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210405183726/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-vaccines-shipped-by-covax-facility-arrive-in-lao-pdr/
notes_C1: Announced April 22, there is a 2-week lockdown for all Vientiane residents who are not permitted to leave their homes except for necessary activities such as buying food, for medical emergencies, or if they are essential government workers until May 5.  In Borikhamxay and Saravan provinces, authorities have now ordered all schools closed from April 19 to May 2 in districts where infected persons live.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210421214936/https://www.rfa.org/english/news/laos/cases-04212021171654.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A,B,C (AstraZeneca, Sinopharm): Health authorities in Laos have launched an online registration programme for Covid-19 vaccinations aimed at priority groups. According to an announcement by the Centre of Information and Education for Health, residents of Vientiane and foreign citizens will be able to register online for Covid-19 vaccinations. The AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine and Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine will be given to priority groups such as medical personnel and individuals in at-risk groups, as well as people who are 60 years old or above. After medical personnel, individuals with chronic illnesses, such as respiratory or cardiovascular disease, asthma, obesity, immunodeficiency, and others, are expected to receive the vaccine first.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426202227/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/04/24/authorities-open-online-registration-for-covid-19-vaccinations-in-laos
notes_C5: Due to the 2-week lockdown announced April 22 to May 5, public transportation is currently not in operation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426190809/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Lebanon
notes_H1: I could not find a specific date for an official public campaign beginning, but given that on Mar 6 the Health Minister stated "Lebanon is no longer in Coronavirus containment stage", and that on the same day the first domestic restrictions got into place, this seems like the proper time point.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504213031/https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/news-bulletin-reports/505703/health-minister-hassan-lebanon-is-no-longer-in-cor/en
notes_H2: Lebanon has a mixed approach to testing with symptomatic and eligible ppl able to access testing + population level random testing of ppl without symptoms or eligibility to attempt to estimate the population level of infection.     /web/20200608224645/https://www.executive-magazine.com/economics-policy/healthcare/coronavirus/testing-for-covid-19-in-lebanon On April 20, the Ministry of Public Health began population screening or what they called “random testing” (though it is not so random, see below) in different areas of Lebanon. "
notes_C7: From 21st August 2020, Lebanon has reinstated a nationwide curfew from 1800-0600 daily, during which internal movement will also be restricted (with the exception of travelling to and from the airport).   https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone, or exercising).    Masks are required outdoors in all public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_E2: Extension of deadlines for paying taxes and utility bills, banks are allowed to extend 5yr no interest loans./web/20200611013320/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/08/lebanon-direct-covid-19-assistance-hardest-hit
notes_C3: From 21st August, all public events are banned.  2020https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Previous curfew ended at 5am, a new curfew began as part of the four-phase easing of restrictions programme.    The first phase: starts from five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/08/2021, until five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/22/2021.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210208174424/http://drm.pcm.gov.lb/Media/News/Daily-situation-report-06-Feb,-2021_English-Versio.pdf
notes_C8: All air travelers over age 12 arriving in Beirut are required to undergo PCR testing upon arrival unless they have documented proof of testing positive for COVID-19 more than 15 days prior to arrival, an IgG positive test showing sufficient antibodies, or proof of full vaccination more than 15 days prior to arrival. Unless travelers possess proof of testing positive for COVID-19 more than 15 days prior to arrival, an IgG positive test showing sufficient antibodies, or proof full vaccination more than 15 days prior to arrival, all travelers are required to quarantine for 72 hours and download in the covidlebtracker app.  https://archive.vn/yMaT0  https://archive.vn/QYvoa    Commercial flights are operating to and from Lebanon. Check with your travel company for the latest information.  Travelers to Lebanon are required to present a negative PCR test result taken within 96 hours prior to arrival in Lebanon at check-in.  All travelers will also have to take a PCR test at Beirut International Airport upon arrival (which is provided at the airline’s expense) and then to quarantine for 72 hours, unless an exemption applies:    If you have previously tested positive for COVID-19 (i.e. can present proof of a positive test, dated more than 15 days prior to arrival in Lebanon), providing you now have a negative test  If you have an IgG positive antibody test showing a percentage of those antibodies in the blood above the required rate  For disabled passengers, those with special needs or autism, holding a medical report, which is approved on an individual basis by the Ministry of Public Health representatives at the airport. You should check with the Lebanese Embassy in the UK if you need more details.  Travelers will also be required to download and activate the “Covid Leb Track” mobile application on arrival to Lebanon, and to present the application to the authorities at Beirut International Airport at the time of the PCR test.  https://archive.vn/f7rxc  https://archive.vn/QYvoa
notes_C2: From 21st August 2020, malls, gyms and restaurants will be closed, although restaurants will be permitted to make deliveries 0600-1800. Grocery stores will be allowed to operate from 0600-1700.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20200221-lebanon-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus-2-more-suspected/
notes_H8: Regarding to C6 the strict stay at home requirements also include the elderly.    Nightly curfew ( 20:00-05:00) remains in effect until further notice.    https://archive.vn/xhXtt    Lebanon has announced a total lockdown between April 3 and April 6 for Easter to prevent gatherings and avoid super spreader events.    https://archive.vn/ERx9A  https://archive.vn/1mTwR    During the month of Ramadan, from Monday 12 April to Wednesday 12 May, there is a nation-wide curfew in place between 9.30pm and 5am.  https://archive.vn/NF974  https://archive.vn/vZ6kC
notes_C1: All public and private schools will resume their education in person as well as learning online under a blended learning approach starting from April 21, 2021.  This will happen in three stages, starting with Lebanese Baccalaureate pupils in Year 12.The second stage includes Brevet pupils in Year 9 and kindergarten pupils, set to return on May 5. The rest of the classes will return on May 17, in the third and final stage.  Pupils who are unable to return to school because of health concerns will be exempt from the plan and can continue distance learning.  The decision came after Lebanon's national coronavirus committee released a statement advising the education sector to resume activities in line with virus precautions and safety measures.    https://archive.vn/QAtCo  https://archive.vn/GTNrN  https://archive.vn/13KJ1  https://archive.vn/HDJn8
notes_H7: Lebanon officially launched the national vaccination campaign at Rafik Hariri University Hospital in Beirut on February 14. The priority groups which the campaign targets in the early phases of vaccination: frontline health workers, the elderly, and those with co-morbidities. Pfizer-BioNTech is the vaccine that has been administrated in Lebanon.   https://archive.vn/Ootiq  https://archive.vn/Clvvb  https://www.moph.gov.lb/userfiles/files/Prevention/COVID-19%20Vaccine/Lebanon%20NDVP-%20Feb%2016%202021.pdf  https://archive.vn/185bg    Pfizer and AstraZeneca are available through the Ministry of Public Health and Sputnik is available through the private sector.  https://archive.vn/yMaT0    Lebanon, through the MoPH, is finalizing all legal and financial aspects needed to conclude the PfizerBioNTech vaccine deal to import around 2 million doses. Lebanon is already involved with the COVAX  platform to obtain certain potential vaccines that are WHO endorsed. These vaccines include the likes of  Astrazeneca-Oxford vaccine, Moderna vaccine, Johnson & Johnson vaccines, among others.  https://archive.vn/Clvvb  https://www.moph.gov.lb/userfiles/files/Prevention/COVID-19%20Vaccine/Lebanon%20NDVP-%20Feb%2016%202021.pdf
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating at limited capacity. Starting April 12, there will be a curfew in place from 7:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m  https://archive.vn/yMaT0    Public transportation has resumed operating nationwide, albeit with social distancing measures and passenger limits in place. As of April 12, a 21:30-05:00 nightly curfew is in effect for the duration of Ramadan.  https://archive.vn/vZ6kC

name: Liberia
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20210209010112/https://www.facebook.com/LiberiaMOE/posts/2893171400953833
notes_H2: "For all non-travelers, sample collection is free."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111202132/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C7: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) does not have any restrictions on internal movement. [1] Nor is there any reference to internal movement restrictions on the Ministry of Health website [2] or any proclamations from the President since the state of emergency expired on July 21st, 2020.     [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_H6: On April 24, on the advice of health professionals, the president extended the stay-at-home order’s application period and geography (to all 15 counties in the country). During this time, residents may leave their homes only to procure food or health items, an activity limited to one person per household for a maximum of one hour, so long as the person does not venture out of his or her local area. Anyone in public must wear a face-mask. See: https://blogs.loc.gov/law/2020/05/liberia-government-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19/ (accessed 14th September 2020, web archive unavailable)
notes_C3: Still in place.    SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C6: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) specifies that people must stay home when sick, but does not recommend the general public stay home. [1] Additionally, the ministry of health website does not include healthy people staying home as a recommendation to prevent catching COVID-19. [2]    [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C8: A negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) isn’t required to enter the country. Health screening procedures are conducted at airports. Travellers will be tested for COVID-19 upon arrival at the traveller’s expense (75 $). Incoming travellers will have a mandatory temperature check. All passengers are required to wear a face mask and wash their hands.   Travellers who test positive for COVID-19 upon arrival will undergo treatment based on Liberia’s case management guidelines.  Travellers who test negative should self-quarantine for seven days and monitor their symptoms for a period of 14 days, beginning the day after arrival in Liberia.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://lr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: State of emergency extended for 2 more weeks. The President said restaurants, stores selling food commodities, dry goods, building materials and electronic appliances, will be allowed to open, provided they take in 25% of their full occupancy at a time while observing social distancing.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603170556/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/compulsory-covid-19-testing-for-curfew-violators/     https://web.archive.org/web/20200603171219/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/state-of-emergency-extended-for-yet-another-two-weeks/
notes_C4: LARGE GATHERINGS INCLUDING PARTIES OF MORE THAN 10 PEOPLE, SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_H3: "Liberia, hard hit by the Ebola epidemic in 2014, was one of the first countries to start screening for Covid-19 at airports and to adopt other control measures, such as rapid testing, complete contact tracing and quarantine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111204228/https://www.wsj.com/articles/which-countries-have-responded-best-to-covid-19-11609516800
notes_E1: For example, stimulus package that includes disbursement to private school teachers. See https://moe-liberia.org/ministry-of-education-continues-disbursement-of-stimulus-package-to-private-school-teachers/ [web archive unavailable]
notes_H8: When the state of emergency expired on July 21st, restrictions on movement and any stay at home restrictions were lifted.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104202802/https://www.emansion.gov.lr/2press.php?news_id=5178&related=7&pg=sp
notes_C1: According to the IMF, schools in Liberia have reopened since January 4, 2021.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210312173955/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H7: After receipt of 96,000 doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, through the COVAX facility, Liberia, on April 1, 2021, joined many countries to officially launch the vaccination campaign against COVID-19. Vaccines are available to the frontline workers and the most vulnerable (A and B groups).  The vaccines are now deployed at eight sites in Montserrado and Margibi counties including; the Number 14 Military hospital, JFK memorial hospital, Catholic hospital, Redemption and SOS Hospitals among others. The vaccines will subsequently be rolled out to the others counties in the coming days.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210409171516/https://www.afro.who.int/news/liberia-launches-vaccination-against-covid-19
notes_C5: 17th March    To ensure public safety, the Ministry of Transport and LNP have agreed that the full enforcement of the preventive measures shall commence effective on March 17, 2020.    Public Transport- taxis should carry no more than two passengers in the back and one in the front. motorbike/pempem should carry only one passenger.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200603180000/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/mot-announces-preventive-measures-for-public-transport/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603175325/https://emansion.gov.lr/doc/COVID-19%20Declaration%20of%20National%20Health%20Emergency%20-%20MoH.pdf

name: Libya
notes_H1: Authorities continue to conduct awareness campaigns on media, social media, public spaces, or elsewhere around hygiene methods, social distancing, of other measures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419125348/https://reliefweb.int/report/libya/libya-health-sector-bulletin-march-2021    For the latest information and advice for travel to Libya with regards to COVID-19, please visit Libya’s National Centre of Disease Control (NCDC) webpage at https://ncdc.org.ly/Ar/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210318005810/https://ly.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H2: 21 March 2020 - WHO confirms coronavirus testing in Libya is conducted properly  http://archive.vn/HmFOD
notes_C7: Libya's land, sea, and air borders are closed to all except essential traffic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221144124if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_H6: Wear a mask to keep your nose and mouth covered when in public settings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108111919/https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/warning/coronavirus-libya    It is mandatory to wear face masks when out in public. Fines will be given to those who do not comply.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108112323/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C3: Public, cultural, sports and social events are banned.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201108112323if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C6: Lockdown is indefinitely in Libya. A curfew is in place in Eastern Libya, between 17:00 and 7:00.  Non-essential attractions in most of Libya are closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419123022if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/
notes_C8: All Libya's air and sea borders are closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/
notes_C2: Restaurants and cafes are allowed to reopen, however people are not allowed to dine inside. Barbershops, and non-essential businesses are closed until further notice. Public parks and meat markets are closed until further notice.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118125325if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C4: The Libyan Presidential Council of the Government of National Accord (GNA) has announced a curfew across Libya starting March 22 from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. over concerns about Coronavirus possible outbreak. "All mosques, education institutions, cafes, restaurants, wedding halls, parks, clubs and shops will be closed and funerals and weddings as well as public transports will be banned."   http://archive.vn/xQyIN
notes_H3: Coding change as I am unable to find any contract tracing info for Libra. Prior notes from coders refers to testing labs and not contact tracing
notes_H8: See C6.
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.    https://archive.vn/WgxZH
notes_C5: Public transportation in Libya is operating but limited.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329040943/https://www.tripsguard.com/destination/libya/

name: Liechtenstein
notes_H1: Hygiene measures are a must for everyone Strict adherence to the hygiene rules is still the best measure against a possible contagion in the unavoidable social contacts. The hands are  Wash thoroughly with soap, avoid shaking hands and kissing people and all you have to do is cough or sneeze into a handkerchief or the crook of your arm. People who have a fever and cough should stay at home.    Appeal to the population    The government appeals to all residents of the country who Government action with common sense and the greatest discipline implement. In case of doubt, the principle of caution should be applied. The government is aware of the fact that some of these measures have far-reaching consequences. But it is a question of solidarity with the elderly Generation and those with certain pre-existing conditions that we all share get together and cope with the tasks ahead of us together.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_H6: Beginning March 1,  For all gatherings and establishments, strict protective procedures must be maintained. This also includes maintaining social distances of at least 1.5 meters who do not belong in the same household, as well as the wearing of masks in all public areas.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C3: Beginning March 1, public events of up to 10 people will be allowed, but no food or drink are allowed to be served.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C6: On 24 October 2020, the government began recommending limiting social contact again along with other restrictions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210501200344/https://www.regierung.li/files/attachments/588-corona-regierung-schliesst-gastronomie-1023.pdf?t=637555027160559197
notes_C8: 16th March 2020, The government recommends that you only travel when it is absolutely necessary. It is to be expected that there will continue to be changes to the entry and Quarantine regulations in other countries sometimes come without notice, accordingly, further restrictions on travel are to be expected. All People who are currently abroad will be able to return as soon as possible came to Liechtenstein.    Information on border controls in Austria    Austria has introduced border controls at the borders with Liechtenstein. From Wednesday,  March 18, 2020, the border crossings to Austria remain in Schellenberg and Mauren blocked. The border crossings Ruggell and Schaanwald, however, remain around the clock open to commuters and goods. That means that freight and commercial traffic (exception: passenger transport), commuter traffic, for emergency services and for transit through Austria possible without a stopover are. For all other cases the obligation to bring one applies Health certificate with molecular biological test in German, English, Italian or French language, which must not be older than four days. Should If such a certificate is not available, entry will be refused. Austrian Citizens and people with residence or ordinary In any case, residence in Austria is allowed to enter the country, whereby this is daily home quarantine.  Avoid travel    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C2: On November 10, in light of rising levels of COVID-19 infections, the Liechtenstein Government extended measures taken in October to mitigate the spread of the virus through November 29.   - This included measures implemented on October 21 and 24, respectively that the wearing of masks are required inside all public buildings and the temporary closing of restaurants, bars and night clubs.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210501200344/https://www.regierung.li/files/attachments/588-corona-regierung-schliesst-gastronomie-1023.pdf?t=637555027160559197  https://web.archive.org/web/20210501184909/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C4: Beginning March 29, up to 25 people will be allowed to gather in outdoor public areas. In addition, family and friends may gather indoors in groups of up to 10 people, up from five announced in February. Public events of up to 10 people will continue to be allowed, but the serving of food or drink is prohibited. Public establishments in the areas of culture, entertainment, leisure and sports, allowed to reopen in February, will continue to be open. Bars, nightclubs and dance clubs, as well as casinos will remain closed. Restaurants will also remain closed but are allowed to offer takeaway and delivery services. School cafeterias, as well as business cantinas and hotel restaurants servicing guests are not affected. For all gatherings and establishments, strict protective procedures must be maintained. This also includes maintaining social distances of at least 1.5 meters who do not belong in the same household, as well as the wearing of masks in all public areas.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_H8: 16th March 2020, Older people should stay at home    Contagion causes mild symptoms in most people. For elderly People and people with certain pre-existing conditions can get the virus though be life-threatening. The government therefore recommends people age 65 and over as well People with previous illnesses urgently, social contacts to the absolute Minimun and stay at home whenever possible. Contacts with Avoid people who show symptoms of the common cold. The government is also calling Relatives when dealing with older people and people with previous illnesses the greatest caution.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C1: Schools are scheduled to start slowly transitioning back from distance learning starting 11 May, with regular classes resuming on 18 May.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic

name: Sri Lanka
notes_H1: From 14 March, Sri Lanka announcements start increasing. Since then the President and Ministry of Health have been quite active on social media. This continued throughout the nationwide curfew which started on 20 March.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200504162625/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=225&Itemid=487&lang=en  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163456/https://twitter.com/gotabayar  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163534/https://twitter.com/moh_srilanka  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408194539/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-bans-public-events-as-cases-rises-to-8/article31069806.ece  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504143121/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-to-lift-nationwide-curfew-on-april-27-829717.html
notes_H2: Multiple  new reports from Jan 3 suggest that random Rapid Antigen Tests are being conducted and available at Fish Stalls in the Western Province (the country's capital Colombo is in the Western Province):   - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126065207/https://colombogazette.com/2021/01/03/rapid-antigen-tests-conducted-at-fish-stalls-in-western-province/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126065251/https://www.newsradio.lk/local/random-tests-to-be-conducted-at-fish-stalls-markets/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The use of facemasks remains mandatory in public.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175517/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/454241/sri-lanka-government-maintaining-coronavirus-related-measures-as-of-march-12-update-42  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reduced monetary policy rates by 100 basis points since March. The required reserve ratio on domestic currency deposits of commercial banks has been lowered by one percentage point, the liquidity coverage ratio and net stable funding ratios have been reduced to 90 percent and the rate at which CBSL grants advances to commercial banks has been lowered by 500 basis points. Commercial banks cannot declare dividends, share buy backs or increase payments to directors until end-2020. The President announced a debt repayment moratorium, which includes a six month moratorium on bank loans for the tourism, garment, plantation and IT sectors, and small & medium industries, with reduced rate working capital loans and investment-purpose loans for these sectors. There will also be a three-month moratorium on small-value personal banking and leasing loans. The interest rate on credit cards will be capped, for transactions up to a certain amount, with a reduction in the minimum monthly repayment. Financial institutions are also requested to reschedule non-performing loans. Lower capital conservation buffer requirements and a relaxation of loan classification rules have been announced. In addition, state-owned institutions will invest in treasury securities to stabilize the money market rate at 7 percent.    http://archive.fo/nKJdw
notes_C3: As of May 1st, there is a general ban on public events and gatherings, which includes weddings and religious sites. This will be until 21.05.21 when the decision will be reviewed     see here: see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210502171414/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/sri-lanka-issues-new-tough-guidelines-amid-spike-in-covid-19-cases/article34462911.ece    The British Government website also indicates that Public gatherings such as exhibitions, conferences, parties, indoor and outdoor events, carnivals, musical shows and processions have been banned    https://web.archive.org//web/20210502173627/http://www.colombopage.com/archive_21A/May01_1619881000CH.php
notes_C6: Is a curfew in place? No.  In case of an increase in cases, Sri Lankan authorities will enact short-notice curfews and travel restrictions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: On 21st the reopening of the international airport was noted, allowing for tourists. A PCR test is required upon arrival, followed by another on the seventh day of the visit. In addition, guests must remain confined to one hotel for a period of 14 days before allowed to travel around the country freely and in accordance with regional Covid rules.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210408031531/https://www.ttgasia.com/2021/04/07/sri-lanka-eases-quarantine-rules-for-vaccinated-tourists/
notes_C2: Is a curfew in place? No.    Additionally, movement, business, and gathering restrictions are in force across high-risk areas; areas recently or currently designated as high-risk include parts of Ampara, Colombo, Gampaha, Kalutara, Kandy, Kurunegala, and Puttalam districts. Under curfew restrictions, all nonessential businesses except for specifically-permitted industries must close in designated areas. Essential shops, such as pharmacies and grocery stores, may open intermittently or provide delivery services.   Most businesses have resumed operations. Schools and universities have begun phased re-opening.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175517/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/454241/sri-lanka-government-maintaining-coronavirus-related-measures-as-of-march-12-update-42
notes_C4: All public events and gatherings have been banned as of May 1st due to a spike in cases    see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210502171414/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/sri-lanka-issues-new-tough-guidelines-amid-spike-in-covid-19-cases/article34462911.ece    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502172248/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sri-lanka/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org//web/20210502173627/http://www.colombopage.com/archive_21A/May01_1619881000CH.php
notes_H3: Government issues initial testing and contact tracing protocols. https://web.archive.org/web/20200329223450/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/images/pdf/Circulars/Corona_virus/revisionsummary.pdf
notes_H8: Most nonessential public gatherings are banned. Capacity controls continue at hospitality venues and on private transport. The use of facemasks remains mandatory in public. All private and public organizations must collect and update employee details to facilitate contact tracing if and when necessary. Authorities may reintroduce or implement stricter nationwide measures in the coming days and weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175517/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/454241/sri-lanka-government-maintaining-coronavirus-related-measures-as-of-march-12-update-42
notes_C1: following a spike in cases, schools in the Western Province and the North Western Province are closed until further notice     see here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210502171414/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/sri-lanka-issues-new-tough-guidelines-amid-spike-in-covid-19-cases/article34462911.ece    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502172908/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/sri-lanka-braces-for-imminent-third-covid-19-wave/article34417392.ece    https://web.archive.org//web/20210502173627/http://www.colombopage.com/archive_21A/May01_1619881000CH.php
notes_H7: COVID-19 vaccines are available in Sri Lanka to citizens and resident visa holders.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175656/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Lesotho
