notes_C2: As from 26th April 2020, non-essential shops providing goods and services which were forced to shut down on 11th March 2021, will now be allowed to re-open.  However, restaurants, bars and gyms remain closed.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210426061302/https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/108815/live_prime_minister_unveils_plan_to_lift_covid19_measures__staggered_reopenning_for_schools
notes_C4: Malta restricts gatherings to fewer than 10 people, then to 6.    source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217065445/https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/105023/covid19_group_gatherings_in_public_spaces_reduced_to_10_people
notes_H3: Maltese authorities prepared for eventual outbreaks from January. In fact, when the first cases popped up in March, comprehensive contact tracing took place for each case.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217080015/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/January/19/pr200063.aspx
notes_E1: A wage supplement is introduced on 18th March 2020. This is committed to be provided at least till March 2021.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201217072939/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/March/18/pr200520.aspx
notes_H8: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217084731/https://www.gov.mt/en/Government/DOI/Press%20Releases/Pages/2020/May/22/pr200977en.aspx
notes_C1: Schools Start to re-open gradually.  Monday, April 12:   • Childcare centres, kindergartens, primary schools reopen   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409115241/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/abela-fearne-gauci-announce-covid-easing-measures-schools.863055
notes_H7: As from 10th April 2021, The Maltese government announced that the vaccine programme is now extended. Apart from the three groups of people who are already being administered the vaccine (Key workers, clinically vulnerable groups, elderly groups), the vaccine is now broadly available to anyone who wishes to be vaccinated. For now this is limited to those aged over 50. This will be then extended to younger individuals.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210411070025/https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/chris-fearne-covid-19-vaccines-vaccination-strategy-malta-health.863757
notes_C5: Public transport operational as per normal, apart from some small requirements such as mask wearing.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201217070503/https://www.maltachamber.org.mt/en/malta-public-transport-releases-new-summer-schedule-with-436-additional-trips-per-day

name: Myanmar
notes_H1: On March 9th, the Ministry of Health and Sports launched an awareness campaign and COVID-19 tracking website.     They are:   "-publishing situation reports about Myanmar and other countries in the state-owned newspapers and the internet website of the Ministry (www.mohs.gov.mm) and social media pages (https://www.facebook.com/ MinistryOfHealthAndSportsMyanmar) and (https://www.facebook.com/ MyanmarCDC) , with taking response to the fake news  -coordination with relevant government agencies to lessen socioeconomic impacts resulted from COVID-19.  -awareness programmes with the use of handheld loudspeakers at the crowded places in Regions and States such as bus gates and markets, in cooperation with Myanmar Red Cross Society , civil society organizations and community based organizations."  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200604172504/https://www.globalnewlightofmyanmar.com/report-on-coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19-3/    COVID-19 tracking website: https://web.archive.org/web/20200320234718/https://mohs.gov.mm/Main/content/publication/2019-ncov
notes_H2: According to the US Embassy,     "Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Burma?  If so, are test results reliably available with 72 hours? – YES        Testing is available at the following locations:      Air Cargo Terminal at Yangon International Airport: located on Pyay Road near the Than Pin Gone bus stop. It is located near the DHL Myanmar warehouse at the airport, which is searchable in Google Maps.      Swab collections for PCR tests occur daily from 9:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. with results available the next day by 9:30 a.m.      The cost of the PCR test is 200,000 MMK.      Telephone numbers: 094 4409 9941 / 094 4409 9942 (*We have received reports that phone inquiries may not be answered, but the facility remains open).      N Health: located in Yangon at the Tourist Burma Building on the corner of Maha Bandula St. and Sule Paya St. (near Sule Pagoda).      Swab collections for PCR tests occur daily from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m. with PCR results available within 24 hours.      The cost of the PCR test is 200,000 MMK.      Telephone numbers: 01 230 3202 / 09 519 9122      Pun Hlaing Hospital: located in Yangon on Pun Hlaing Estate Avenue, Hlaing Tharyar Township, as well as at Pun Hlaing Clinic Downtown Yangon, No. 14/A, Taw Win Street (Corner of Ambassador St and Taw Win St), Dagon Township.      PCR and antigen tests are provided. Please call or register online at least 24 hours in advance.      The cost of the antigen test is 45,000 MMK and the PCR test is 200,000 MMK.      Telephone number: 09 40 060 222      Samitivej International Clinic: located in Yangon at 9E/2 Kabar Aye Pagoda Road, Mayangone Township.      Requirements: copy of air ticket and copy of passport.      Swab collections occur daily from 7:30 a.m. until 10:30 a.m. with results available within 30 hours (via email with hard copy also available for pickup). Please call first before visiting the clinic.      The cost is 420,000 MMK (includes doctor consultation, Fit to Fly certificate, sample collection fees, lab test) or at-home sample collection is available (includes doctor consultation, Fit to Fly certificate, sample collection fees, transportation fees, lab test). Please contact the clinic for at-home pricing.      Antigen tests are also available. Please contact the clinic for details.      Telephone numbers: 01 656 732 / 01 660 545 / 09 42427 4301      International SOS Clinic: located in Yangon at Inya Lake Hotel, 37 Kaba Aye Pagoda Road.      Swab collections for PCR tests are by appointment only. Please call the clinic for more information.      International SOS will set up a tele-consultation with a doctor three days before your flight, with swab collection two days before your flight, and results available the day before your flight.      The cost of the tele-consultation is $63 USD, the PCR swab collection is $55 USD, and the cost for processing of the PCR test result is $143 USD.      Telephone numbers: 01 657 922 / 09 420 114 536      Email: reception.ygn@internationalsos.com      Note: This information may change frequently and without notice. Those seeking a test are advised to contact the lab first before showing up to check on the most recent requirements, policies, and operating hours, or contact us at ACSRangoon@state.gov."    However it is unclear if this information remains true (and has not been updated) since the coup d'état.    See the US Embassy's website, archived at https://archive.vn/o0WBl
notes_C7: According to the US Embassy in Yangon,    "Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? – YES        Some domestic flights have resumed in Burma. Contact domestic airlines for details about COVID-19 related travel procedures.      Burmese authorities announced stay-at-home orders for all of Yangon Region (except for Coco Island), effective at 8:00 AM on September 21, 2020.    Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work, 2.) employees of private organizations and businesses must telework (those working in banking and finance, gas stations, food and refrigeration services, production and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, medical equipment production, and the distribution of drinking water and personal hygiene items are exempt), 3.) only one person per household allowed for grocery shopping, 3.) only two people per household allowed for medical treatment, 4.) a mask must be worn at all times when out of the home, 5.) only vehicles transporting people for one of the permitted activities are allowed to pass through other townships, 6.) in addition to the passenger(s), only one driver is allowed in a vehicle for the permitted activities, and 7.) advance approval from the respective ward administration is needed for anything that falls outside of these permitted activities. Failure to comply with this order will warrant action under the Prevention and Control of Communicable Diseases Law.    Travel restrictions and mandatory public health measures are in force in most parts of Burma. U.S. citizens travelling or resident anywhere in Burma should ensure they have the latest information on COVID-19 prevention measures in the locations they plan to visit, or currently reside in. Note that new measures may be put into place with little or no advance notice."    See the US Embassy's website, archived at https://archive.vn/o0WBl
notes_H6: According to the US Embassy in Yangon,    "Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work,...  4.) a mask must be worn at all times when out of the home... Failure to comply with this order will warrant action under the Prevention and Control of Communicable Diseases Law."    See the US Embassy's website, archived at https://archive.vn/o0WBl
notes_E2: This seems like it should be coded as 2. For example, according to the IMF, as of October 8 2020, there were measures in place including: exemptions and subsidies of household electricity charges (MMK 109 billion); deferment of income and commercial tax payments due in the second and third quarters of the fiscal year to end of FY 19/20. See https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  [accessed 19 October 2020, web archive unavailable]
notes_C3: The military regime has instituted a ban on gatherings of five or more people, and a nationwide curfew from 8:00 P.M. until 4:00 A.M. that supersedes previous COVID-19 policies.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322060444/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Residents of Yangon Region must abide by the following orders: 1.) stay at home unless going to/from work, 2.) employees of private organizations and businesses must telework (those working in banking and finance, gas stations, food and refrigeration services, production and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, medical equipment production, and the distribution of drinking water and personal hygiene items are exempt), 3.) only one person per household allowed for grocery shopping, 3.) only two people per household allowed for medical treatment, 4.) a mask must be worn at all times when out of the home, 5.) only vehicles transporting people for one of the permitted activities are allowed to pass through other townships, 6.) in addition to the passenger(s), only one driver is allowed in a vehicle for the permitted activities,  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412175701/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: C8 : updated to 4 from 3 as the land and air borders are closed as per link below.    Effective March 30, the Burmese government will no longer allow international commercial passenger flights to land at any airport in Burma. This suspension will last through November 30  On March 19, the Burmese government announced the temporary suspension of entry and exit of foreign nationals through land borders.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109171739/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: On the 25th of September the Ministry of Health and Sports issued an order effective 26th September that, people residing in 11 townships of the four state and regions are required for “Stay-at-Home” in order to effectively control the spread of the disease.   Those who need to perform their duties at government departments, banking services, filling stations, private-rum ports, communication businesses, food production, production and distribution of medical supplies and drinking water, factories of daily personal hygiene products and related businesses are excluded. Civil servants are to rotate on a 2-week for office attendance and 2-week on work-from-home basis.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201006141131/https://www.moi.gov.mm/moi:eng/announcements/1545
notes_C4: The military regime has instituted a ban on gatherings of five or more people, and a nationwide curfew from 8:00 P.M. until 4:00 A.M. that supersedes previous COVID-19 policies.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322060444/https://mm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: No legitimate sources to indicate either way at the point, due to the media blackout as a result of the coup d'état.
notes_E1: E1 : updated to 1A from 1F as the relief is being provided to everyone in the "vulnerable" category.    In-kind and cash transfers to the *most vulnerable* population (MMK 325 billion)    Insured Fund for Workers: The Social Security Board, under the Ministry of Labor, Immigration and Population, will pay 40 percent of the salary to insured workers, as a family assistance fund, in accordance with the Social Security Law.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201029172716/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: More than 380000 people over the age of 65 years has been vaccinated  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412181318/https://www.mmtimes.com/news/more-380000-myanmar-receive-covid-19-vaccine.html
notes_C1: The government of Myanmar ordered all schools, including private ones, to close from 26 August. The date for re-opening has not yet been announced  https://web.archive.org/web/20200909015440/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/myanmar/coronavirus
notes_H7: A- Key workers, B- Clinically vulnerable groups  Myanmar receives free first batch of Covid-19, AstraZeneca’s vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India. This is a gift from India to Myanmar  More than 110000 Healthcare workers and volunteers will be vaccinated as part of the initial phase. This will be followed by the government official and the elderly over the age of 65.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/myanmar-receives-first-batch-of-covid-19-vaccines-from-india-942168.html  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.mmtimes.com/news/40pc-myanmars-population-be-vaccinated-against-covid-19-2021.html
notes_C5: On the 25th of September the Ministry of Health and Sports issued an order effective 26th September that, people residing in 11 townships of the four state and regions are required for “Stay-at-Home” in order to effectively control the spread of the disease.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201006141131/https://www.moi.gov.mm/moi:eng/announcements/1545

name: Mongolia
notes_H2: Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in?Mongolia??Yes???  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours??Yes??  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: [[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April. Internal travel, including within Ulaanbaatar, will be prohibited with exceptions only for emergency vehicles and funerals.' All domestic flights are cancelled.    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_H6: No update in policy.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: On March 27, a comprehensive set of fiscal measures for consideration has been proposed by the cabinet to protect vulnerable household and businesses and to support the economy. These include: (i) ... and (iv) an increase in credit guarantees to SMEs and soft loans from the development bank to cashmere producers. On April 13, Parliament approved tax exemption measures as proposed by the cabinet.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200723211732/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.mongolbank.mn/eng/news.aspx?tid=1&id=2489
notes_C3: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April.' Public events are not allowed during lockdown.    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_C6: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April.'    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_C8: The Government of Mongolia has decided to temporarily suspend entry of all passengers through all border checkpoints until 30 April 2020.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200517094042/http://embassyofmongolia.co.uk/?p=3265&lang=en
notes_C2: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April. ... Essential services such as grocery stores, pharmacies and hospitals will remain open throughout.'    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_C4: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April.' Gatherings are extremely restricted during lockdown.    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_H3: Mongolia is doing contact tracing through scanning QR codes at public places. Recently, the government has introduced the Exposure Notification System   https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426080044/https://montsame.mn/en/read/260941
notes_E1: No update in policy.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210503033812/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: The State of All-Out-Readiness ends on Feb 23 and the curfew in the capital has been lifted. Citizens, businesses, and organizations have returned to normal work and life.   Link: https://archive.vn/5Y993
notes_C1: '[D]ue to a rise in COVID-19 cases the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under lockdown and a “red all-out-readiness” status from 10 to 25 April.' Schools are closed during lockdown.    https://archive.vn/79EyE
notes_H7: Mongolia is currently administering the Pfizer, AstraZeneca,?Sinopharm, and Sputnik V vaccines.?  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426075432/https://mn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Due to the rising number of COVID-19 cases, the government reimposed the local quarantine on April 12th and re-extended it until May 8th.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210426074637/https://mn.usembassy.gov/alert-lockdown-extended-until-may-8-2021/

name: Mozambique
notes_H1: Ongoing communication campaign on the official government website.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210416071544/https://covid19.ins.gov.mz/
notes_H2: No changes.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210504121923/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: In the Greater Maputo area and all provincial capitals there is a curfew in place from 10 p.m. to 4 a.m. every night.  The curfew also applies in Manhiça, Chokwe, Maxixe, Gondola, Moatize, Mocuba, Nacala, Montepuez, and Massinga.  Is a curfew in place? Yes  But there are no restrictions on intercity travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165431/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: 5th May 2020, the Mozambican government tightened the preventive measures against the Covic-19 pandemic, by making it obligatory to wear face masks in public places and in any gatherings of people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200901074214/https://clubofmozambique.com/news/mozambique-masks-now-obligatory-in-public-places-aim-report-159431/
notes_C3: Gatherings of more than 20 people are banned   https://web.archive.org/web/20200816123245/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/mozambique/coronavirus
notes_C6: All persons displaying respiratory symptoms or fever must stay home.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210504121923/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: "On December 17, President Nyusi announced revised COVID-19 measures effective December 19. These measures include:    - All persons arriving in Mozambique must present a PCR negative test result undertaken in the country of origin up to 96 hours prior to departure;   -Tourist and visitor visas will be re-issued at all operational border posts"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231180619if_/https://www.facebook.com/pg/CanadainMozambique/posts/
notes_C2: Commercial establishments will be open from 9 a.m. – 7 p.m. Monday – Saturday, and 9 a.m. – 6 p.m. on Sunday. Restaurants may remain open until 8 p.m. every day. Recreational and leisure sports and games are prohibited. Casinos, museums, theaters, galleries, and similar cultural venues may open up to 40% capacity. Discos, bars and stalls selling alcoholic beverages will remain closed.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165431/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426165338/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/466831/mozambique-authorities-maintain-covid-19-restrictions-as-of-april-14-update-13
notes_C4: The SOPC (State of Public Calamity) will allow for the gradual resumption of the following activities:  - Private social events are permitted with up to 40 attendees  - Religious services are permitted at 50 percent capacity, up to 150 attendees  - Public and private institutions can conduct operations in conformance with social distancing and preventative measures including temperature checks, regular cleaning of facilities, ventilation, prohibition of sick staff entering facilities, and a limit of 40 people for events  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115131525/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: Contact tracing for the first case in the country: The patient has mild symptoms, is in isolation at home and is undergoing clinical follow-up by the country's health authorities. At this moment, contacts are being tracked for the purposes of monitoring the transmission of the virus. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506214722/http://www.misau.gov.mz/index.php/100-primeiro-caso-de-coronavirus-confirmado-hoje-em-mocambique
notes_H8: All elderly people who is displaying respiratory symptoms or fever must stay home, as noted in C6 column.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210504121923/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: Note: face-to-face classes at all educational institutions are permitted to resume on March 7, 2021.    Link:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314223217/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: The groups that are receiving the vaccine are the following: A; B and C.    The vaccine is Covishield.      The vaccines were donated by Covax Initiative and  the Indian Government.    Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20210314230600/https://www.misau.gov.mz/index.php/403-assista-ao-vivo-a-cerimonia-de-lancamento-do-plano-nacional-de-vacinacao-contra-a-covid-19;  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314232030/https://observador.pt/2021/03/08/covid-19-mocambique-recebe-mais-484-mil-doses-e-inicia-vacinacao/
notes_C5: "On September 7, Mozambique transitioned from a State of Emergency (SOE) to a State of Public Calamity (SOPC) [will be in place for an indefinite period].  The SOPC will continue indefinitely at the red alert level while the risk of spreading COVID-19 exists in Mozambique and preserves many of the SOE COVID-19 prevention measures with gradual resumption of social and economic activities in coordination with health authorities.    During the SOPC the following prevention measures remain in effect:  (....)  Passenger limits for buses, vans, and other methods of public transportation"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201028113637/https://mz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201028114857/https://www.dw.com/pt-002/covid-19-estado-de-calamidade-p%C3%BAblica-declarado-em-mo%C3%A7ambique/a-54822206

notes_C4: "Large gatherings are no longer allowed."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323073129/https://mr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

notes_E1: The code has been changed from 1A to 0, from June 26th; the financial support to 30,000 families announced on March 25th, due to last 3 months, was no longer current after the June 25th, and no new income support policies have been found. notes_H7: Mauritania began its COVID-19 vaccination campaign in late March as a shipment of 50,000 doses arrived from China.    President Mohamed Ould Ghazouani supervised the process, which took place in the National Hospital Centre in the capital Nouakchott.    According to the country's state news agency, Nouakchott's medical staff will get the jabs first, followed by medical staff in all other cities and people with chronic diseases and vulnerable groups. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210406043506/https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20210326-mauritania-begins-covid-vaccine-campaign/

name: Mauritius
notes_H1: Mobile app launched on 26th March: https://web.archive.org/save/https://defimedia.info/besafemoris-une-application-gratuite-pour-des-informations-officielles-sur-le-covid-19
notes_H2: On April 27, mass testing for antigens was initiated.  https://archive.vn/usdt8#selection-16039.25-16041.53  COVID-19 tests are available at the C-Lab laboratory at Wellkin Hospital on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 09:00 to 12:00. Patients must dial 605-1000 to book an appointment.  Results are available within 48 hours.  Cost of Rs.2500 (approximately $60 USD) must be paid in full by the patient.  Visit Wellkin Hospital’s COVID-19 announcement (French) for additional information.  https://archive.vn/Nd7GC#selection-1845.0-1849.37
notes_C7: Recommended not to leave the house unless necessary, all public transport still running, no restrictions on internal movement (see government graphic in article).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210503065537/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503071444/https://www.lexpress.mu/article/392489/covid-19-deuxieme-phase-deconfinement-partir-1er-mai-jusquau-1er-juin
notes_H6: Per the government announcement in the below article, face masks should be worn. The terms and conditions of the moratoriums remained unchanged. On December 2, these, together with a number of other measures falling under the Support Program, were further extended to June 30, 2021. https://archive.vn/usdt8#selection-16089.283-16089.420

notes_C8: Until the 16th of April, no passengers will be aloud entry into Mauritius.   US Embassy - "Effective March 10, 2021, international flight arrivals have been suspended until further notice; however there are limited commercial flight departures"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210402235137/https://www.mymauritius.travel/mauritius-travel-alerts  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405155038/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Per the official announcement graphic in the below article, certain businesses i.e. Beauty Salons, Dentists, are open, but others like gyms, shops, cultural activities, cinemas, schools are all required to remain closed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210503071444/https://www.lexpress.mu/article/392489/covid-19-deuxieme-phase-deconfinement-partir-1er-mai-jusquau-1er-juin
notes_C4: Is a curfew in place? Yes  https://archive.ph/7YQj1#selection-1987.0-1989.3   All religious and sociocultural activities are cancelled. https://archive.ph/HJ3LX#selection-2621.225-2621.282  Cultural and sports events will be cancelled and there is a restriction on numbers at marriages and funerals.  https://archive.ph/4VN9n#selection-679.617-679.727
notes_H3: It seems like contract tracing is comprehensive rather than limited. Since the time the number of cases climbed steadily and reached 128 on 30 March, health services prioritised contact tracing to identify people to test – that is, people who had been in physical contact with infected and identified patients – while anybody who had been quarantined and showed symptoms suggestive of COVID-19 infection was also tested. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20200521205121/https://voxeu.org/article/mauritian-response-covid-19
notes_E1: ii) Employment Support Scheme for SMEs to support 11,000 employees with a monthly payment of Rs10,200 per capita; iii) Recruitment by Landscope (Mtius) Ltd of some 2,000 technically unemployed people for the National Clean-Up Campaign;  https://archive.vn/usdt8#selection-16063.1533-16063.2558
notes_H8: https://archive.ph/FuutQ#selection-2783.0-2783.24  Measures for the elderly:    Carer’s benefitting from Carer’s Allowance can apply for Work Access Permit so as to provide assistance to bedridden elders and the carer will have to be vaccinated.  Banks to provide a special counter to elderly.  For elders who receive their pensions from Post Offices and are encountering difficulties to fetch same, may request the Ministry of Social Security and National solidarity to home-deliver their pensions.
notes_C1: As part of the restrictions, all activities will remain closed except for the police, port, airport, fire services, health, pharmacy, and security services. https://archive.ph/HJ3LX#selection-2605.0-2605.156  Effective March 10, 2021, the government of Mauritius has announced a nation-wide period of confinement until March 25thin response to COVID-19. All schools, public places including beaches, shopping centers, and restaurants are closed until March 25th. name: Malawi
notes_H1: Government twitter feed   https://twitter.com/MalawiGovt and health department https://twitter.com/health_malawi
notes_H2: Covid Testing is provided by the main hospitals and laboratories. It is available to symptomatic and asymptomatic people for the average cost of $92 USD.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210502113108/https://mw.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Face coverings have been advised in public, but are not mandatory.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210427145807/https://mw.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: https://archive.vn/VycBW  No policy change - No evidence that the executive order of subsidised maize prices for 'this season' has ended

notes_C6: There no longer appears to be any evidence of a curfew in place and no other stay at home requirements are apparent.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210502113108/https://mw.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: All land borders remain closed except for essential goods transporters, deportees, and those in special circumstances. Malawians and residents can return to Malawi upon production of an original certified negative COVID-19 test result. Foreigners may not travel to Malawi via land borders. https://archive.vn/lUzXo#selection-2171.2-2171.290  International Flights are operating - Are U.S. citizens permitted to enter? Yes https://archive.vn/lUzXo#selection-2439.0-2441.3
