In recent weeks, several unauthorized mass parties have been detected, which the government considers are the greatest risk ahead and put the transitory health status of the country at risk, stressed the Secretary of the Presidency, Álvaro Delgado.    “The Executive Power through the Ministry of Public Health and according to the legal mandate of the Organic Law of Public Health must adopt, immediately, before the violation of the sanitary provisions, all the measures at its disposal to keep the country harmless or reduce the risks of the effects of the pandemic ”, explained the prosecutor Rodrigo Ferrés.    The fines may range from 37 thousand pesos to one million three hundred thousand. The Executive Power may close establishments and file police and prosecutorial complaints in cases of contempt.    The Minister of Health, Daniel Salinas, explained why the risk of a massive adult party is different than that of a children's party protocolized by the Ministry and other activities that have been devised opening in recent times, such as restaurants, hotels, some shows, and also the Rural del Prado."    (Since not all shows have been authorized I have coded this indicator as 2G)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018230001/https://radiouruguay.uy/fiestas-no-autorizadas-se-aplicaran-multas-sanciones-y-denuncias-penales/
notes_C6: According to the government news, the president said that the Government "defends tooth and nail" not to establish a mandatory confinement of the population. "The 'stay at home' is worn out, everyone knows what they can do," said Lacalle Pou. "If people can stay at home, let them stay, but it is not mandatory," which indicates recommended but not required stay-at-home measure.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid
notes_C8: From December 21 to January 10, 2021, border will be closed, entry to the country will be suspended, except for Uruguayans who have purchased their ticket on December 16, and the transport of cargo.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221025342/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/larranaga-garcia-torre-ejecutiva-conferencia  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid   http://web.archive.org/web/20201229065720/https://uy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201020201228/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-exterior-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_C2: Bars, Pubs and restaurants can be open until midnight. Governmental offices, food courts in Shopping Centres, gyms, clubs and touristic sites shall be closed.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210416162553/https://medios.presidencia.gub.uy/legal/2021/decretos/03/cons_min_418.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20210416172536/https://medios.presidencia.gub.uy/legal/2021/decretos/04/cons_min_424.pdf
notes_C4: A battery of strict measures to prevent an increase in COVID-19 infections take effect on December 21, including “private meetings may not exceed ten people”.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201228231706/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-Sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_H3: The Ministry of Public Health announced it would trace individuals coming from high risk areas. https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html (Archived version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200417034706/https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html)
notes_E1: The Executive Power, through the Ministry of Labor and Social Security, created a special unemployment subsidy scheme for private-sector workers affected by the health emergency due to the COVID-19 disease. The subsidy to be received will be up to 25% of the monthly average of the computable nominal salaries received in the six full months of effective work prior to setting the cause, depending on the number of days of suspension or reduction. As of April, the amount to be received, which includes the subsidy and the amount paid by the company for the period actually worked, will in no case be less than 75% of the average monthly wages of the last six months taken for the profit calculation.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210416204720/https://www.bps.gub.uy/16874/subsidio-especial-por-desempleo-parcial.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210416193621/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H8: Although this policy has not been broadly explained, the Ministry of Public Health and the Ministry of Social Development are coordinating inspections on long-stay centres for the elderly.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210417222641/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-desarrollo-social/comunicacion/comunicados/comunicado-sobre-estafas-establecimientos-larga-estadia-para-personas   http://web.archive.org/web/20210417222844/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-Sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_C1: Since March 23, 2021: "Face-to-face education will be suspended at all levels of education until inclusive Tourism Week. The post-presence return will be progressive, starting with initial education."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330050115/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-educacion-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_H7: All groups are being vaccinated with AstraZeneca, Pfizer/BioNTech or Coronavac, as follows: population over 50 years old; clinically vulnerable persons between 18 and 70 years old and key works who didn't get a dose previously.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210417215726/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/plan-estrategico-vacunacion-contra-covid-19  http://web.archive.org/web/20210417215508/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/sites/ministerio-salud-publica/files/documentos/noticias/PLAN%20ESTRATEGICO%20VACUNACION%20COVID%2015.4.2021.pdf
notes_C5: Public transportation is open with masks and social distancing measures. To prevent the spread of COVID-19, the measure of limiting passenger capacity in interdepartmental transport units to 50% began to take effect from December 21 through January 10, 2021.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064206/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/mtop-transporte-distancia-olaizola-protocolo  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064449/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-transporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19

name: United States
notes_H1: The President's Coronavirus Guidelines for America https://web.archive.org/web/20200322010504/https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/03.16.20_coronavirus-guidance_8.5x11_315PM.pdf
notes_H2: First drive-through testing site introduced in New York    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19
notes_C7: Travel restrictions vary from state to state. Some states have removed all statewide travel restrictions. Some states still recommend quarantine upon arrival from another state. Some states offer exemptions to those who are vaccinated or have a recent negative COVID test.    For example, Rhode Island requires travellers to the state to fill out a COVID-19 Travel Screening Form and failure to comply with quarantine can result in a $500 fine.     Could not find evidence for any states fully restricting entry from other states, so code changed to 1G to reflect quarantine/testing requirements of some states and CDC recommendations for travel.    Link to CNN article on travel restrictions by state (last updated 27 March 2021):  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329160222/https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/us-state-travel-restrictions-covid-19/index.html    Link to CDC travel guidelines:  https://archive.vn/XOhXC    Link to RI travel screening webpage:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210328065422/https://covid.ri.gov/travel-screening
notes_H6: Governor Wolf in Pennsylvania:    Expanding on the business safety order signed by Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine in April that requires the wearing of masks in businesses, Governor Tom Wolf today announced a new order signed by Dr. Levine that takes the mask-wearing directive one step further.    With this order, signed under Dr. Levine’s authority under the Disease Prevention and Control Act, masks must be worn whenever anyone leaves home. The order takes effect immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200923054840/https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/gov-wolf-sec-of-health-signs-expanded-mask-wearing-order/
notes_E2: CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, implemented targeted debt relief based on Federal jurisdiction (e.g. eviction freezes for federal housing programs, mortgage forbearance for federally-backed mortgages, etc.). Primary source (U.S. House of Representatives, Financial Services Committee, archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430040220/https://financialservices.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=406472    Debt/contract relief also implemented at state level (e.g. eviction freezes, rent increase freezes, utility bill late charge waivers, etc.), but case-specific and not captured in this coding scheme.
notes_C3: Many states continue to ease COVID-19 restrictions on public gatherings and are gradually allowing many public event venues to open with a specified percentage of original capacity. Code changed to 1G to reflect this.    Link to Husch-Blackwell state-by-state COVID-19 policies:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329165030/https://www.huschblackwell.com/state-by-state-covid-19-guidance  Link to AARP article on state-by-state restrictions:  https://archive.vn/dKWcn
notes_C6: As of March 4th, no generally applicable curfews are in force. In at least one state (South Dakota) the elderly and other vulnerable individuals are encouraged to stay at home.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308020436/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_C8: As of March 2, foreign nationals who have travelled to Iran within the past 14 days are denied permission to enter the US.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410104600/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/coronavirus-travel-restrictions/
notes_C2: Many states are allowing businesses to reopen at specified capacity restrictions and/or closing-time restrictions. However, because no states seem to be requiring specific sectors to remain completely closed, the code has been changed to 1G. If evidence to the contrary is found, please change code.    Link to Husch-Blackwell state-by-state COVID-19 policies:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329165030/https://www.huschblackwell.com/state-by-state-covid-19-guidance  Link to AARP article on state-by-state restrictions:  https://archive.vn/dKWcn
notes_C4: Alabama, Idaho, Indiana, Missouri and South Dakota allow gatherings of any size, while other states have very strict measures in place. The most restrictive are New Mexico with max 5 people and Oregon with max 6 people from max 2 households.     Overview (last updated Nov 17): http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193939/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases  New Mexico: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/  Oregon: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193338/https://govstatus.egov.com/OR-OHA-COVID-19
notes_H3: "Contact tracing was used in Seattle and parts of California early on in their coronavirus outbreaks, but as community spread took hold, many cities and states switched to a "mitigation" approach, like closing schools and other social distancing measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010434/https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/04/10/831200054/cdc-director-very-aggressive-contact-tracing-needed-for-u-s-to-return-to-normal
notes_E1: Unemployment insurance in the U.S. is state-specific, but overseen by the U.S. Dept. of Labor. On average, unemployment insurance replaces ~50% of lost wages for a finite period of time. The CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, boosted unemployment benefits by supplementing state benefits with $600 per week, and expanding eligibility to individuals that normally don't qualify for unemployment insurance (e.g. gig workers & independent contractors). Secondary source, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430034950/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/policy-basics-unemployment-insurance    The CARES Act also established a low-interest, forgivable loan program for small businesses to help keep employees on payroll. Primary source, U.S. Small Business Administration, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430035544/https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program
notes_H8: On March 13, CMS issued guidance that advised nursing homes to restrict visitors, helping prevent introduction of the virus into these facilities. CMS released a Guidance for Infection Control and Prevention of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Nursing Homes.   “Facilities should restrict visitation of all visitors and non-essential health care personnel (“HCP”), except for certain compassionate care situations, such as an end-of-life situation.” In end-of-life situations, visitors should be limited to a specific room. LTC Facilities are expected to convey these restrictions to potential visitors and advise they defer visitation until further notice. CMS also noted that if a state were to further limit visitation to apply even in end-of-life situations, a LTC Facilities’ compliance with the state requirement would not result in a citation for noncompliance with CMS’s visitation requirements.  Source - https://archive.vn/AbZ50    Refer to link for the CMS Guidance document. http://web.archive.org/web/20201216063424/https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-20-14-nh-revised.pdf
notes_C1: "Kentucky public schools had to offer at least two days of in-person instruction each week starting March 29. The requirement was the result of HB 208, which Governor Andy Beshear signed on March 4... Parents could still keep their children in fully remote learning.  Oregon public elementary schools had to reopen no later than March 29 for hybrid or full-time in-person instruction. Parents could still keep their children in fully remote instruction."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210414231916/https://ballotpedia.org/School_responses_to_the_coronavirus_%28COVID-19%29_pandemic_during_the_2020-2021_academic_year
notes_H7: As of Monday 19th April , CDC announces that COVID-19 vaccines are available to every American over 16years who wants a shot.   CDC - https://web.archive.org/web/20210421023256/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/How-Do-I-Get-a-COVID-19-Vaccine.html     The White House press briefing - https://web.archive.org/web/20210421024446/https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/press-briefings/2021/04/19/press-briefing-by-white-house-covid-19-response-team-and-public-health-officials-30/     Reuters - https://web.archive.org/web/20210421023909/https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-cdc-expands-covid-19-vaccine-eligibility-16-older-2021-04-20/
notes_C5: Across the country, public transport is operating but at reduced capacity.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201123194911/https://time.com/5869375/public-transit-coronavirus-covid/

name: Uzbekistan
notes_H1: Government launched an official website with up-to-date information on fighting Coronavirus: https://web.archive.org/save/https://coronavirus.uz/ru
notes_H2: Individuals showing symptoms undergo testing through government facility as per update  Quote: "Individuals who are showing COVID-19 symptoms will undergo testing at government facilities."    Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502231541/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uzbekistan/coronavirus  ___________________________________________________________  Quote: "COVID-19 Testing:  Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Uzbekistan?  Yes   If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours?  Yes    COVID-19 PCR tests are available at clinics and medical facilities throughout Uzbekistan.  The cost of testing is typically between 200,000 and 350,000 Uzbekistani Soum ($20-$35 USD), and is paid by the patient prior to testing. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210502214431/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: From 15 August onwards, restrictions on movement between regions are lifted. See local news agency Gazeta website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201112100715/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/10/quarantine/
notes_H6: Masks must be worn in public.  source:  https://archive.vn/eZ6Zt
notes_E2: Government assistance (e.g. Anti-Crisis fund) provided (since 2020 and continuing on into 2021) for several different areas including individual loan repayments.    ______________________________________________  Quote from linked article 1:  "Liquidity support   On 14 April 2020, the Central Bank of the Republic of Uzbekistan (the “Central Bank”) has reduced the refinancing rate from 16% to 15% to stimulate liquidity support for the economy due to financial crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic.     Under the Decree 5978, the Central Bank has:   allowed the extension of loan repayments by individuals and individual entrepreneurs due in the next six months of 2020 valued at UZS 4.7 trillion (equivalent of USD 470 million)."    and    "the deadline for payment of property tax and land tax for individuals is extended until 15 October 2020;    Individuals have been granted the right to an interest-free deferral (installment plan) of tax payments, accrued on income from personal real estate leased to individuals and commercial real estate leased to businesses affected during the quarantine period, until 1 April 2021;"    Web archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051226/https://www.whitecase.com/publications/alert/covid-19-uzbekistan-government-financial-assistance-measures  _______________________________________________________________________________    Quote from linked article 2:  "The authorities also temporary reduced social contributions for individual entrepreneurs, postponed the payment of property and land taxes, extended a moratorium on tax audits, and delayed tax declarations for 2019 income taxes. The central government also asked local governments to reduce taxes by 30 percent and provide a 6-month grace period on paying property tax."    Web archived link 2:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051441/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23U
notes_C3: The government allowed to hold concert and entertainment events from January 28. However, the halls can only be 50% full, and visitors must wear masks and follow social distancing.  Link: https://archive.vn/2isaA
notes_C6: No curfew right now across the country.   Link:  https://archive.vn/5bc9e
notes_C8: Arriving passengers must complete a health screening form upon arrival.  Arriving passengers who do not have a negative PCR test prior to travel will be subject to a rapid screening test at the airport. Passengers with positive results will be required to go to a quarantine facility.    http://web.archive.org/web/web/20210425162638/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: The UK Embassy states that hotels, motels, and guest houses have reopened (but are subject to special health and safety rules) following the easing of restrictive measures. From 15 August, all shopping malls, clothing markets, restaurants, cafes, beauty salons, and larger shops, as well as gyms, swimming pools, private kindergartens, and education centers have reopened.  Link: https://archive.vn/hMl5w
notes_C4: Gatherings for more than 30 people are banned.   Link: https://archive.vn/phTyw
notes_H3: Evidence on active contact-tracing was conducted earlier on in 2020, although it is still being done, there is little evidence to show it is as robust as before. The website of the Ministry of Health includes a section where the population can conduct a test to assess their need for testing." Link (4):  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329044417/https://www.euro.who.int/en/countries/uzbekistan/news/news/2020/9/uzbekistans-covid-19-response-focuses-on-core-public-health-measures-and-community-resilience
notes_E1: On 21 January, the law "On employment of the population" came into force. Accordingly, citizens who lost their jobs in the past 12 months are paid unemployment benefits in the amount of 50 percent of the average monthly wage.   Links: https://archive.vn/AOl4u https://archive.vn/0rGtQ
notes_H8: No changes found.  ________________________________  Quote (1):  "Persons aged over 65 are recommended to remain in self-isolation and not to visit public spaces." notes_C1: From 11 January, schools and universities are open across the country. The government requires schools and universities to provide health protection to students. Moreover, the government allows continuing online learning for those students who belong to risk groups and have chronic diseases.  Links: https://archive.vn/D52gP https://archive.vn/IgGjB https://archive.vn/9l68x
notes_H7: Vaccines: Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  Uzbekistan government have approved vaccines and started vaccinations as of April 1st according to latest update. The first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine have been received on March 17th with the aim to provide initial doses to individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel as per the update,  "Has the government of Uzbekistan approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? Yes  Are vaccines available in Uzbekistan for U. S. citizens to receive?  Yes, although supplies are still very limited.  Which vaccines are available in Uzbekistan?  Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  According to Uzbek health authorities, the government’s initial vaccination campaign against COVID-19 began on April 1 with the first residents of Tashkent and regional capitals getting their shots.  The Health Ministry said on Telegram that people in district capitals and smaller settlements will start getting vaccinated on May 1, while vaccine doses will arrive in more remote areas in June.  The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used.  The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel."    Archived article   http://web.archive.org/web/20210409031018/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    A latest update also reported that the government started mass vaccination as per news, "An official statement says that "3,138 vaccination centers and 862 mobile medical brigades have been set up across the country for the vaccination campaign...[and] more than 4,000 doctors and more than 11,000 nurses are involved in the vaccination program."    Also, "The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used to guard against COVID-19 among the country's 32 million people.    The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, teachers of schools and kindergartens, and law enforcement and military personnel."  Archived Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210410190425/https://www.rferl.org/a/uzbekistan-mass-vaccination-covid-19/31181553.html  _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    As per update, these vaccinations are conducted free of charge as per news, "Vaccination plan has been developed for the immunization of the country’s population, according to which 4.1 million people will be vaccinated in the first stage: people over 65 years old, medical workers, people with chronic diseases, teachers, kindergarten employees, law enforcement agencies. They will be vaccinated in state institutions and free of charge."    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210411215518/https://www.asinta.com/news/uzbekistan-covid-19-employer-resources/
notes_C5: From 15 August onwards, public transport including buses, minibuses and metro reopens. Passengers are required to wear mask and ensure social distancing. See government telegram channel, https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083526/https://t.me/s/koronavirusinfouz/5657 AND news agency Gazeta article, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083701/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/14/public-transport/

name: Venezuela
notes_H1: Stablishment of a national committee for corona, and public campaign to raise awareness https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oq0b_OzXV7w
notes_H2: The "Guideline for management and treatment of Covid-19 patients and contacts" (24/4/20) states that PCR tests should be performed on: suspect cases, patients before hospital/quarantine discharge, a/symptomatic contacts of confirmed cases, people who enter the country and probable cases (See page 3). Priority should be given to severe cases, people with comorbidities, pregnant women and healthcare workers (See page 4).    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yrv5ec-LAdelzvTIf1RIhstTIduxEp3C/view  See "ESQUEMA TERAPÉUTICO ESPECÍFICO PARA TRATAMIENTO DE PACIENTE" in https://web.archive.org/web/20200406095426/http://www.mpps.gob.ve/index.php/sistemas/descargas

notes_H6: “People have been instructed to wear face covering at all times when outside.” “Travel in Venezuela…The use of face covering is mandatory at all times, including when travelling via land in private vehicles.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201102203502/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus
notes_E2: From March 22 and during the following six months banks must put the collection of credit payments on hold, telecommunications services would not be cut off, and rent payments for homes and businesses would be suspended (...) The government also announced that they will assume the payment of payrolls for small and medium-sized companies for six months. Also, those that are “paying a mortgage will have the possibility to stop paying the installments to the bank, but the bank must assume how to modify and adapt the debt.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504192146/https://www.elnacional.com/economia/medidas-economicas-populistas-anunciadas-por-maduro-podrian-enterrar-al-sector-privado/

notes_E1: The President of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, made on Tuesday, April 6, a series of advertisements to support the population, including workers of private and self-employed companies, and to encourage the creation and strengthening of micro-enterprises in the face of the second wave of Covid-19, the product of the presence in the country of the P.1 and P.2 variants of the coronavirus.    Income support measures include:  *The "Stay at Home" bonus for solidarity support for workers from private companies will be resumed from this week. name: United States Virgin Islands
notes_H1: From March 13, Governor Bryan declares a state of emergency and established coordinated public campaign reflected through a timeline.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200730103133/https://www.vi.gov/usvi-covid-19-timeline/

notes_H6: Masks are required in all public places where distancing is not possible.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121235059/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-10/2020-09.30%2018th%20Supplemental%20Exec_%20Order--fully%20signed.pdf

Later in the Safer at home and Open Doors phase, the government allows these events to take place but participants (less than 50 people) must maintain 6 feet apart and wear masks. - Stay at home:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141201/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020-03.23-12-54pm-Order-Suppl-Exec-Order-re-Restrictions-to-Movement-Gatherings-Operations-of-Business-Govt.-and-Schools-.pdf - Safer at home:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141325/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6th-Supplemental-Exececutive-Order-COVID-19.pdf - Open doors:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141731/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/8th-Supplemental-Exec-Order.pdf - Summary of 3 phases:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141833/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/
notes_C6: “As a community, we are trying to find a new normal. Our success in this endeavor is dependent on our willingness to adhere to the health guidelines and restrictions,” the Governor said. “Although we are now in week three of the moratorium on leisure guests, the virus is still being transmitted through person-to-person contact. This continues to be the most prevalent mode of transmission for the virus. We must all commit to doing our part to keep each other safe.”     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014181944/https://www.vi.gov/governor-bryan-moves-territory-to-safer-at-home-status/
notes_C8: All travelers age 5 or older are required to use the USVI Travel Screening Portal and submit a negative test prior to traveling  to the US Virgin Islands. Travelers who have received a Covid-19 vaccine are also required to complete screening prior to travel. Upon arrival in the US Virgin Islands, travelers are subject to a screening procedure, including a temperature scan or Covid-19 testing/re-testing.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425114358/https://usviupdate.com/
notes_C2: Non-essential businesses open, bars closed  Restaurants open with restrictions: open for indoor dining of 6 persons per table; no bar seating    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323133315/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/
notes_C4: No gathering greater than 50, facial coverings and social distancing required. Restrictions on religious gatherings were eased in advance of Easter and going forward churches can have gatherings of up to 200 people or 50 percent of their capacity, whichever is less.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112112/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210425112632/https://www.vi.gov/covid/news-post/governor-bryan-eases-seating-capacity-restrictions-for-houses-of-worship/
notes_H3: The specific testing benchmark beyond 2% will likely vary considerably by state and dependent upon local disease burdens. The Harvard Global Health Institute has suggested two methods to assess whether testing is adequate. Their benchmark is based on how much testing would be needed for a state to test all infected people and contacts that at predicted burdens. A testing capacity to test all symptomatic people and their close contacts (contact-tracing) is critical to prevent epidemic transmission. The second benchmark that the Harvard Global Health Institute suggests is that communities that demonstrate positivity rates (total positives/total tests) of 10% or lower are likely testing adequately.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014190157/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-05/Lab%20Faqs.pdf
notes_E1: $300 of benefits available to those unemployed 'through no fault of their own' through the Lost Wage Assistance (LWA) scheme.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323135225/https://www.vidol.gov/unemployment-insurance/

notes_E2: According to IMF, the SBV has issued guidelines to commercial banks to reschedule loans, reduce/exempt interest, and provide loan forbearance.   Newly approved measures include deferring excise tax on domestically produced cars, lowering land rental, cutting or exempting various fees and charges, cutting CIT rate for small and micro firms, and raising PIT deduction.  Financial institutions are also exempting and reducing fees. Affected firms are eligible to concessional loans from Vietnam Social Policy Bank (VSPB) with no interest for making salary payment to their workers who temporarily stopped working.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200723164138/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

January 24: Manh Bridge Tea Room, Lich Son Cam Ly, Luc Nam, Bac Giang  WHAT TO DO:  - Contact the nearest health authorities immediately for support advice;  - Call the hotline to provide the phone number of people who have been in close contact with him  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201220112/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/vi/web/guest/-/6851640-10
notes_E1: No evidence that the cash transfer program remains in place. The source quoted previously only mentions data for 2020 and not 2021. The Ministry of Finance does also not have any information on income support.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426125901/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210426125919/https://www.mof.gov.vn/webcenter/portal/mof/r/m/ttsk/prere/prere_chitiet?showFooter=false&showHeader=false&dDocName=MOFUCM199557&_afrLoop=897454579929625
notes_H8: Jan 14, 2021: "The UN Population Fund (UNFPA) handed over COVID-19 personal protective equipment meant to support the elderly to the Social Protection Department under the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs in Hanoi on January 14. The supplies include gloves, face masks, anti-droplet face shields, thermometers, and hand sanitizer worth 30,000 USD.    They will be distributed to social protection centers and community caregivers in high-risk cities and provinces, namely Hanoi, Hai Duong, Da Nang and Quang Nam.    At the handover ceremony, UNFPA Representative in Vietnam Naomi Kitahara said the COVID-19 pandemic is amplifying the vulnerability of the elderly, and that the fatality rate for older people is higher, and for those above the age of 80, it is five times higher than the global average. Therefore, elderly people must be a priority in dealing with COVID-19 to ensure no one is left behind in humanitarian response as well as in development efforts, she added."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215195932/https://en.vietnamplus.vn/unfpa-offers-aid-to-support-the-elderly-amid-covid19/194771.vnp
notes_C1: "Schools in Ho Chi Minh City resumed on March 1 following a month-long break to prevent the spread of the pandemic."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301055144/https://www.vietnam-briefing.com/news/vietnam-business-operations-and-the-coronavirus-updates.html/      "Students from kindergarten to high school levels would return to school on March 2, while those from vocational schools would return on March 8. University student schedules would be determined by the schools themselves, though the National Steering Committee for Covid-19 Prevention and Control recommended they reopen starting March 15 to ensure social distancing measures, the municipal People’s Committee said Saturday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301053353/https://vietreader.com/life/34925-students-in-hanoi-will-be-back-to-school-next-week-as-covid-under-control.html
notes_H7: A, C but also includes residents in outbreak areas hence have coded it as 3G.    Vaccine being administered is Oxford/AstraZeneca and Sputnik V.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210426124039/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: It has been over 21 days, so the suspension of public and passenger transport schools in Quang Ninh and Hai Duong is no longer in affect.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210201165815/https://vietnamnet.vn/en/society/pm-orders-residents-in-hai-duong-quang-ninh-not-to-leave-localities-709115.html

name: Yemen
notes_H1: "The Ministry of Public Health and Population announces the state of comprehensive health mobilization for doctors, health personnel, technicians, and preventive quarantine experts, in preparation for facing the Coronavirus." (Translated from Arabic)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200510135933/http://www.moh.gov.ye/news_details.aspx?id=2264
notes_H2: Authorities in Aden setup a new specialized field hospital in Al Mualla district for patients with fever. On 04 October 2020, a COVID-19 examination unit opened at the isolation center in Ataq, Shabwah Governorate. Fifteen sea border points and three land border points are partially open for movements. There have been ten transit points for public movement between southern and northern governorates. Since the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak, the Yemeni authorities have put additional preventive measures and health screenings for people passing through these transit points, specifically at points located in Taizz and Al-Bayda. For Yemeni returnees from KSA through the Al’Wadeeah border entry point, carrying a COVID PCR test report is mandatory by the Yemeni authorities. Authorities at Al’Wadeeah entry point have established and installed a PCR testing facility at the entry point for travelers who arrive without a PCR test report.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155117/https://displacement.iom.int/yemen
notes_C7: in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19. These measures include the adoption of restrictions on movement countrywide.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155916/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/covid-19-movement-restrictions-yemen-mobility-restriction-dashboard-14-21-october-2020
notes_H6: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19.  But there is a lack of PPE means it not generally followed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029163154/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/yemeni-women-take-lead-fight-against-covid-19
notes_C3: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv
notes_C6: Curfews are in effect in Marib governorate from nine in the evening until six in the morning.  https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/20201230_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20%2319.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118220329/https://dtm.iom.int/reports/yemen-covid-19-mobility-restrictions-30-dec-2020
notes_C8: Al Wadeeah border entry point returned to its normal position, open to travelers travelling between Yemen and Saudi Arabia, after a two week closure from 20 December 2020 to 8 January 2021.  /web/20210308221347/https://displacement.iom.int/system/tdf/reports/20210210_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20_N21.pdf?file=1&type=node&id=10766
notes_C2: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv
notes_H8: Carrying over C6 indicator which has been coded as 2T due to a curfew in effect in the Marib governorate.   https://archive.vn/52MNi
notes_C1: Schools are reported as fully open (in policy) on UNESCO tracker; confirmed in independent media reports. Public health prevention measures in place (e.g. hand washing). However, in practice armed conflict has also forced some school closures as reported in media, regardless of stated COVID-19 school closure policy.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001741/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse    http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001546/https://www.unicef.org/yemen/stories/schools-reopen-yemen-after-months-closure-due-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026164301/https://www.middleeasteye.net/fr/news/classrooms-rebel-held-yemen-shuttered-first-day-school-799916572
notes_H7: Vaccination campaign began on 20 April: A (key workers), B (Clinically vulnerable), C (elderly); AstraZeneca being administered.   "Yemen's COVID-19 vaccination campaign began in government-held areas on Tuesday three weeks after the first shipment from the global COVAX vaccine-sharing scheme arrived in the war-torn country...Yemen on March 31 received 360,000 doses of AstraZeneca's (AZN.L) vaccine...Duamelle said frontline workers, the elderly and those with certain health problems would be prioritised...The government's health ministry has previously said the COVAX vaccines will be free."  https://archive.vn/PIkSN  https://archive.vn/YbfDb

name: South Africa
notes_H1: 5 March 2020 - South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has warned that the coronavirus will turn into a "national crisis" and its impact will be "huge".  His warning came after the first case of the coronavirus was detected in South Africa.     https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-51752974     https://www.gov.za/Coronavirus
notes_H2: The National Institute of Communicable Diseases (NICD) recommends that you should only get tested if you display symptoms plus:  Been in contact with a confirmed COVID-19 person;  Travelled to a high risk country;  Worked in or been to a healthcare facility treating people with Covid-19;  Have a severe case of pneumonia with an unknown cause.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503103825/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/faqs/
notes_C7: Movement Restrictions:  Is a curfew in place?   Yes  Under Alert Level 3, the curfew will apply from 2100 until 0600 daily.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No  https://web.archive.org/web/20210114090801/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H6: Facial coverings required in all public places. This is a change from previous coding, but policy has not changed — the way this is coded is in line with the coding interpretation guide.     Adjusted Alert Level 3 in place until 15 February (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201183707/https://twitter.com/PresidencyZA/status/1348697788679397377/photo/1), see government website for guidance on alert level 3 (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201185402/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/alert-level-3-during-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown).
notes_E2: The government has put in place a loan guarantee scheme for companies below a certain turnover. The government also announced measures for relief for borrowers from banks  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608210933/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Since 1 March 2021 (Level 1 Alert) All  (i) faith-based, religious gatherings; and  (ii) social, political and cultural gatherings,  are permitted but limited to 250 persons or less for indoor venues and 500 persons or less for outdoor venues and if the venue is too small to hold the prescribed number of persons observing a distance of at least one and a half metres from each other, then not more than 50 percent of the capacity of the venue may be used, subject to strict adherence to all health protocols and social distancing measures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503094045/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/coronavirus-covid-19-alert-level-1
notes_C6: On July 12th, amidst rising COVID cases, President Cyril Ramaphosa announced that the country would remain at level 3 lockdown but would reinstate nightime curfews.     Source  https://web.archive.org/web/20200713161631/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-safrica/south-africa-reimposes-alcohol-ban-curfew-as-coronavirus-cases-spike-idUSKCN24D0QU
notes_C8: Effective 2-15-20221 20 land borders will reopen on Monday, says Motsoaledi. Valid negative Covid 19 test required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215191542/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/south-africa-reopen-20-land-border-crossings-next-week
notes_C2: Adjusted alert level 1 is in place from 1 March 2021. All persons who are able to work from home must do so. However. persons will be permitted to perform any type of work outside the home. and to travel to and from work and for work purposes under Alert Level 1, subject to-  (a) strict compliance with health protocols and social distancing measures.  (b) the return to work being phased -in in order to put in place measures to make the workplace COVID-19 ready;  (c) the return to work being done in a manner that avoids and reduces risks of infection; and  (d) the work not being listed under the specific economic exclusions in this Table.    SPECIFIC EXCLUSIONS  1. NIght vigils  2. After-funeral gatherings including "after-tears" gatherings..  3. Night clubs.  4. The land borders that remain closed, excluding the land borders contemplated in regulation 78(1).  5. Passenger ships for international leisure purposes, excluding small crafts, in line with health and border law enforcement.  6. Attendance of any sporting event by spectators.  7. Exclusions relating to public transport services as set out in the directions issued by the Cabinet member responsible for transport.  8. Exclusions relating to education services as set out in the directions issued by the Cabinet members responsible for education.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210503094045/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/coronavirus-covid-19-alert-level-1
notes_C4: In Level 1 Alert (since 1 March 2021), all  (i) faith-based, religious gatherings; and  (ii) social, political and cultural gatherings,  are permitted but limited to 250 persons or less for indoor venues and 500 persons or less for outdoor venues and if the venue is too small to hold the prescribed number of persons observing a distance of at least one and a half metres from each other, then not more than 50 percent of the capacity of the venue may be used, subject to strict adherence to all health protocols and social distancing measures.  (b) Persons attending faith-based or religious gatherings are not permitted to-  (I) sleep-over, after a service, at the place of worship; and  (ii) gather outside of the designated places of worship.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503094045/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/coronavirus-covid-19-alert-level-1
notes_H3: 7th March- tracing of all members of a group of 10 from Italy from which one tested positive.  The public must be notified that we have information and know the whereabouts of all the other 10 people who were part of the group that had travelled to Italy. All those who came back to South Africa, are currently being tested. We are now awaiting their test results to come out. Since being traced, they have remained in isolation to avoid any further contact with third parties.  	https://web.archive.org/web/20200406162441/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/2020/03/07/confirmation-of-second-case-of-covid-19-in-south-africa/
notes_E1: President Cyril Ramaphosa has announced that government will direct R50 billion towards grants, in which child grant recipients will receive R300 in May and R500 in June. https://web.archive.org/save/https://ewn.co.za/2020/04/21/watch-live-ramaphosa-says-r50bn-allocated-towards-grant-recepeints  South African President Cyril Ramaphosa announced a 500 billion rand ($26.3 billion USD) rescue package, equivalent to 10% of the GDP of Africa’s most industrialised nation, to try to cushion the economic blow of the coronavirus pandemic.  The package will target large increases in existing welfare grants, funds for protecting jobs.   Additionally, 200 billion rand ($10 billion USD) in loan guarantees in partnership with the central bank of South Africa, finance ministry and commercial banks, and tax deferral for firms with more than 100 million rand turnover.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200501072953/https://www.ft.com/content/e07b70bd-71ae-4b8a-9855-09665330fed9     He is addressing the nation on Tuesday night on additional economic and social relief measures that form part of the national response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.    All the other recipients will receive R260 extra for the next six months    The unemployed, with no source of income, will receive a monthly stipend of R350 for the next six months.    Ramaphosa said Sassa will be distributing food through the provision of vouchers for the vulnerable for the poor.
notes_H8: Every person is confined to his or her place of residence from 00H00 until 04H00 daily  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503094045/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/coronavirus-covid-19-alert-level-1
notes_C1: According to UNESCO and SA's government website, on academic break until 3 May: https://web.archive.org/web/20210503093940/https://www.gov.za/about-sa/school-calendar  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503094100/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H7: A,C: All health care workers, including traditional healers, and all citizens 60 years and above to register on the EVDS for vaccines  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503104926/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/vaccine-updates/
notes_C5: Per US embassy, Public rail, minibus taxi, and bus services have resumed at reduced levels subject to social distancing and mandatory use of face masks for passengers and drivers.  Minibus taxis and buses must reduce their maximum licensed passenger seating capacity to 70% a vehicle, e-hailing services that are licensed to carry up to four passengers are limited to carrying 50% of their permissible passenger carrying capacity.  Transport services are required to provide adequate sanitizers for washing of hands of all passengers.  Operators must ensure that their vehicles are sanitised before picking up and after dropping off passengers.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201129221233/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Zambia
notes_H1: Zambia’s Ministry of Health (MoH) has implemented several measures as of Friday, February 21, to prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) into the country. notes_H2: Testing is available for symptomatic individuals and travelers.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210502161405/https://s3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com/bot-bkt/prod/30914/30914-How%20to%20get%20Tested.png    https://web.archive.org/web/20210502151943/https://zm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

notes_C2: Places have reopened  https://archive.vn/WVdgz#selection-715.0-715.26

notes_C1: Schools re-opened on Feb 1'st  https://archive.vn/UDqn4  Though some schools might not reopen until Feb 13'th - The President has since directed the Minister of Education and the Minister of Higher Education, in conjunction with other sectors, such as the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Local Government, to be “on top of things” and ensure all schools are ready for re-opening on Monday, 13? February 2021, as the resumption of learning will depend on how ready each learning institution is. - https://archive.vn/qoe3X#selection-1409.0-1409.388
notes_H7: A:  AstraZeneca  Zambia received the first doses of the vaccine on April 12. Vaccine roll-out began on April 14. Health care workers will be the first group to receive the vaccine.  "Government has resolved that the COVID - 19 Vaccination Programme will be implemented in a cautious and phased up manner, and on a pilot and voluntary basis,"  We will begin with our frontline health care workers, in both public and private health facilities. I am, therefore, very delighted to join our gallant health care workers here at the University Teaching Hospitals as we kick-start this roll-out today. Other frontline workers performing core societal functions including, but not limited to, the police, defense and security personnel, immigration officers, teachers, judiciary staff, traditional leaders, the clergy and the media will follow, "" Dr Chanda said."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419031607/https://reliefweb.int/report/zambia/zambia-launches-covid-19-vaccination    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419031410/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fmohzambia%2Fposts%2F1884192308422084

name: Zimbabwe
notes_H1: From today (Friday), in Zimbabwe Covid-19 awareness messages will be broadcast on two national radio stations in three local languages, reaching five million people (this is sponsored by Goal Global, an NGO)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504143836/https://www.goalglobal.org/stories/irish-humanitarian-aid-agency-goal-leading-fight-against-spread-of-covid-19-in-zimbabwe/
notes_H2: Testing is widely available through several government-approved laboratories.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210222151527/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C7: Inter-city travel has resumed with bus operators required to ensure the disinfection of buses, wearing of masks and sanitisation of passengers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308201320/https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/crr7mlg0rpvt/zimbabwe
notes_H6: Everyone in a public place must observe social distancing (i.e. keep at least one metre apart) and wear a face mask.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308202748/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2021/03/public-health-lock-down-order-relaxation-of-lock-down/
notes_C3: It is still the general rule that people are not allowed to assemble in public places in groups of more than two, except when allowed by the Lock-down Order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308202748/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2021/03/public-health-lock-down-order-relaxation-of-lock-down/
notes_C6: Starting 22 July, security forces will enforce a curfew between 6pm-6am local time. All non-working people will be required to stay at home, except to buy groceries and seek medical attention. Business hours will be limited to 8am to 3pm, apart from those performing essential services.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200730220048/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/07/zimbabwe-imposes-curfew-spike-coronavirus-infections-200722052647613.html
notes_C8: Zimbabwe is under Level 4 Lockdown for 30 days from the 5'th January 2021 https://archive.vn/o9ZBb  Chiwenga said air travel was still allowed, with arrivals and returning residents being required to present certificates showing themselves to be free of COVID-19   https://archive.vn/TEm3s#selection-413.0-413.162
notes_C2: With the updated lockdown rules, most workplaces have been allowed to open under strict WHO guidelines. Beerhalls, bars, nightclubs, and gyms remain closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315090029/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C4: Funeral gatherings remain restricted to 30, while other gatherings including church meetings are limited to 50 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308201320/https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/crr7mlg0rpvt/zimbabwe
notes_H3: There is no data to support information on contact tracing.
notes_E1: There is no current data to support any evidence of income relief.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308204707/https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/zimbabwe/brief/monitoring-covid-19-impact-on-households-in-zimbabwe
notes_H8: Coding in line with C6 given the national lockdown measures apply to the elderly.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210417092946/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/zimbabwe/coronavirus
notes_C1: All schools have reopened in a staggered manner as planned under health and safety guidelines. Exam classes returned on the 15th with the rest of school years returning on the 22nd.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210404103650/https://allafrica.com/stories/202103030501.html
notes_H7: Zimbabwe has moved into the second phase of its COVID-19 vaccination programme.  It’s now targeting the elderly people with chronic conditions, and essential workers like the police, army and prison employees.    In the first phase of the vaccination rollout, healthcare workers were targeted.  Sinovax and Sinopharm vaccines are being administered.  Note: The Zimbabwean government is targeting broad mass vaccination in Victoria Falls in an attempt to reopen the area to the tourism industry. This includes all adults aged between 18-65 from 29th March        http://web.archive.org/web/20210405130826/https://www.enca.com/news/zimbabwe-moves-second-phase-vaccination-programme    http://web.archive.org/web/20210331014528/https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/africa/2021-03-23-zimbabwes-entire-tourist-town-of-victoria-falls-to-get-covid-19-vaccination/
notes_C5: Both the US and US embassies have removed previous specifications on restrictions placed on public transport so public transport now appears to be operating without any closures or restrictions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210424114816/https://zw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210424114313/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/zimbabwe

name: Taiwan
notes_H1: Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) is activated to serve as a coordinator of all epidemic responses and update the public about COVID-19. Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20200405093236/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/Bulletin/Detail/32NPG1QXFhAmaOLjDOpNmg?typeid=9 ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200407070520/https://www.ocac.gov.tw/OCAC/Eng/Pages/Detail.aspx?nodeid=329&pid=15730946
notes_H2: "On May 23, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that it gradually eased restrictions on applicants for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) testing considering that domestic coronavirus situation is under control.  The decision allows members of the public to undergo COVID-19 testing at their own expense at designated hospitals due to emergency situations, as well as work and studying abroad requirements, and obtain documents proving they have done the testing. Members of the public who are eligible for requesting COVID-19 testing at their own expense are as follows: 1.    Those under home isolation or quarantine who need to attend a funeral of a deceased first or second degree relative or visit such relative with serious illness; 2.    Those who need to visit other countries/regions for an emergency involving their relatives overseas, including accidents or serious illness; 3. Those requesting COVID-19 testing for work; 4.  Those requesting COVID-19 testing for studying abroad; 5. Foreign nationals, mainland Chinese, Hong Kong or Macao residents requesting COVID-19 testing for departure; 6.    Family members of those listed above.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200526054841/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/zvqg0FiEVgQDWcL3ftogcA?typeid=158"
notes_H6: TAIPEI (Taiwan News) — Taiwan Health Minister and Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) head Chen Shih-chung (???) on Wednesday (Aug. 5) announced eight public settings where mask-wearing will be compulsory, in response to the country's increased coronavirus cases over the last few weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201012161730/https://www.taiwannews.com.tw/en/news/3981125
notes_E2: The Bank of Taiwan (BOT) has made financial assistance measures available to loan clients who are experiencing payment difficulties due to coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Until June 30, BOT's existing borrowers who have previously repaid principal and interest on schedule can apply for up to a six-month principal repayment extension. Borrowers must submit documents showing suffering and economic impact from COVID-19, such as proof of revenue decline, non-voluntary unemployment, or leave without pay. Borrowers must continue paying monthly interest during the extension period.  Loan Extension: Companies or individuals can apply to defer principal repayment or extend loan. Credit card payment deferral at public banks: Individuals can apply to defer card payment without penalty and interest.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200722174919/https://www.mof.gov.tw/eng/singlehtml/f48d641f159a4866b1d31c0916fbcc71?cntId=4ea6929857b04241aa6df34003fd9c25  https://web.archive.org/web/20200722174815/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/taiwan-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: Taiwan Lantern Festival was cancelled. Premier Su urged local governments to cancel or delay large public events to minimize the risk of contracting and spreading COVID-19.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210221081133/https://www.ey.gov.tw/Page/9277F759E41CCD91/d0b58e08-1850-4d28-9b36-99b123e5ea72  https://archive.vn/DIWmM  https://archive.vn/n41cn
notes_C8: http://archive.is/kNP0H  Taiwan Centers for Disease Control  “From June 22, short-term business travelers are allowed entry and can apply for shortened home quarantine period”
notes_H3: Taiwan centers for disease control  https://web.archive.org/web/20200414072715/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/File/Get/LO4IJGwYKrJ5urP3CQeLbw  On January 23, 2020, level 2 of the CECC was established due to the fact that the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed on January 21, 2020.  3. Surveillance and Laboratory Diagnosis: (1)We began to identify people who developed fever, cough or other acute respiratory symptoms and who had a past 14-day travel history or close  contact with the above mentioned people. They are all required to report to the health authorities and provide a lab specimen for further laboratory diagnosis. (2)When a person seeks medical attention using his or her National Health Insurance (NHI) card, the person’s travel history to areas affected by COVID-19 will display on the system because immigration data is linked to the National Health Insurance Administration. This system helps remind a physician to pay attention to past 14-day travel history and inquire and examine the person accordingly. This can effectively prevent failing to detect a potential case.(3)Since February 16, 2020, we have enhanced COVID-19 case finding by proactively seeking out patients with severe respiratory symptoms who had tested negative for influenza and retested them for COVID-19. In addition, patients who are highly suspected as COVID-19 infection by the physicians as well as medical staff with pneumonia or cluster are also subject to provide specimens for further laboratory diagnosis. (4)In order to have specimens tested quickly, we have improved our laboratory diagnosis capacities from 12 laboratories for 520 cases per day to 34 laboratories for 3,200 cases per day.
notes_E1: Starting from 21 April, companies suffering a 50% reduction in income when compared to the same period over the past two years qualify to apply for salary subsidies.   The government will subsidise 40% of wages of an employee up to a limit of NT$20,000 per month for three months.  Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20200511214349/https://thetaiwantimes.com/taiwans-unheralded-covid-19-financial-response/2587 ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200425120520/https://udn.com/news/story/120974/4508657
notes_H8: People returning to Taiwan from overseas must quarantine in hotels rather than their own homes if there is at least one person aged 65 or above live at home.    https://archive.vn/fG4tW
notes_C1: Strict policies of Covid prevention in schools has since been relaxed, with no recent school closures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201218101936/https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Category/Page/0vq8rsAob_9HCi5GQ5jH1Q
notes_H7: Taiwan 'announced that the government-funded COVID-19 vaccine would be available to ... essential personnel who maintain the normal functions of society such as police and military police officers, and staff and people receiving care at long-term care institutions, social welfare institutions and in the social welfare system on April 23, 2021.'  This means group [C], the elder groups, also started to receive vaccines.    https://archive.vn/aMuaN

name: Kosovo
notes_H1: the public campaign website can't be accessed for several weeks  https://kosova.health/
notes_H2: Testing available at the main public hospital (free) plus at private clinics (for a charge)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210416072551/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/
notes_C7: No restrictions on internal movement.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210416072551/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/
notes_H6: Unable to find sources to confirm date detailed below so have coded from July 5:    The government of Kosovo made wearing mask mandatory on July 5 in order to slow the spread of COVID-19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015100253/https://euronews.al/en/kosovo/2020/07/31/thousands-fined-in-kosovo-for-not-wearing-mandatory-face-mask    A summary from the United Nations Kosovo Team says that measures coming into force on July 13:    ' Masks are mandatory in all activities outside of the apartments and houses, for all individuals'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201015100616/https://unkt.org/2020/07/16/recap-ministry-healths-governemnt-measures-entering-force-13-july-2020/
notes_E2: Quote: "? Lease subsidies  Further financial support is available for lessors in the  form of a lease subsidy of up to (50%) of the value of  the lease for small and medium-sized enterprises, for  April and May. Total value: €12million.  The lessee, after completing and uploading the form  through the EDI electronic system, no later than 15  May 2020, must prove that the lease contract was  concluded before 1 March 2020. They must prove  that their activity has been negatively affected by the  emergency situation.  In order to receive a subsidy of up to 50% for the  payment of rent, the lessor must have a bank account  in one of the commercial banks of Kosovo.  For this measure, the tenants who have prepaid  annual rent will not benefit, only those who have the  obligation of unpaid rent for two months from the  beginning of the pandemic."  Link: https://assets.ey.com/content/dam/ey-sites/ey-com/en_al/generic-content/pdf/ey-government-support-package-albania-and-kosovo.pdf  Property tax  Pursuant to Kosovo Law on the Tax on  Property (essentially taxing  companies/individuals based on  properties held), a decision has been  issued on the postponement of  issuance of property tax bills, including  the postponement of payment of first  installment for 2020 and  postponement of deadline for filing of  complaints on property tax bills and  certificates of assessed values.  Customs duties and VAT  All production business entities  registered in Kosovo (or their  contractors), who deal with the import  of raw materials, including wheat and  flour, for the production of bread and  bread products are exempt from  customs duties and VAT on these  supplies. The impact of these  measures on the businesses should be  considered on a case by case basis.  Business tax  The deadline for filing tax returns,  reports and payments, as well as  handling and adjudicating claims for  refunds related to the implementation  of applicable tax legislation, has been  extended from 31 March 2020 until  30 April 2020.
notes_C3: (Order 18)  All gatherings with high risk of spreading the infection, more than 30 people (meetings, seminars, trainings) are prohibited. Regardless of the number of persons, holding a reception / consolation reception and organizing weddings is prohibited.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210422143703/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Vendimet-e-Mbledhjes-se-7-te-te-Qeverise-se-Republikes-se-Kosoves.pdf
notes_C6: From April 7 to April 18, freedom of movement will also be restricted from 22:00 to 05:00, except in cases of urgent nature and those with special permits.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412192444/https://kryeministri-ks.net/kryeministri-kurti-dhe-ministri-vitia-prezantuan-masat-e-reja-kunder-covid-19/
notes_C8: Arrivals must either have a current negative test (<72 hours old). Arrivals without a negative test must go into quarantine for 7 days      https://web.archive.org/web/20201122110254/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_C2: After the lockdown from 7-18 April, the restaurants and leisure facilities, shopping malls and gyms will be allowed to reopen. All employees, with the exception of systemically important employees, are still obliged to work from home. However, the number of people allowed to attend meetings such as seminars, meetings or training sessions has been increased from 10 to 30.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210427103008/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_C4: (Order 18,20)  All gatherings with high risk of spreading the infection, more than 30 people (meetings, seminars, trainings) are prohibited. Regardless of the number of persons, holding a reception / consolation reception and organizing weddings is prohibited.    Funerals are allowed only with the participation of close family, not more than 30 people.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210422143703/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Vendimet-e-Mbledhjes-se-7-te-te-Qeverise-se-Republikes-se-Kosoves.pdf
notes_H3: I couldn't find any convincing evidence of comprehensive tracing.    The effectiveness and level of enforcement of the project below is unknown.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210323014137/https://ghpp.de/en/projects/getprepared/training-series-for-contact-tracing-teams-in-the-context-of-the-covid-19-pandemic/
notes_E1: Quote: "Salary compensation  Financial support to companies in financial distress as  a result of their decline in activity due to a public  health emergency situation, as follows:  • Coverage of monthly salaries of employees in the  amount of €170 per employee, for April and May.  Total value: €41million;  In order to benefit from this measure, the following  criteria must be met:  — The employer, through the electronic EDI system,  must complete and upload the form and list  designed by TAK (Tax Authorities of Kosovo), no  later than 15 May 2020.  — The employer must prove that their activity was  negatively affected directly or indirectly by the  health emergency situation with the decisions of  the Government of Kosovo to prevent the spread  of the virus, proving financial difficulties through  the cash book, bank balance sheet and other  similar evidence.  — The employee can only benefit from this scheme  from their primary employer if they have more  than one employer, for the period to February  2020."  Link: https://assets.ey.com/content/dam/ey-sites/ey-com/en_al/generic-content/pdf/ey-government-support-package-albania-and-kosovo.pdf
notes_H8: The following restriction on elderly and vulnerable populations was introduced:  Older citizens (over the age of 65 years) and citizens with chronic diseases (diabetes, hypertension and heart disease, chronic lung disease, patients with kidney disease, patients with suppressed immunity, oncology patients, etc.) can go out in public only in the early morning hours (from 05:00 to 10:00) and in the evening (from 18:00 to 21:00);  These restrictions are even stricter than the curfew guidelines for the general population, thus seek to further protections for elderly and vulnerable populations.  Additionally:  All residents of the Republic of Kosovo shall be obliged to wear face masks in all activities outside their homes/apartments, as well as to maintain a physical distance of 2m in joint areas outside their homes/apartments (employers shall be obliged to create conditions for this distance to be applied in work environments); All public and private institutions shall be obliged to possess hand sanitizers and face masks in accessible places, at the entrance of the building, which can be used by the employees of the institutions and visitors; It is forbidden to gather citizens more than 5 people in public squares, parks and the like.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329203727/https://kryeministri-ks.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ENG-Vendimet-13.docx
notes_C1: Schools are online only until 18 April.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412191748/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/    public and private institutions of pre-university education will organize all teaching activities from April 12 to April 18 will continue online because for pre-university education we are just on vacation. (This translation does not make sense, so I'm not sure what this exactly means)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412192444/https://kryeministri-ks.net/kryeministri-kurti-dhe-ministri-vitia-prezantuan-masat-e-reja-kunder-covid-19/
notes_H7: Which vaccines are available in Kosovo? Astra Zeneca.   At this time the vaccine is limited to health care workers, police, Kosovo Security Forces and those over 80 years of age.  (A,C)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412191748/https://xk.usembassy.gov/coronavirus/    Kosovo which is the last country in Europe to start its vaccination rollout, and says it will start inoculating medical personnel, elderly citizens people, and those with chronic diseases.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412215258/https://www.euronews.com/2021/03/29/kosovo-receives-first-covid-19-vaccines-through-covax-programme
notes_C5: As of 29 July, Public transportation is now required to operate at half capacity to enable riders to follow social distancing guidelines while traveling. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200809121054/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Kosovo.pdf
